loans.name: Cell 8 Nanyonjo Jane Group

texts.en:
N. Jane is forty-one years old and is the single mother of five children who are working. She is also looking after four dependents who are schooling.

Jane deals in used clothes, that is: dresses, skirts, blouses, etc., and has so far been five years in her business. She is using the loan to purchase more used clothes to sell to her customers. Her beliefs with the loan are that her standard of living will improve and that she will manage to take care of her family.

Jane is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to prosper and upgrade to selling new clothes instead of used clothes.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Raema Group

texts.en:
Raema is the group leader of Raema group. There are four members in this group and each of them wants to take a loan for expanding their business to make it larger.

Raema wants to take a loan for her bakery business.

Hateka wants to take a loan for her husband who has a general store.

Razei wants to take a loan for her carpet-weaving business.

Karema wants to take a loan for her husband who has a carpentry shop.

So they are requesting a group loan of 42,000 Afghani and they are very thankful to AFS and Kiva lenders who are able to support all the poor people.

loans.use: To expand her bakery business

loans.name: Lai

texts.en:
Mrs. Lai K., 37, and her husband, Mr. Chun Nhem, 41, were married in 1985 and have five children: three daughters and two sons. Two of their daughters are garment factory workers, one son is a construction worker and the other children attend school. The family lives along National Road Number Five about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Mr. Chun Nhem used to be a fisherman, but he stopped the business for a while and started a new business as a construction contractor, while Mrs. Lai K. stopped her fish selling business and she hopes to run new business as well. Lai is requesting a loan of $500 in order to buy wooden materials to repair the wall of the house.

loans.use: To buy wooden materials to repair the wall of her house.

loans.name: Ayoka

texts.en: Ayoka lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells cooked foods and bread. She has been in this business since the year 1979. Ayoka is 50 years old. She is very determined to expand her business and increase her family's standard of living. She is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and bread to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and bread

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
In the year 2001, Victoria T. became a member of ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), a MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines. She is 60 years old and married with five children. She lives in the town of Morong, Rizal Province. Most of her children are already married and separated from her.

She has a talent for sewing, and from the start of being a member of ASHI, she wisely used her loans as continuous capital in her sewing business. Now on her sixth loan, she is requesting the amount of 30,000 pesos; 24,250 of which will be used to purchase materials for sewing and the remaining amount for a secondary business (farming).

She is positive that her business will grow and she even dreams of extending her business and to hire manpower. She is looking forward to having enough profits to help sustain the school expenses of her grandchild and to be able to construct a durable house.

loans.use: Additional capital for sewing and for a secondary business (farming).

loans.name: Tdo 2 Nakimuli Annet Group

texts.en: Nakimuli A. is 24 years old, married with four children (who are in schooling) and looking after one dependent. She has been in her business of operating a salon for four years and a boutique for one year so far. She is using the loan to purchase salon items such as hair chemicals and hair treatments, and for purchasing boutique items such as various types of clothing. She is also employing some people to help her in case she is not around. Nakimuli A. is a hardworking business lady whose dream is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase salon items such as hair chemicals and hair treatments, and to purchase boutique items, such as various types of clothing

loans.name: Khanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Khanthy A., 48, and her husband, Mr. Hok Vorn, 58, live on an Island in Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They were married in 1979 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Their daughter is married and lives in the family home. One of their sons is an air-conditioner repairman, and the youngest son attends university.

Khanthy has been a silk weaver since 1980, a skill she learned from her parents. Her husband is a farmer. In addition, the couple also raises pigs. Khanthy asked for a previous loan to purchase piglets and silk materials for her weaving business. She is now requesting another loan of $500 to purchase feed for her pig raising business.

loans.use: To use for raising pigs.

loans.name: Fozia Muhammad Iftikhar Group

texts.en:
Fozia baji is a wife of M. I. who has lived in a city named Lahore, Pakistan, for the past 10 years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for Punjabi foods. She is a very lively person by nature. She never fights with anyone and keeps a smile on her face all the time. She is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighbors to earn income. Her income gives her confidence to lead an independent life. She is married to M. I. who has been an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) driver for the past 3 years. He earns 350 to 400 pak rupees per day. Fozia baji is applying for a loan to repair his auto-rickshaw because repairing it has become essential.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Safia baji and Kalsoom baji each want a loan to buy motorbikes for their bike rental businesses. Asia baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy electrical supplies (wires, switch boards and switches) for her electrical supplies selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Fozia baji is seated in the center of the baji’s and is showing her work.

loans.use: To repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Tdo 2 Nabagoza Joyce Group

texts.en: N. Joyce is aged thirty-two years old, married and blessed with four children who are all schooling. She has been operating a business selling used clothing for three years so far. She is using the loan for purchasing used clothing for sale; that is to say, various types of clothing such as skirts, dresses, blouses, shirts, trousers, etc. The loan is really adding value to her business because she is now able to buy in big volumes. N. Joyce is an encouraging business lady whose dream is to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: For purchasing used clothing for sale, such as skirts, dresses, blouses, shirts, trousers, etc.

loans.name: Ciriaca

texts.en:
Ciriaca M. is a 71-year-old woman, who is determined and optimistic to get out from poverty. She is married to Francisco who is a pensioner and they are residing at Cardona, Rizal province in the Philippines.

She joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines in 2008. Her previous loan was used as additional capital for their businesses: hog fattening and hog slaughtering. Now on her second loan, she is requesting the amount of 10,000 pesos as additional capital for hog slaughtering. This business is running well with the help of her child. They slaughter pigs and sell the pork to their neighbors within their village.

She is hopeful that with the help of ASHI, she can save more for their future since they are already old, and that her child can continue her business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets for raising and pigs for slaughtering.

loans.name: Abong

texts.en: L. is single with four children. She lives in Ntamulung quarter in Bamenda, Cameroon. L. and her entire family live in a house with eight rooms, one sitting room and a kitchen. Being a very hard working woman, L. had to overcome some challenges in life such as taking care of her children, especially as she is living in her parents house. It is not easy for her living there with other family members and children. L. runs a call centre, an embroidery business and also sells food supplements in front of their compound with the support of her children. She plans to invest this loan in her existing businesses of call centre, food supplement and embroidery. She plans to expand these businesses since she has been doing them for a number of years. This will be L.’s fourth loan from GHAPE; she has been a member since 2005. She has been quite successful in the past with her businesses due to her location (right on the main road), the quality of her products, and her reasonable prices. Also, with her experience, she is now having more customers who buy her products. Part of her profits from this loan will be used to buy a plot where she will construct a house in the future for her and the children. And another part will be used to improve her farm. L. does not foresee a problem with her loan repayments as they are quite small repayments every month. She intends to start repayment in the fourth month after taking the loan. About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy food supplements, material for embroidery and farm supplies and to pay operating costs of a call centre

loans.name: Zareena Muhammad Mubarak Group

texts.en:
Zareena baji is a wife of M. M. and they have both been citizens of Lahore, Pakistan, for the past fifteen years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods.

At her age, Zareena baji wants to set a good example for her grandchildren and for her family. In spite of her age, she keeps working on her sewing machine, sewing clothes. In this photo she is playing with her grandson and laughing. Her husband is also a very mature person and is a driver by profession. Zareena baji is requesting for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor-vehicle) because her husband is currently driving a rented one and pays half of his income to the owner. 

This group loan consists of three additional people: 

Zuhran baji wants a loan to buy a lathe.

Fozia baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw.

Mukhtaran baji wants a loan to buy tools for her motor workshop.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw for her husband

loans.name: Soklun

texts.en:
Mrs. Soklun B., 43, and her husband, Mr. Chanra Pao, 43, were married in 1989 and have one daughter who is in grade 11. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Soklun has been selling finished silk fabric for fifteen years. She buys it from silk weavers in her village for resale in Phnom Penh market. Her husband works at a government office concerning fisheries. She is applying for a loan of $1,000 to purchase more finished silk fabrics for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more finished silk fabrics for resale

loans.name: Parveen Muhammad Arif Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji is a wife of M. A. who is a driver by profession. He has had five years of experience in this profession. and can drive every type of vehicle very easily. They both are very active persons and have been citizens of Lahore, Pakistan, for the past fifteen years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods.

Parveen baji operates an embroidered-clothes business to share the financial burden of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor-vehicle) for her husband so he earns a good income as driver of his own vehicle. 

In the photo, Parveen baji is showing her embroidered dress.

This group loan consists of four additional people:

Razia baji and Parveen baji each want a loan to repair their auto-rickshaws.

Kalsoom baji wants a loan to buy vehicle wheels to sell.

Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy materials (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food-selling business.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw for her husband

loans.name: Sokunthea

texts.en:
Ms. Sokunthea S., 35, is single and has two brothers. She lives in a small village along National Road Number Two about thirteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 
 
Sokunthea has been a garment factory worker for ten years. One of her brothers has full-time employment and the other one is learning to be a locksmith. She is asking for a loan of $800 to plaster the wall of her house and to build a staircase.

loans.use: To plaster the wall of her house and to build a staircase

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey S., 42, and her husband, Mr. Bros Sao, 42, have been married since 1991 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Three of them attend school and other one is still too young. The family lives along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Srey has been a farmer for seven years. She grows wax gourds and other vegetables. Her husband has been a mason for twenty-one years. She is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to purchase construction materials to build her house and build a restroom for her family’s use.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to build her house and a restroom for her family

loans.name: Nasreen Muhammad Mushtaq Group

texts.en:
Nasreen baji has lived in Lahore, Pakistan for the past 20 years. Lahore is famous for its historical places and Punjabi food. Nasreen baji is a very active lady. She sews clothes to pay off her utilities. Her husband, M. M., has run a plastic pipe making business for over 8 years. Nasreen baji is applying for a loan to buy items (plastic beads and patterns) to advance her husband’s business.

This loan serves four other people:
 
Abida baji wants a loan to buy blankets to sell.  
Shabana baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. 
Rubina baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 
Sadaf baji wants a loan to buy items (creams, cosmetics) for her beauty shop. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Nasreen baji wears a white dress and working on a sewing machine in this photo.

loans.use: To buy material for plastic pipe making.

loans.name: Tit

texts.en:
Mr. Tit U., 60, and his wife, Mrs. Sophy Khan, 62, live in a small village across the Mekong River about thirteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1980 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home, and the other three children have full-time employment. One daughter attends school.

Tit has been a wooden-house builder for over ten years. Mrs. Sophy is a farmer; she grows cucumbers and melons in the farmland near her house. Tit is requesting a loan of $500 to pay fees for his daughter, who is learning hairdressing skills, and to raise the land around his house.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees for his daughter and to raise the land around his house

loans.name: Ghazala Liaqat Group

texts.en:
Ghazala baji, wife of L., has resided in the city of Lahore, Pakistan, for the past ten years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods.

Ghazala baji is a very active lady. She performs her duties and manages her family very effectively. Her husband runs a grocery shop in the community. People are used to coming to him for groceries because of the reasonable prices and good quality. She is requesting a loan to buy more groceries to advance her husband’s grocery shop. 

This loan consists of four additional people: 

Nasira baji wants a loan to buy plastic water bottles to sell.

Farzana baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes.

Salma baji wants a loan to buy another water-buffalo for her animal-selling business.

Shagufta baji wants a loan to buy sanitary supplies (pipes, taps) to sell.

In the photo, Ghazala baji is standing in the center of the group, showing her member Salma baji’s water-buffalo.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her husband's grocery shop

loans.name: Asapo

texts.en: E. is 38 years old and married with five children. For the past three years, she has sold frozen food such as turkey and fish. E. is requesting the loan amount of 120,000 NGN to purchase more frozen food such as chicken, turkey and fish to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen food to sell

loans.name: Akporuma

texts.en: G. is 37 years old and married with one child. Since 2008 she has had a business selling cement. G. has been borrowing from Kiva partner, LAPO, for the past five years. She is now requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more cement to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cement to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: N. Samuel is 38 years old and married with two school-aged children. Samuel is a hardworking businessman who has had a retail business in the Bingo zone for quite some time. He will use his loan to purchase retail commodities such as soap, washing Jik (bleach), cooking oil, sugar, etc. to meet customer demand. His hope for the future is that he will be able to work hard to make more profit.

loans.use: To purchase retail commodities

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en: M. Rashid is 36 years old and married with three children who are studying. He is a hardworking business man who owns a bakery shop near the Kalerwe stage. He will use his loan to purchase baking ingredients for making bread, donuts, etc. Rashid supplies bread to a number of different places, such as retail shops and so forth. His future hope is to work hard to meet customer demand, and so obtain more profits.

loans.use: To purchase baking ingredients for making bread, donuts, etc.

loans.name: James

texts.en: W. James is 48 years old and married with four school-aged children. He is a hardworking businessman who operates his business from Owino market in Kampala city. James will use his loan to purchase wholesale commodities such as beans, groundnuts, etc. to sell to his customers. He wants to deal with many more customers, and his dream is to educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase wholesale commodities such as beans, groundnuts, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es socia del Bancomunal Madres del Futuro.
María es conviviente tiene 44 años, dos hijos de 18 y 8 años, el mayor entro a la fuerzas Aéreas, y el ultimo está estudiando en la escuela estatal.
María trabajaba vendiendo en un colegio golosinas por más de cinco años, se retiro por que salió embarazada y dejo de trabajar con los ahorros compro un carro de segunda, con las ganancias compro  una moto-taxi, los cuales los da a trabajar.
Desde que María está en Finca  aprendió a desenvolverse en el negocio, a invertir  
María necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles, para pintar su carro y arreglo de motor para que pase la revisión técnica.
El sueño de María es poner un negocio de terapia física en su casa.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Madres del Futuro Community Bank. She is 44 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children aged 18 and 8. The older one is in the Air Force, and the younger one is still at school. María used to sell candy at a school for more than five years but stopped when she became pregnant. With her savings she bought a secondhand car, and then with the profit from that she bought a motor-taxi. She earns her living from these vehicles. Since María has been with Kiva partner Finca, she has learned how to run a business and how to invest her money. She needs a loan of 2600 soles to re-spray her car and fix the engine so that it will pass the motor vehicle inspection. Her dream is to open a physiotherapy business in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Re-spray her car and fix the engine

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys  es socia del Bancomunal Madres del Futuro.
Gladys es  madre soltera tiene 41 años  dos hijos de 27 y 26 años que trabajan, son independientes.
Gladys ayudaba a cocer a su mama y después de dos años se puso a estudiar  corte y confección, puso su taller de costura  en su casa, ella cose ropa para colegios y ropa  a medida, con sus ahorros se ha comprado una combi de segunda, su hijo la maneja, también vende productos de belleza por catalogo.   
Desde que Gladys esta en Finca aprendió a organizar su negocio, a ser puntual y responsable con los prestamos.
Gladys necesita un préstamo de 3400 soles, para arreglar su carro va pasar revisión técnica,  y la compra de productos de belleza. 
El sueño de Gladys es crecer en el negocio y comprar otra combi a gas.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the Communal Bank Group “Madres del Futuro” (Mothers of the Future). She is a 41 year old single mother of two children (ages 27 and 26) who work and are independent.

Gladys helped her mother as a cook and after two years studied tailoring, eventually opening a shop in her home. She makes school uniforms. Using her savings she purchased a secondhand minibus, which her son drives. She also sells beauty products by catalog.

Since joining FINCA, Gladys has learned how to organize her business. She is punctual and responsible with her loans. Gladys needs a loan of 3400 soles to fix her car so that it will pass inspection. She will also buy more beauty products. She dreams of growing her business and purchasing another gas-powered minibus.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair her vehicle so that it will pass inspection

loans.name: Casilda

texts.es:
Casilda  es socia del Bancomunal Madres del Futuro.
Casilda es casada tiene 52 años, dos hijos de 26 y 25 años que trabajan.
Casilda   estudio enfermería técnica, trabaja hasta que se caso y se dedico a cuidar sus hijos, con el tiempo puso una bodega pero la cerro porque tenía mucha competencia y se dedico a vender ropa  se fue hasta provincias a vender ropa   por cuatro años  viajaba los fines de semana, hasta que decidió quedarse a vender a qui en Lima, con los ahorros pudo comprar dos motos y dos carros y darlos en alquiler. 
Desde que Casilda esta en Finca aprendió administrar su dinero, su negocio, a tratar a los clientes.
Casilda necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para cambiar el radiador de su carro y compra de llantas.
El sueño de Casilda es poner un minimarket.
texts.en:
Casilda is a member of the communal bank “Madres del Futuro.” She is married, 52 years old, and has two children, ages 25 and 26. Both of her children have jobs. Casilda studied nursing, but stopped working after she got married to raise her children. Later on she started a small grocery store that closed because of too much competition. She then decided to sell clothing and spent four years going all the way to the provinces to sell on the weekends. She did this until she decided to stay in Lima to sell. She then bought two motorcycles and two cars with her savings and now rents them out. Casilda has learned how to manage her money, her business, and how to treat her clients since she has been a member of Finca. Casilda would love to open a minimart.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cambiar el radiador de su carro

loans.name: Roque Tito

texts.es:
Roque  es socio del Bancomunal Madres del Futuro.
Roque es conviviente tiene  47 años un hijo de tres años, que esta al cuidado de su  esposa.
Roque trabajaba en una empresa textil, se desempeñaba como mecánico textil, lamentablemente su jefe murió y el renuncio;  con la liquidación compro  un puesto y   se puso a vender en  el mercado abarrotes al por mayor y menor.  
Desde que Roque esta en Finca  aprendió administra su negocio, y dar buen uso al crédito.
Roque necesita un préstamo de  2800 soles para la compra de mercadería, sacos de arroz, azúcar, cajas de aceite, leche.
El sueño de Roque es crecer más hasta llegar a tener una tienda más.
texts.en:
Roque is a member of the communal bank “Madres del Futuro. He lives with his partner, is 47 years old, and has a three year old child that his wife cares for. Roque used to be a mechanic in a textile mill. Unfortunately, his boss died. Roque then left his job and bought a spot in the market to sell groceries with his severance pay. Roque has learned how to manage his business and use his loans wisely since he has been a member of Finca. He needs a loan of 2,800 soles to buy merchandise like: rice, sugar, oil, and milk. Roque would love to grow his business until he has another store.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de mercadería, sacos de arroz, azúcar, cajas de aceite, leche

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
Soledad  es socia del Bancomunal Madres del Futuro.
Soledad es viuda,  hace 8 años, tiene 52  años, tres hijos de 24, 20 y 17 años, que trabajan.
Soledad  se caso joven se dedico siempre a su casa y a sus hijos porque su esposo era machista no quiso que trabaje, hasta que se  murió; ella se puso a vender comida en los colegios por un año y en el verano vendía marcianos, con sus ahorros compro una congeladora, aprendió hacer pasteles con un recetario y los vende  a las tiendas, le empezaron a pedir  cada vez más, semanal reparte 10 pasteles entre budines,  pastel de  manzana. 
Desde que Soledad esta en Finca aprendió a ser independiente, a surgir por si sola.
Soledad necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de un microondas y harina 
El sueño de Soledad es poner una fuente de soda.
texts.en:
Soledad is a member of the communal bank “Madres del Futuro.” Soledad was widowed eight years ago. She is 52 years old and has three children: ages 24, 20, and 17. All of her children have jobs. Soledad got married young and took care of the house and her children because her husband was machista and didn’t want her to work. After he died, Soledad sold food in high schools for a year. She bought a freezer with her savings and sold marcianos (a type of Popsicle) in the summer. Then she learned how to make cakes from a cookbook and now sells them to shops. People began to place one order after the other and she sells ten cakes, from apple cake to bread pudding, a week. Soledad has learned to be independent and make her own decisions since she has been a member of Finca. She needs a loan of 1,200 soles to buy a microwave oven and flour. Her goal is to open a soda fountain.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de un microondas y harina

loans.name: Maria Filibertina

texts.es: Doña Filibertina de 37 años de edad, con dos hijos, el mayor de 17 años, tiene una trabajadora de 13 años de edad, ella no descansa atiende su negocio en todo momento tiene una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, le nació la idea de poner una tienda por el sector donde vive no hay ninguna tienda cerca y las pocas que hay quedan muy lejos, también los sábados venden pollo por libra y los domingo venta de refacciones ella se esfuerza para poder darle a sus hijos educación porque quiere verlos profesionales, su sueño es poder construir una casa mas grande porque la que tiene es pequeña y también que sus hijos tengan una habitación cada uno y darles calidad de vida y tener una familia feliz.
texts.en:
Mrs. Filibertina is 37 years old and has two children. Her oldest child is 17-years-old. She has a 13 year old girl to help her with her business. Mrs. Filibertina never rests. She takes care of her business every waking moment. She has a general store that she got the idea to open near her home because there weren’t any stores in the area. On Saturdays, they sell chicken by the pound and spare parts on Sundays. She tries hard to give her children a good education because she wants to help them become professionals. Her dream is to build a bigger house since the one they have is very small. She would like each of her children to have their own room and provide them with a higher standard of living and have a happy family.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de articulos de consumo diario

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia es socia del Bancomunal Las Luciérnagas.
Claudina es conviviente  tiene 28 años tiene dos hijos de 7 y 5 años  que están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Claudina estudio informática y está trabajando como cajera  en un hipermercado, pero su hermana la inscribió para que vendiera productos de belleza por catalogo  y también  vende joyas. 
Desde que Claudina esta en Finca pudo comprar más mercadería  y tiene un respaldo económico.
Claudina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de pulseras, anillos de plata y productos de belleza. 
El sueño de Claudina es poner una tienda bazar en la casa de su suegra.
texts.en:
Claudia is a member of the communal bank “Las Luciérnagas.” She lives with her partner, is 28 years old, and has two children: ages 5 and 7. Both are students in the state school. Claudina studied computer science and works as a cashier in a hypermarket, but her sister signed her up to sell jewelry and beauty products from catalogs. Claudina has been able to buy more merchandise and has more financial backing since she has been a member of Finca. She needs a loan of 1,000 soles to buy bracelets, silver rings, and beauty products. Claudina’s dream to open a store (a bazar) in her mother-in-law’s house.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de pulseras, anillos de plata y productos de belleza

loans.name: Desideria

texts.es:
Desideria  es socia del Bancomunal Las Luciérnagas.
Desideria es conviviente tiene 47 años, un hijo de 16 años, que está terminando de estudiar en la escuela estatal.
Desideria se enamoró de su esposo  el  vendía  pollos, se fueron a vivir juntos y ella empezó a trabajar con él en la venta de pollos  hace mas de 25 años, dice es un buen negocio porque es un producto de primera necesidad.
Desde que Desideria esta en Finca aprendió ahorrar, antes todo su dinero lo invertía y no ahorraba nada, pero ahora aprendió a horrar para conseguir sus metas.
Desideria necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, para la compra de congelados  pavita, medallones, huevos, gallinas, bolsas.
El sueño de Desideria es poner una avícola en una avenida principal.
texts.en:
Desideria is a member of the communal bank "Las Luciérnagas" (The Fireflies). Desideria lives with her husband and is 47 years old. She has a 16 year old son who is finishing his studies at a public school. Desideria fell in love with her husband who sold chickens. Twenty-five years ago they went to live alone and she started to work with him selling chickens. She says that it is a good business because chicken is a basic food item that everyone wants. Since Desideria was in Finca she learned to save money. Before she invested all of her money and she did not save anything. But now she learned how to save to acheive her goals. Desideria needs a loan of $550 (1,600 Soles) to buy frozen chicken, chicken breasts, eggs, bags and hens. Desideria's dream is to start a poltury farm.

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy frozen chicken, chicken breasts, eggs, hens and bags.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza  es socia del Bancomunal Las Luciérnagas.
Maritza es casada tiene  44 años, dos hijos de 20 y 15 años, la mayor  trabaja y la menor está estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Maritza trabajaba como secretaria en una empresa, redujeron personal y se quedo sin trabajo, al poco tiempo se enfermo del corazón la operaron,  ya no pudo trabajar  por muchos años. Hace un año decidió  trabajar vendiendo  cosméticos  y joyas.  
Desde que Maritza está en Finca aprendió ahorrar, y a ser cumplida con los préstamos  es una gran ayuda porque puede invertir en productos.  
Maritza necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de joyas, cosmético y va matricularse en un taller de joyería.
El sueño de Maritza es alquilar un puesto para bazar.
texts.en:
Maritza is a member of the communal bank "Las Luciérnagas" (The Fireflies). Maritza is married and is 44 years old. She has two children and they are 20 and 15 years old. The oldest works and the youngest is a student in the public school system. Maritza used to work as a secretary at a company but her position was cut when their were job cuts at the company. She was left without a job and shortly after she had heart problems and had to undergo an operation. She could not work for many years. A year ago she decided to work selling cosmetics and jewels. Since Maritza has been in Finca she learned to save and to be responsible with her loans. It is a huge help because she can invest money in her products. Maritza needs a loan of $400 (1,200 Soles) to buy jewelry, cosmetics and to pay for a jewelry making class. Maritza's dream is to rent a space in the bazaar.

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jewelry, cosmetics and to take a jewelry making class.

loans.name: Albina Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Albina Isabel tiene 51 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. Moche, provincia D. Trujillo, en el departamento D. la Libertad; Perú.
Ella estudió hasta 3º D. Secundaria, tiene 1 hijo que depenD. económicamente D. ella.
Albina se dedica a la preparación D. comida en un restaurante, anteriormente tenía su propio negocio, una tienda en donD. vendía golosinas y distribuía gas; posteriormente se le presento la oportunidad D. viajar al extranjero, motivo por el cual vendió todo D. su negocio.  En la actualidad se encuentra trabajando para una señora en un restaurante, preparando alimentos.
La señora Albina recién forma parte del Banco Comunal Virgen D. Fátima, del cual señala se encuentra muy contenta, con muchas expectativas, pues ha participado como invitada D. algunas reuniones del Banco Comunal.
Con el crédito D. 300 soles, lo invertirá en la compra D. insumos (dulces y bebidas gaseosas), para el surtido D. su tienda, el cual lo instalará en su domicilio.
Albina tiene como sueño tener su propio negocio en casa, y asi estar más cerca D. su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Albina Isabel is 51 years old and lives in the district of Moche, Trujillo province, in the department of Libertad, Peru. She was in school until her third year of secondary school, and she has one child who depends on her economically. Albina works preparing food in a restaurant, though she used to have her own business, a store which sold gas and sweets. She later had the opportunity to travel abroad, and in order to do so she sold her business. She now works for another woman, preparing food in a restaurant. Albina has recently become a member of the Communal Bank Virgen D. Fátima, a decision with which she is very happy and full of expectations. She has participated as a guest at some of the Bank's meetings. She will invest the loan of 300 soles to purchase sweets and soft drinks to supply the store which she will open up in her house. Albina's dream is to have her own business in her home, and so be closer to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks and sweets

loans.name: Gina

texts.es:
Gina es socia del Bancomunal Las Luciérnagas.
Gina es casada tiene 31 años, un hijo de 3 años quien está  a su cuidado.
Gina estudio educación inicial trabajando en un colegio, pero lo dejo  por que ganaba muy poco, se puso a trabajar con su esposo, el  tiene una tienda de confección de  cortinas y decoración de interiores, ella  también se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza es vendedora estrella.
Desde que está en Finca  con las charlas recibidas aprendió a sacar, a llevar sus cuentas 
Gina necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de productos de belleza.
El sueño de Gina es poner su tienda de decoración y ser directora de belleza.
texts.en:
Gina is a member of the Communal Bank "Las Luciérnagas" (The Fireflies). She is 31 years old, married, and has a 3-year-old child in her care. Gina studied Early Childhood Education at school, but left the job because she made very little money. She began to work with her husband, who had a shop for curtain-making and interior decorating. She also started to work selling beauty products and is an excellent salesperson. Since she has been a part of the bank, the talks they have recieved have taught her to pay bills and do accounting. Gina requires a loan of 800 soles in order to buy beauty products. Her dream is to open a decorating store and be director of beauty.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of beauty products

loans.name: Balvina

texts.es: Doña Balbina Elías, es casada tiene 49 años tiene 9 hijos y se dedica a crianza de pollos y marranos también hace tejidos típicos su crédito lo necesita para comprar comida para sus animales y comprar mas marranos ya que saco los mas grandes el mes pasado, y sus sueños son sembrar café en un terreno abandonado y que sus hijos sigan estudiando tiene una hija que esta en 3ro básico y ella se siente feliz por eso.
texts.en:
Mrs. Balbina Elías is 49 years old, married, and has 9 children. She works raising chickens and hogs, as well as doing traditional weaving. She requires a loan to buy food for her animals, and to buy more hogs since she sold the largest ones last month. She hopes to grow coffee on an empty plot of land, and that her children continue studying. She has a daughter nearly finished high school, which makes her very happy.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing chickens and hogs for resale

loans.name: Silvia Issela

texts.es:
L. señora Silvia IsseL. tiene 36 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. Moche, provincia D. Trujillo, en el departamento D. L. Libertad; Perú.
ElL. terminó sus estudios Universitarios, tiene 3 hijos que dependen económicamente D. elL..
Silvia se dedica a L. venta D. ropa y bordados, cuando inició en ManueL. Ramos vendía únicamente ropa D. bebé, actualmente ha ampliado su negocio pues sus clientes le vienen haciendo pedidos D. prendas D. vestir para damas y caballeros (adultos).
Su mercadería lo adquiere al por mayor en Lima, lugar al que viaja constantemente para comprar sus productos.
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su Banco Comunal Virgen D. Fátima, lo invirtió en L. compra D. ropa para bebé (chaqueta, ropones y colchas).
Con este crédito D. 800 soles, lo invertirá en L. compra D. ropa como polos y chompas para niños y adultos.
Silvia tiene como sueño tener su propio stand para ofrecer su mercadería y así poder estudiar más adelante una maestría.
texts.en:
Silvia IsseL. is 36 years of age and lives in the Moche district, Trujillo province, in the department of L. Libertad, Perú. She finished her university studies and has 3 children who she supports economically. Silvia works selling clothing and embroidered goods, but when she started in ManueL. Ramos she only sold baby clothing. She currently has expanded her business as her clients have been placing orders for dress clothing for ladies and men (adults). She gets her merchandise wholesale in Lima, to where she travels constantly to buy her products. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from the Virgen D. Fátima Communal Bank, she invested it in the purchase of baby clothing (jackets, dresses and blankets). With this loan of 800 soles she will invest in the purchase of clothing such as polo shirts and sweaters for children and adults. Silvia has as her dream to have her own stand to sell her merchandise and through this be able to study for a Masters degree in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of clothing like polo shirts and sweaters for children and adults.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee  es socia del Bancomunal Las Luciérnagas.
Haydee es casada tiene 38 años, tres hijos de 15, 10 y 4 años que están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Haydee estudio obstetricia, no lo ejerció por que le ofrecían un trabajo en provincia y tenía  que  dejar a su familia, y se puso a trabajar con su esposo  vendiendo extractos de sábila, uña de gato, jugos naturales, ellos e levantan muy temprano para preparar todo, y salen con una carreta a trabajar todos los días.
Desde que Haydee esta en Finca   los prestamos han sido de ayuda para comprar más mercadería, aprendió ahorrar.
Haydee  necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de productos naturales, miel de abeja, algarrobina,  no ni todo de la selva. 
El sueño de Haydee es alquilar un puesto grande, y trabajar en su carrera de obstetricia.
texts.en:
Haydee is a member of Las Luciérnagas Communal Bank. Haydee is married, is 38 years old and has three children who are 15, 10 and 4 years old and study in the public school. Haydee studied obstetrics but did not practice because they offered her a job in the province and she would have had to leave her family. She went to work with her husband selling aloe extracts, cat’s nail, and natural juices. They wake up very early to prepare everything and go out with a cart to work everyday. Since Haydee is in Finca that loans have helped her to purchase more merchandise and she learned how to save. Haydee needs a loan of 1000 soles to purchase natural products, bee’s honey, and algarrobo syrup. Haydee’s dream is to rent a big stand and work in her career as an obstetrician.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of natural products, bee's honey, and algarrobo syrup

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy K. is a 38-year-old married father of two. He has been offering computer services in his shop in Shanzu for the last five years. He does printing, typesetting and CD-writing, and also acts as a computer consultant. Kennedy also sells and lends out entertainment videos and books in the same shop. He has many customers from the small but populated beach town of Shanzu who enjoy the various services he offers. Kennedy has previously borrowed from another source to finance his business, but this will be his first loan from Kiva partner, KADET.

With his 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan, Kennedy plans to upgrade his computer and also purchase some new parts and accessories for it. In the future, he hopes to own a computer training school, to be able to serve and empower the residents of Shanzu.

About KADET
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To upgrade his computer and purchase new computer parts

loans.name: Yensi

texts.es:
Yensi  es socia del Bancomunal Las Luciérnagas.
Yensi es casada tiene 40 años, tres hijos de 15, 13 y 7 años que están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Yensi estudio computación no la ejerció por qué no conseguía quien le de trabajo como practicante, se puso a trabajar, en ventas por muchos años, consiguió un trabajo en wong como impulsadora, y se dedica a vender ropa  por pedidos.    
Desde que Yensi está en Finca aprendió a trabajar y ser responsable con los préstamos.  
Yensi necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de ropa.
El sueño de Yensi es poder alquilar un puesto para venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Yensi is a member of the Las Luciérnagas Community Bank. Yensi is 40, married, and has three children. The children are 15, 13, and 7; and they go to the state school. Yensi studied computers, but she did not work in that field because she could not find anyone to give her work as an intern. She started working in sales, which she has done for many years. She got work as a sales assistant in Wong’s (a supermarket), and she sells clothes by order. Since Yensi has been in Finca she has learned to work and be responsible with the loans. She needs a loan for 800 PEN to buy clothes. Yensi’s dream is to be able to rent a place to sell clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes  es socia del Bancomunal Las Luciérnagas.
Mercedes es conviviente tiene 30 años, tiene dos hijos de 11 y 8 años que estudian en la escuela estatal.
Mercedes  termino la escuela estatal, no siguió estudiando  por que salió embarazada y se dedico a cuidar a su hijo,   empezó a trabajar vendiendo ropa en gamarra vendía, lo dejo por que salió nuevamente embarazada,  tuvo que dejarlo y hace tres años  decidió poner en su casa una tienda, empezó de a pocos y con los prestamos de Finca está comprando mas mercadería.    
Desde que Mercedes esta en Finca,  primera institución que le dio préstamo, para su negocio, aprendió a organizarse hacer precavida.   
Mercedes necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de abarrotes para su tienda, arroz, azúcar, aceite. 
 El sueño de Mercedes es crecer más en el negocio y poner otra tienda.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of the Las Luciérnagas Communal Bank.
Mercedes lives with her partner, is 30 years old and has two children aged 11 and 8 who attend public school.
Mercedes completed public school, but did not continue studying because she was pregnant and had to care for her son. She started to work selling clothing at Gamarra, but she quit because she again became pregnant. Three years ago she decided to set up shop in her home. She started little by little and with the loans from Finca she is now buying more merchandise.
Since Mercedes has been with Finca, the first institution to give her a loan, she has learned how to organise and be cautious with her business.
Mercedes needs an 800 PEN loan to purchase groceries for her shop like rice, sugar and oil.
Mercedes dreams of growing her business and of opening another store.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries for her shop like rice, sugar and oil

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Elvira tiene 64 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, en el departamento de la Libertad; Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria completa, tiene 3 hijos (casados).
Rosa se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos, anteriormente cuando inició en Manuela Ramos tenía su tienda donde vendía mercería, negocio que fracasó debido al incumplimiento de pago por parte de sus clientes, meses después Rosa enfermó lo cual implicó que la operaran.
Luego inicia con la venta de productos lácteos, negocio que actualmente administra, la empresaria señala que cuenta con clientes estables.
Sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Trujillo (en las ferias de lácteos).
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal Virgen de Fátima, lo invirtió en la compra de productos lácteos como queso y manjar blanco. 
Con este crédito de 300 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de manjar blanco, cuajadas (queso procesado) y quesillos.
Rosa tiene como sueño instalar nuevamente su tienda con productos de mercería y ampliar su negocio de la venta de productos lácteos.
texts.en:
Rosa Elvira is 64. She lives in the Moche district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She has a high school education. She has three married children. Rosa sells dairy products. Previously, when she started with Manuela Ramos, she had a store where she sold notions. The business failed because of her customers’ failure to pay. Months later Rosa became ill and had to have an operation. She then started selling dairy products. She currently runs the business, and she has a stable customer base. She gets her products in the city of Trujillo (in the dairy fairs). With her first loan for 300 PEN, which she received from her Virgen de Fátima Community bank, she bought dairy products like cheese and “manjar blanco” (sweet almond-flavored milk pudding thickened with gelatin or cornstarch). With this loan for 300 PEN, she will buy manjar blanco, “cuajadas” (processed cheese), and cheese. Rosa’s dream is to again set up her store with notions’ products and to expand her business of selling dairy products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy processed cheese, manjar blanco (a type of pudding), and cheese

loans.name: Constantina

texts.es:
La señora Constantina A. C.  tiene 51 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, en el departamento de la Libertad; Perú.
Ella estudió hasta 3º de Secundaria, tiene 2 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Constantina se dedica a la venta de golosinas, negocio que ya tenía cuando inició en Manuela Ramos. De lunes a viernes sus golosinas son vendidas en los colegios y en la plaza de armas de su distrito. También se dedica a la venta de postres los fines de semana.
Los productos como golosinas e insumos para la preparación de postres los adquiere en el Mercado Zonal Palermo (Trujillo).
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal Virgen de Fátima, lo invirtió en la compra de galletas, dulces, chicles y jugos envasados.
Con este crédito de 300 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de golosinas, álbum's y bebidas gaseosas.
Constantina tiene como sueño instalar un kiosco cerca a la plaza de armas de su distrito.
texts.en:
Constantina A. C. is 51 years old and she lives in the district of Moche, in the province of Trujillo, in the department of La Libertad, in the country of Peru. She studied until the third year of high school and she has two children that she provides for. Constantina makes a living by selling candy, a business that she already had when she started in Manuela Ramos. From Monday through Friday she sells snack foods at schools and in the center plaza of her district. Also, she sells desserts on the weekends. She buys the snack foods to sell and the ingredients for the for the desserts in a market located in the city of Trujillo. She invested the first loan that she recieved for 300 Soles that she recieved from the communal bank "Virgen de de Fátima" in the purchase of cookies, candies, gum and canned juices to sell. She will invest this next loan of 300 Soles in the purchase of snack foods, albums and sodas to sell. Constantina dreams about started a Kiosk that is close to the main plaza of her district.

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase of snack foods, albums and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
La señora Rosalina pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cajas Reales”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Chucuito, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil casada, es madre de 3 hijos.  Tiene estudios de secundaria completa y vive en la Comunidad de Chinchera, Sector San Bartolomé.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace casi 1 año, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles con el cual compró lanas para la elaboración de artesanías.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 700.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de lana y tejer todo tipo de artesanías en miniatura, y también teje chompas, chalinas, gorros, etc.
 
Su mayor  deseo es estudiar y puede ayudarse vendiendo las artesanías que produce.

A ella le gusta compartir sus experiencias  con sus compañeras, le gusta la facilidad de los préstamos que ofrece Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Rosalina is a member of the “Cajas Reales” Communal Bank located in the Chucuito district in the province of Puno, in the department of Puno. She is married, 37 years old, and is the mother of 3 children. She has completed secondary school studies and lives in the San Bartolomé sector of the Chinchera community.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for almost 1 year. Her first loan was 500.00 PEN, which she used to buy wool to make handicrafts.

She now needs a loan of 700.00 PEN to purchase wool and sew each type of handicraft in miniature form, as well as sew sweaters, scarves, hats, etc.

Her biggest dream is to study and she can help herself by selling the handicrafts that she makes.

Rosalina likes sharing her experiences with her partners. She likes the easy access to loans that Manuela Ramos offers.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wool to make handicrafts

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La señora Irma pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cajas Reales”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Chucuito, Provincia D. Puno, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 60 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y es madre D. 03 hijos que aun dependen D. ella.  Tiene estudios D. primaria completa y vive en el la Comunidad D. Chinchera.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. la fundación del Banco Comunal, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra D. lanas para la confección D. Artesanías.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra D. lana D. diferentes colores, con los que confeccionara artesanías para luego venderlos en las ferias D. Chucuito. Irma también elabora bordados en bayeta (tela especial para bordados).

Su mayor sueño es poder  criar vacunos para engorD..

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones que se dan en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Irma belongs to the Cajas Reales Community Bank, which is located in the Chucuito district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 60, married, and has three dependent children. She has an elementary school education. She lives in the Chinchera community. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos since the foundation of her Community Bank. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought wool to make her handicrafts. She now needs a loan for 800 PEN to buy different colors of wool to make her handicrafts. She will later sell them at the fairs in Chucuito. Irma also makes embroideries in “bayeta” (a special cloth for embroidery). Her biggest dream is to be able to raise cattle to fatten. She likes the savings and the meetings in her Community Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool for handicrafts

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora María Magdalena tiene 49 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, en el departamento de la Libertad; Perú.
Ella estudió primaria completa, tiene 2 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
María se dedica a la venta de carne y cerveza, este negocio lo tenía desde que inició en Manuela Ramos, pero no contaba con mucha mercadería, poco a poco su negocio fue incrementando y ahora distribuye sus productos por el distrito de Moche y en Trujillo, sus clientes ya son estables (conformados por familiares y amigos), además del negocio mencionado también se dedica a la preparación de menú (solo para familiares).
Sus productos como la carne, lo trae de Virú; y la cerveza la adquiere mediante tiendas distribuidoras.
Con el primer crédito de 300 S. que recibió de su Banco Comunal Virgen de Fátima, lo invirtió en la compra de carne.
Con este crédito de 1700 S., lo invertirá en la compra de carne y cerveza.
María tiene como sueño tener su propia bodega para ofrecer sus productos que actualmente vende.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Magdalena is 49 years old and lives in the Moche district in the province of Trujillo, department of la Libertad, Peru. She completed her primary studies and has now two children who depend on her economically. Maria works selling meat and beer, a business she has had since she joined Manuela Ramos. She began without much merchandise, but little by little her business has grown, and she now distributes her products in the Moche district and in Trujillo. She has a stable clientele (made up of relatives and friends), and besides the aforementioned business she also prepares food (for family members only). Her meat is supplied from Virú and the beer is bought from wholesale stores. She re-invested the first loan of 300 S. that she recieved from her Village Bank "Comunals Virgen de Fatima" to purchase more meat. The 1,700 S. she is now requesting will be used to buy both meat and beer. Maria's dream is to have her own shop, from which she can offer the products she currently sells.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of meat and beer for her business

loans.name: Julia Carlota

texts.es:
Julia es social del Bancomunal 24 de 0ctubre
Julia es casada, tiene 46 años y  tres hijos, los de 22, 21 y 16 años; los mayores están casados y el ultimo  estudian ingles. 
Julia se puso a vender samwish pero no le fue bien por que la zona donde vendía había mucha competencia  y su hermana la incorporo a la venta por catalogo de Productos de belleza, empezó con una linia ahora vende para tres empresas de belleza.  
Desde que comenzó en Finca  ha aprendido que todo mujer tiene la oportunidad de surgir 
Necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para compra productos  de belleza por catalogo en oferta, y poder estoquearse. 
El sueño  de Julia es tener una librería bazar.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the 24 de Octubre Community Bank. She is 46, married, and has three children. The children are 22, 21, and 16. The older children are married; the last one is studying English. Julia started selling sandwiches, but that was not good because there was so much competition in the area where she sold. Her sister got her into selling beauty products by catalog. She started with one line, and now she sells for three beauty companies. Since she started with Finca, she has learned that every woman has the opportunity to advance. She needs a loan for 1,200 PEN to buy beauty products by catalog and be able to stock her inventory. Julia’s dream is to have a bazaar style bookstore.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products by catalog and be able to stock up

loans.name: María Esther

texts.es:
La señora María Esther tiene 48 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, en el departamento de la Libertad; Perú.
Ella estudió primaria completa, tiene 3 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
María se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, cerveza y ropa. Cuando inició en Manuela Ramos empezó con la venta de productos de belleza, luego, pasado un año y medio, empezó con la venta de cerveza, negocio que creció con el apoyo de su padre y del Movimiento Manuela  Ramos, ahora se mantiene muy bien en su negocio, reconoce que tiene momentos difíciles pero que ha aprendido a salir adelante, lo que le permite invertir en diferentes productos, hasta invertir en la venta de ropa. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su propia casa.
Sus productos de belleza los obtiene mediante catálogos, la cerveza la provee la fabrica distribuidora de cerveza y su mercadería (ropa) la compra en la ciudad de Lima. 
Con el primer crédito de 300 S. que recibió de su Banco Comunal Virgen de Fátima, lo invirtió en la compra de productos de belleza de catálogos para su stock.
Con este crédito de 700 S., lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería como ropa y cerveza.
María tiene como sueño instalar un bazar en donde pueda ofrecer las prendas de vestir con total comodidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Esther is 48 years old and lives in the Moche District of Trujillo Province, Department of Libertad, Peru. She completed her elementary school education and has 3 children who are financially dependent on her.

María sells beauty products, beer and clothing. When she started with Manuela Ramos, she began selling beauty products and, a year and a half later, also began selling beer. She has been able to grow her business with the help of her father and the support of Manuela Ramos. Her business is doing well, but she admits that she has had some difficult moments and has learned to keep moving forward. She would like to offer different products and invest in selling more clothes. María’s business is located in her home.

Her beauty products are ordered through catalogs, beer is acquired from a distributor, and her clothing stock is purchased in the city of Lima. With her first loan of 300 S., provided by the Virgen de Fátima Communal Bank Group, she ordered beauty products from catalogs to increase her inventory.

She is now requesting a loan of 700 S. to buy more merchandise, such as clothing and beer. María dreams of opening a boutique where her customers can shop for clothing in total comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing and beer

loans.name: Jenny Cecilia

texts.es:
Jenny es social del Bancomunal 24 de 0ctubre
Jenny es conviviente, tiene 40 años, tres hijos de 17, 15, 4 años;  que están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Jenny ha incursionado en otro negocio que es la venta de artesanía, canastas de Junco y telares  ha conocido a varios artesanos y esta mandando hacer artesanías para venta le esta yendo bien, ella vende en las ferias y eventos que organiza la municipalidad. .
Necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles,  para invertirlo en buffet y artesanía
El sueño de Jenny es tener su casa propia, y  tener  un negocio estable
texts.en:
Jenny is a member of the 24 de Octubre Community Bank. Jenny is 40, in a common law marriage, and has three children. Her children are 17, 15, and 4; they attend the state school. Jenny has undertaken another business, which is the sale of handicrafts like baskets of 'junco' (a water plant which is used when dry) and woven goods. She has known various people who make handicrafts, and she is placing orders with them. It is going well. She sells at fairs and at events that are organized by the municipality. She needs a loan for 3,000 PEN to buy a shelves and handicrafts. Jenny’s dream is to have her own house and to have a stable business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shelves and handicrafts

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La señora Elena, Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cajas Reales”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Chucuito, Provincia D. Puno, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 60 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, con 4 hijos, tiene estudios D. primaria completa, vive en el Barrio Santa Rosa Jr. Pichacani - Puno.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 4 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra D. prendas D. vestir americana.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, para comprar ropa americana en todas las variedades.
 
Su mayor  deseo es continuar trabajando y ver profesionales a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan las facilidades D. pago D. los préstamos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elena is 60 years, married with 4 children and lives in the District Santa Rosa Jr. Pichacani - Puno. She belongs to the Communal Bank “Cajas Reales”, located in the district of Chucuito, Puno Province. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 4 years; her first loan was for 300.00 Nuevo Soles which was used to purchase American clothing. At this moment she is requesting a loan of $500 to buy a variety of American clothes. It is her greatest desire is to continue working and to see her children become professionals. She likes the facility of the loan payments.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana es social del Bancomunal 24 de 0ctubre
Ana es casada  tiene 40 años, no tiene hijos.
Ana se esta dedicando a las ventas  de productos de belleza por catalogo, a la venta de zapatos por catalogo, y la venta de ropa, gracias Dios tiene bastantes clientas. 
Necesita un crédito de 1200 soles, que los va invertir en mercadería por fiestas patrias. 
El sueño que tiene Ana  es  seguir creciendo en el negocio y comprarse otro
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the Bancomunal 24 de Octubre.

Ana is married, 40 years old, and does not have any children.

Ana sells beauty products and shoes through a catalog, as well as clothing. Fortunately, she has enough customers.

She needs a loan of 1200 soles, which she will invest in merchandise for the Independence Day holiday.

Ana’s dream is to continue growing her business and to buy another.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in merchandise for the Independence Day holiday

loans.name: Franz Tamayo Group

texts.es: “Franz Tamayo” es una Asociación Comunal que pertenece al Centro Focal  “Panamericana”, con 13 integrantes. A la cabeza de su presidenta  Nicolasa Q., se organizan para llevar a delante su reunión. Nicolasa tiene el negocio de tejido de chompas y necesita el préstamo para comprar materia prima como  lana. Al igual que Nicolasa las demás integrantes tienen sus respectivos negocios como la confección de ropa, tejido de mantillas, venta de comida y  tienda de barrio.
texts.en:
“Franz Tamayo” is a Communal Association of 13 members that belongs to the “Pan-American” Focal Center. At the top is President Nicolasa Q., who is organizing them to move forward with their group. Nicolasa has the business of woven sweaters and needs the loan to buy raw materials like wool. Like Nicolasa, the other members have their respective businesses such as the preparation of clothing, woven blankets, food sales and neighborhood stores.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goods and raw materials

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza  es social del Bancomunal 24 de 0ctubre
Maritza es casada, tiene 45 años dos hijos de 16  y 7 años que estudian en la escuela estatal Francisco Bolognessi en San Juan.  
Maritza tiene una bodega, pero  en la misma cuadra han abierto otra bodega y las ventas ya no es el mismo, ella ha visto  la posibilidad de poner un negocio de bazar   en el callao y quiere implementarlo. 
Necesita un crédito de 800 soles,  para la compra de ropa de bebe.
El sueño que tiene es tener otra tienda, un bazar y ver a su hijos profesionales.
texts.en:
Maritza is a partner at the October 24th Village Bank. Maritza is married, 45 years old, and has two children who are 16 and 7 years old and study at the Francisco Bolognessi state school in San Juan. Maritza has a grocery store, but on the same block another grocery store has opened so her sales aren’t the same anymore. She has seen the possibility of putting a general goods store in Callao and she wants to set one up. She needs a loan of 800 soles to buy baby clothing. Her dream is to have another store – a general goods store - and to see her children have careers.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase baby clothing

loans.name: Priscila Maritza

texts.es:
Priscila es social del Bancomunal 24 de 0ctubre.
Priscila es de cerro de Pazco, es madre soltera tiene 43 años, tres hijos de 18, 11 y 7 años.
Priscila tiene su negocio de alquiler de cochera, ella tiene un terreno grande que poco a poco lo esta arreglando, por que cada vez su clientela aumenta..  
Todavía tiene la idea de dar desayunos por las mañanas, no lo pudo hacer por motivos familiares.
Necesita el préstamo de 1000 soles, para poner piso a su cochera..
El sueño de Priscila es construir su casa y que su hija estudie psicología y poner otro negocio.
texts.en:
Priscila is a member of the Bancomunal 24 de Octubre.

Priscila is from Cerro de Pazco. She is 43 years old, a single mother, and has three children who are 18, 11, and 7 years old.

Priscila has a car rental business. She has a large piece of land that she is fixing little by little because her number of customers continues to increase.

She still has the idea of serving breakfast in the mornings, but has not been able to do it because of family reasons.

She needs a loan of 1000 soles to put a floor in her garage.

Priscila’s dream is to continue building her house, to start another business, and for her daughter to study psychology.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To put a floor in her garage

loans.name: Regina

texts.es:
Regina  es socia del Bancomunal 24 D. Octubre.  
Regina es casada tiene 64 años, tiene dos hijos D. 27 y 26 años que trabajan y estudian.
Regina le regalaron un carro y ha elL. no le gusta manejar y decidió alquilarlo y con el tiempo con su esposo compro otro auto y lo alquilo, por su parte se dedico al negocio D. polos dando servició D. bordado y se esta dedicando a L. compra y venta D. polos D. exportación.   
DesD. que Regina esta en Finca aprendió el manejo del negocio y a saber invertir.
Regina necesita un préstamo D. 1600 soles, para L. compra D. repuestos D. carro, para hacerle mantenimiento a su carro que va pasar revisión técnica  
El sueño D. Regina es tener un menimarket.
texts.en:
Regina is a member of the October 24 Communal Bank Group. She is 64 years old, married, and has two children (ages 27 and 26) who are working and studying.

Regina was given a car, but she doesn’t like to drive. So she decided to rent it out, and eventually her husband bought another car to use as a rental. She dedicates most her time to her business buying and selling embroidered sweaters for export.

Since joining FINCA, Regina has learned how to manage her business and expanded her investment knowledge. She needs a loan of 1600 soles to purchase spare parts to maintenance her car so that it will pass inspection.

Regina’s dream is to open her own mini-market.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia  es socia del Bancomunal 24 de Octubre.  
Sonia es casada tiene 37 años, un hijo de  10 años que estudia en al escuela estatal.
Sonia   estudio psicología en la universidad termino su carrera cuando empezó a trabajar quedo embarazada, cuando nació su hija dejo de trabajar y se dedico a cuidarla , puso en su casa una librería y sus vecinos le pedían cosas de bodega y ella empezó comprando cosas   comestibles para la  bodega, su pequeña hija también le ayuda.      
Desde que Sonia esta en finca  ha crecido su capital se ha duplicado, tuvo que mandar a romper una pared de su casa para ampliar su negocio.  
 Sonia necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles para  la comprar de cerveza  y gaseosa para su bodega 
El sueño de Sonia es  crecer más en el negocio y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Sonia is a partner at the October 24th Village Bank. Sonia is married, 37 years old, and has a 10-year-old daughter who studies at the state school. Sonia studied psychology at a university and finished her degree. When she began to work she got pregnant. When her daughter was born she stopped working in order to take care of her and she put a bookstore in her house. Her neighbors asked her for grocery items so she began buying edible goods for her shop. Her little daughter also helps her with the work. Since Sonia has been with FINCA she has doubled her capital. She had to order for a wall to be torn down in her house to make her shop bigger. Sonia needs a loan of 1200 soles to purchase beer and sodas for her grocery store. Sonia’s dream is to grow her business and to finish the construction on her house.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beer and sodas for grocery shop

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria es socia del Bancomunal 24 D. Octubre.  
Gregoria es casada tiene cuatro hijos D. 28, 26, 25, y 23 años que trabajan 
Gregoria  antes solo se dedicaba a su casa, hasta que se mudo y en su casa propia puso una bodega  D. venta D. abarrotes, su negocio ha crecido por que ahora ella venD. productos D. bazar.
DesD. que Gregoria esta en Finca le ha ido bien su capital aumentó, aprendió ha invertir y como llevar su negocio. 
Gregoria necesita un préstamo D. 2400 soles para la compra D. víveres para su bodega, arroz, azúcar, harina 
El sueño D. Gregoria es vender al por mayor por que la mercadería se mueve rápido.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a member of the village bank 24th of October. She is married and has four children ages 28, 26, 25 and 23 who all work. Gregoria was a full-time homemaker until she moved and set up a general store in her own house. Her business has grown because she now sells domestic products. Since Gregoria has been with FINCA things have gone well for her-- her capital has increased, and she has learned to invest and how to run her business. Gregoria needs a loan of 2400 soles to buy supplies for her store like rice, sugar and flour. Gregoria's dream is to sell wholesale because the merchandise sells quickly.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies for her general store including rice, sugar and flour

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Benkadi 1 sont toutes des femmes mariées, avec une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Massoukou, un des villages de la commune rurale de Tingolé, sous préfecture de Fana, 2ème région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Elles font exclusivement la culture d’arachide qui reste la principale culture de la zone.
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de pouvoir réaliser leurs activités hivernales. 
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, des semences, des intrants, des petits matériels et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir 9 hectares.
Après la récolte  la production sera vendue dans les marchés de Marka-Coungo, Fana et Tingolé à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes généralement au comptant. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 17.500FCFA par campagne.
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi 1 souhaitent la continuation de leur collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso et ambitionnent avoir des montants plus élevés.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 1 group are all married women, who average 50 years of age and 5 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Massoukou, one of the village of the rural city of Tingolé, Fana subprefecture, 2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They exclusively grow peanuts, which is still the main crop in the area.

They are seeking their first loan from Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to realize their rainy season activities. This loan will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers, small materials, and to pay for the cost of labour and hoeing of 9 hectares. After the harvest, the production will be sold, usually for cash, at the following markets : Marka-Coungo, Fana and Tingolé, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

They intend to turn an average profit of XOF 17'500 (ca US$ 35) per campaign. The women of the Benkadi 1 group wish to pursue their collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso and ambition to obtain higher loans.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, small materials, and to pay for the cost of labour and hoeing of 9 hectares

loans.name: Lena

texts.fr: lena est une femme mariée née en 1955 à thies ,elle a commencé à faire du petit commerce depuis plusieurs années ;son activité consiste à acheter pour revendre de l'huile de palme ,de la pate d'arachide ,des balais et diverses autres produits:avec ce pret elle veut renforcer son fonds de roulement
texts.en:
Lena is a married woman, born in 1955 in Thies. She began to work in petty trading several years ago. Her business consists of buying palm oil, peanut butter, brooms, and various other products for resale. With this loan, she wants to add to her working capital.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Benkadi 3 sont toutes des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Massoukou  un des villages de la commune rurale de Tingolé, sous préfecture de Fana, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles sont à leur première  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir réaliser les activités  agricoles. Elles font exclusivement la culture d’arachide qui reste la principale culture de la zone. 
Par rapport à l’utilisation de ce prêt, elles comptent acheter, des semences, des intrants, des petits matériels et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 10 hectares.
La production sera vendue au niveau des marchés de Marka-Coungo, Fana et Tingolé après les récoltes, au comptant surtout  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20 000FCFA par campagne.
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi 3 ambitionnent avoir des montants à hauteur de souhait.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 3 group are all married women who average 34 years of age and 3 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Massoukou, one of the villages of the rural city of Tingolé, subprefecture of Fana, 2nd administrative region of Mali.

They are seeking their first loan from Kiva's partner, the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to be able to realize their farming activities. They exclusively grow peanuts, which is still the main crop in the area. This loan will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers, small materials, and to pay for the cost of labour and hoeing of 10 hectares. After the harvest, the production will be sold for cash at the following markets : Marka-Coungo, Fana et Tingolé, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

They intend to turn an average profit of XOF 20'000 (ca US$ 45) per campaign. The women of the Benkadi 3 group ambition to obtain loans corresponding to the desired amount.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, small materials, and to pay for the cost of labour and hoeing of 10 hectares.

loans.name: Esperanza 2006 Group

texts.es: La Asociación Comunal “Esperanza 2006” es parte del Centro Focal “Los Andes”, con aproximadamente 4 años de vida una de las integrantes es Elena M., que necesita el préstamo para comprar chamarras y así incrementar su mercadería, actualmente comercializa su producto en la feria “16 de Julio” pero ella tiene el objetivo de abrir otro punto de  venta. Al igual que Elena las demás integrantes de la Asociación Comunal tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de plástico, arroz, fideo, material escolar y otros y necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería.
texts.en:
