The Communal Group "Esperanza 2006" is part of the Los Andes Focal Center and has been together for about 4 years. One of the members is Elena M. who needs a loan in order to buy jackets and thereby increase her available merchandise. Currently she sells her products at the July 16th Market but she has the goal of opening another sales location. Just like Elena, the other members of the Communal Group have their own businesses like selling plastics, rice, noodles, school materials and other items. They need a loan in order to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys I. is a married mother of three, living in Geneku, Cameroon. She has been a member of GHAPE since 2006 and has borrowed from the organization twice before. Through these loans, she has been able to establish for herself a restaurant and bar.

Through her first two loans, Gladys has seen her home life improve, has been able to pay school fees, provide for her family, and has been able to give them better food. In addition to that, Gladys is now able to ensure that her family will have access to quality medical care.

Following her first and second loans, Gladys has requested another loan from GHAPE. This time around, she is requesting 150,000 Fcfa from the organization. With this next loan, Gladys hopes to be able to expand her restaurant and include a provisions store where beer will also be sold.

By expanding her business, not only will Gladys be making more money and be helping her family, but she will also be providing a valuable service to different members of the community. As it stands right now, some members of the community need to travel long distances just to be able to get something to eat. By expanding her business, Gladys will be able to shorten the distance that many people have to travel in order to eat, and thus will be improving the quality of life of those folks.

Gladys’s business is sure to succeed with these new developments, simply on account of the fact that there are a couple of primary and secondary schools nearby where teachers, students and families often pass by. Beyond this, she has been experiencing an increase in business lately as more customers are patronizing her restaurant. With more services to offer, she is almost sure of further growth and success.

Gladys chooses to work with GHAPE empowerment credits not only because of the favorable terms of the loans, such as the low interest rates and lack of requisite collateral, but also because of the ability for borrowers to make payments over time, thus relieving the financial burden on individual borrowers, and freeing them from a potential debt trap or cycle.


About GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To expand her restaurant and include a provisions store where beer will be sold

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Maria Isabel vive en casa de sus padres con su esposo y sus dos hijos en la calle Carlos Medinacelli de la zona de Alto Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz; ella trabaja en una agencia de viajes y el esposo trabaja con un auto de su propiedad  como radio taxi.  El crédito que solicita es para reparar la movilidad ( ajuste de frenos, cambio de aceites, etc.) y de esta manera mantener sus ingresos y mantener a su familia estable.

Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito de Impro; la actividad que desempeña la califica para obtener un crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Isabel lives at her parents' house with her husband and two children on Carlos Medinacelli Street in the Alto Sopocachi zone of La Paz; she works at a travel agency and her husband drives a car that she owns as a radio taxi. The loan that she is requesting is to repair the car (break adjustment, oil-change, etc.) and thereby maintain her income and keep her family stable. It is the first time that she is requesting a loan from Impro; the work that she performs qualifies her for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cost of maintenance of a radio taxi that she owns and that her husband drives for a living

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi  4 est constitué  de 10 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans, 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames à Massoukou,  un des villages de la commune rurale de Tingolé, sous préfecture de Fana, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles  sont à leur première  collaboration avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir réaliser les activités agricoles. Elles font exclusivement la culture d’arachide qui reste la principale culture de la zone. 
Par rapport à l’utilisation de ce prêt, elles comptent acheter, des semences, des intrants, des petits matériels et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 10 hectares.
La production sera vendue au niveau des marchés de Marka-Coungo, Fana et Tingolé après les récoltes, au comptant surtout à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20 000FCFA par campagne.
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi 4 souhaitent la continuation de leur collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso et ambitionnent avoir des montants plus élevés c’est à dire à hauteur de souhait.
texts.en:
Benkadi 4 is composed of 10 married women who average 29 years of age and 3 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Massoukou, one of the villages in the rural city of Tingolé, Fana subprefecture, 2nd administrative region of Mali.

They are seeking their first loan from Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, in order to be able to realize their farming activities. They exclusively grow peanuts, which is still the main crop in the area. This loan will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers, small materials, and to pay for the cost of labour and hoeing of 10 hectares. After the harvest, the production will be sold, mainly for cash, at the following markets : Marka-Coungo, Fana and Tingolé, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

They intend to turn an average profit of XOF 20'000 (ca US$ 45) per campaign. The women of the Benkadi 4 group wish to pursue their collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso, and ambition to obtain higher loans.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, small materials, and to pay for the cost of labour and hoeing of 10 hectares.

loans.name: Julia Inés

texts.es:
La señora Julia Inés S. D. M. tiene 73 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. Moche, provincia D. Trujillo, en el departamento D. la Libertad; Perú.
Ella estudió primaria completa, tiene 1 hijo que depenD. económicamente D. ella.
Julia tiene una bodega en la cual venD. insumos para la preparación D. alimentos y útiles D. escritorio. Cuando inició en Manuela Ramos tenía el mismo negocio pero sus ventas eran bajas, solo vendía golosinas y determinados útiles D. escritorio (cuadernos y lapiceros); con las ganas D. que su negocio crezca, empezó también con la venta D. frutas.
Sus productos los obtiene en tiendas mayoristas cuyos proveedores la visitan en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su Banco Comunal Virgen D. Fátima, lo invirtió en la compra D. insumos para la preparación D. alimentos (arroz, aceite, azúcar, huevos y detergentes).
Con este crédito D. 500 soles, lo invertirá en la compra D. golosinas, bebidas gaseosas, e implementación D. su librería.
Julia tiene como sueño tener su propio bazar donD. pueda ofrecer productos como mercería, útiles D. escritorio y abarrotes.
texts.en:
Julia Sanchez D. Martinez is 73 years old and lives in the district of Moche, in the province of Trujillo, Peru. She completed her primary eduction, and she still has one son who is financially dependent on her. Julia has a small general store where she sells grocery items and office supplies. When she began working with Manuela Ramos, she had the same business, but her sales were slow and she was only selling sweets and a few basic items such as notebooks and pens. With the income from her increasing sales, she has begun selling fruit. She purchases her inventory from wholesale vendors who come to her house. With the first loan she received from the Communal Bank, she purchased items such as rice, cooking oil, sugar, eggs and detergents. With this loan, she will purchase sweets, sodas and more office supplies. Julia's dream is to have a larger store where she can offer more merchandise, office supplies and groceries.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her small general store with sweets, sodas and office supplies.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El señor Mario vive en casa de sus padres en la calle Felix Sirpa de la zona de Vino Tinto de la ciudad de La Paz, se dedica a la confección de trajes de varón y con esta actividad genera empleo porque trabaja con un ayudante de costura. El crédito que solicita es para comprar material (telas, hilos, forros, botones) y poder mantener su fuente de trabajo y al mismo tiempo tener mayor clientela.

Esta es la primera vez que acude a Impro para solicitar un crédito y por la actividad que desempeña, además del análisis de flujo de caja y análisis social califica para obtener un crédito.
texts.en:
Mario lives in his parent’s home on the street Felix Sirpa in the Vino Tinto section of the city of La Paz. He works sewing men’s suits and in this finds employment working alongside an apprentice. The loan that he requests is to buy materials (fabrics, thread, lining, buttons) so that he can maintain his source of work and at the same time have a bigger clientele.

This is the first time that he has turned to Impro to request a loan for which he qualifies for the position he holds, as well as by analysis of his cash flow and social qualifications.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, thread, lining and buttons

loans.name: Rosa Marleny

texts.es:
La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cajas Reales”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Chucuito, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y es madre de 03 hijos.  Tiene estudios de secundaria completa y vive en la Comunidad de Chinchero Sector San Bartolomé.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace casi medio año, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra de lanas para la confección de Artesanías.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de lana industrial por conos, ella elabora chompas, chalinas, solo por pedido.

Su mayor  deseo es seguir trabajando, para poder educar a  sus hijos.

A ella le gustan la forma de trabajo y la unión que hay en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the community bank “Cajas Reales” that is located in the Chucuito district, Puno province, department of Puno. She is 27 years old, has a commonwealth partner and is a mother of three children. She has completed secondary school and lives in the Chinchero community, San Bartolomé sector.

She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for almost half a year. Her first loan was for 500.00 Nuevos Soles (about $165USD), which she used to buy yarns for artisan projects.

Now she needs a loan of 800.00 Nuevos Soles to buy cones of industrial yarn. She will make jackets and scarves for orders only.

Her greatest wish is to be able to continue working to be able to educate her children.

She likes the method and unity of working with a community bank.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cones of industrial yarn

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi 5 est  constitué de 10 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans, 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames à Massoukou,  un des villages de la commune rurale de Tingolé, sous préfecture de Fana, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles viennent de commencer la collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir réaliser les activités hivernales. Elles font exclusivement la culture d’arachide qui reste la principale culture de la zone. 
Par rapport à l’utilisation de ce prêt, elles comptent acheter, des semences, des intrants, des petits matériels et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 10 hectares.
La production sera vendue au niveau des marchés de Marka-Coungo, Fana et Tingolé après les récoltes surtout au comptant  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 17500FCFA par campagne.
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi 5 ambitionnent avoir des montants à hauteur de souhait.
texts.en:
The Benkadi 5 group is composed of 10 married women who average 50 years of age and 5 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Massoukou, one of the villages in the rural city of Tingolé, Fana subprefecture, 2nd administrative region of Mali.

They are seeking their first loan from Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, in order to be able to realize their rainy season activities. They exclusively grow peanuts, which is still the main crop in the area. This loan will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers, small materials, and to pay for the cost of labour and hoeing of 10 hectares. After the harvest, the production will be sold, mainly for cash, at the following markets : Marka-Coungo, Fana and Tingolé, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

They intend to turn an average profit of XOF 17'500 (ca US$ 35) per campaign. The women of the Benkadi 5 group ambition to obtain loans corresponding to their wishes.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, small materials, and to pay for the cost of labour and hoeing of 10 hectares.

loans.name: Benkadi 6 Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi 6 est constitué de 2 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 27 ans, 3 enfants et  vivant  dans des familles polygames à Massoukou,  un des villages de la commune rurale de Tingolé, sous préfecture de Fana, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles viennent de commencer leur collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir réaliser les activités hivernales. Elles font exclusivement la culture d’arachide qui reste la principale culture de la zone. 
Par rapport à l’utilisation de ce prêt, elles comptent acheter, des semences, des intrants, des petits matériels et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 2  hectares.
La production sera vendue au niveau des marchés de Marka-Coungo, Fana et Tingolé après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes venant généralement des grandes villes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20 000FCFA par campagne.
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi 6 ambitionnent avoir des montants à hauteur de souhait.
texts.en:
Benkadi 6 is made up of two married women with an average age of 27 and 3 children, living in polygamous families in Massoukou, a village belonging to the rural community of Tingolé, Sous-préfecture of Fana, 2nd administrative region of Mali.

They have just begun to work with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to work at rainy-season businesses. They grow peanuts exclusively, which is still the principal crop in this area.

They expect to use this loan to buy seeds, agricultural intrants, and small equipment and to pay the costs of weeding and plowing so as to maintain 2 hectares.

Their produce will be sold in the markets of Marka-Coungo, Fana and Tingolé after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women coming generally from the big towns. They expect to make an average profit of 20,000 F CFA for the growing season. Their ambition is to earn as much as their hearts desire.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and odds and ends

loans.name: Sabougnouma 1 Group

texts.fr:
Sabougnouma 1  est constitué de  10 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41ans et  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Djambougou un des villages de la commune rurale de Tingolé, sous préfecture de Fana, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités hivernales. Les spéculations sont l’arachide et le petit mil. Elles sont à leurs troisièmes collaborations avec l’institution, les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter des intrants, des petits matériels, des semences et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage  pour entretenir 17.5  hectares.
Les productions seront vendues au niveau des marchés de Marka-Coungo, Fana et Tingolé après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40 000FCFA par campagne qui sera à étoffer les activités commerciales.
texts.en:
Sabougnouma 1 is composed of 10 married women who average 41 years of age and 3 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Djambougou, one of the villages in the rural city of Tingolé, Fana subprefecture, 2nd administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, in order to realize their rainy season activities. They mainly grow peanuts and millet. They are seeking their third loan from Soro Yiriwaso, and the previous loans ended without problems. With this new loan, they intend to buy seeds, fertilizers, small materials, and to pay for the cost of labour and hoeing of 17.5 hectares. After the harvest, the production is sold at the following markets : Marka-Coungo, Fana and Tingolé, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

They intend to turn an average profit of XOF 40'000 (ca US$ 85) per campaign, to be used to bolster their businesses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, small materials, and to pay for the cost of labour and hoeing of 10 hectares.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cajas Reales”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Chucuito, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 35 años de edad, de estado civil casada y es madre de 03 hijos.  Tiene estudios de segundaria completa y vive en la Comunidad de Chinchero, Sector Miraflores.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 7 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra de lanas para la confección de Artesanías.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, para compra de lana acrílica para la elaboración de artesanías como títeres de dedo.  Paralelamente tiene un segundo negocio de  preparación de  comida para vender en las ferias.

Su mayor  deseo es seguir trabajando y que su negocio crezca mas.

A ella le gustan las reuniones ya que comparte muchas experiencias con sus amigas.
texts.en:
Lidia belongs to the community bank “Cajas Reales” that is located in the Chucuito district, Puno province, department of Puno. She is 35 years old, married and is the mother of three children. She has completed secondary studies and lives in the Chinchero community, Miraflores sector.

She has worked with the Movemiento Manuela Ramos for 7 years. Her first loan was for 300.00 Nuevos Soles (about $100 USD) that she used to buy yarns for artisan projects.

Now she needs a loan of 800.00 Nuevos Soles to buy acrylic yarn to make artisan projects such as finger puppets. She has a second business on the side preparing food to sell at markets.

Her greatest desire is to keep working and that her business grows.

She likes bank meetings to share with her friends their experiences.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase acrylic yarn

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Virginia, Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cajas Reales”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Chucuito, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno.  Ella tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, es madre de 1 hijo, tiene estudios de segundaria completa, vive en la Comunidad de Chinchera Sector Miraflores.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace casi 3 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para incrementar su capital en su taller de carpintería.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de madera, también comprará lana para elaborar artesanías en miniatura.
 
Su mayor  deseo es mejorar su negocio en su carpintería, al mismo tiempo también en la elaboración de sus tejidos en artesanías.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y los encuentros entre Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Virginia is a member of the “Cajas Reales” Communal Bank, which is located in the Chucuito district of the province of Puno, in the department of Puno. She is 25 years old, has a live-in partner, and is the mother of 1 child. She has completed secondary school studies and lives in the Miraflores sector of the Chinchera community.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for almost 3 years. Her first loan was 300.00 PEN, which she used to increase capital in her carpenter’s workshop.

She now needs a loan of 800.00 PEN to purchase wood. She will also buy wool to make handicrafts in miniature form.

Her biggest dream is to improve business in her carpenter’s workshop, as well as the production of her knitted handicrafts.

She likes the savings and chats among the Communal Banks.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood and wool for handicrafts.

loans.name: Orchidée Plus Group

texts.fr: Pitchou L.  gère ses deux propres moulins qui constituent l’essentiel de son activité. Il a acheté le premier moulin en 1999. Le deuxième a été acquis en 2008, grâce aux bénéfices accumulés générés par le premier. En janvier 2008, Pitchou décide d’intégrer un des groupes de Hope dénommé « Orchidée Plus » dans le but de réaliser son rêve d’ouvrir un dépôt  de mais et de devenir un jour, fournisseur de ce produit dans son quartier situé au sud-est de Kinshasa. Il a déjà reçu trois prêts chez Hope qu’il a remboursés totalement. Pitchou compte, avec le crédit actuel, diversifier son activité en achetant 8 sacs de maїs à revendre en vue d’accroitre le revenu. Actuellement, son affaire lui génère un bénéfice de $175 par semaine. Pitchou est célibataire et père d’un enfant âgé de 3 ans. Le groupe « Orchidée Plus » a eu la joie et le privilège de recevoir John, Kiva Fellow à Kinshasa.
texts.en:
Pitchou L. runs two mills belonging to him, which constitute the essential part of his business. He bought the first mill in 1999. The second was acquired in 2008, thanks to the accumulated profit made with the first mill.

In January 2008, Pitchou decided to join one of the Hope groups called « Orchidée Plus » with the intention of making his dream come true: to open a maize depot and one day, to become a supplier of this product in his neighborhood situated in the south-east of Kinshasa.

He has already received three loans from Hope which he completely reimbursed. Pitchou intends, with this loan, to diversify his business by buying 8 sacks of maize to sell to earn income. Presently, his business is generating a profit of US$ 175 per week.

Pitchou is single and the father of a child of 3. The « Orchidée Plus » group has had the joy and the privilege to welcome John, Kiva fellow in Kinshasa.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying 8 sacks of maize in order to diversify his business

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Sabougnouma  2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabougnouma  2 est constitué  de femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans, 3 enfants et vivant dans des familles polygames à Djambougou un des villages de la commue rurale de Tingolé, sous préfecture  de Fana, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités hivernales. Les spéculations sont l’arachide et le petit mil. Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution, les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, des semences, des intrants, des petits matériels et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 18 hectares.
Les productions seront vendues au niveau des marchés de Marka-Coungo, Fana et Tingolé après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40 000FCFA par campagne.
texts.en:
The Sabougnouma 2 group is composed of married women who average 29 years of age and 3 children. They live in polygamous families in Djambougou, one of the villages in the rural city of Tingolé, Fana subprefecture, 2nd administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, in order to realize their rainy season activities. They mainly grow peanuts and millet. They are seeking their third loan from Soro Yiriwaso, and the previous loans ended without problems. With this new loan, they intend to buy seeds, fertilizers, small materials, and to pay for the cost of labour and hoeing of 18 hectares. After the harvest, the production is sold at the following markets : Marka-Coungo, Fana and Tingolé, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

They intend to turn an average profit of XOF 40'000 (ca US$ 85) per campaign

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, small materials, and to pay for the cost of labour and hoeing of 18 hectares

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cajas Reales” que esta ubicado en el distrito de Chucuito, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y es madre de 02.  Tiene estudios superiores (profesoras de educación primaria). Vive en la Comunidad de Chinchero Sector San Bartolomé.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra de lana acrílica.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para compra de lana acrílica para elaboración de artesanías, como títeres de dedo, guantes, chalinas, etc.

Su mayor  deseo es ejercer su carrera, pero por mientras seguir trabajando para sacar adelante a su familia.

A ella le gusta la solidaridad que existe en su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the Community Bank "Cajas Reales" located in the Chucuito district in Puno. She is 37 years old and she is married common law. She is mother of 2. She completed post-secondary education (primary school teacher). She lives in the community of Chinchero in the San Bartolome sector.

She has been with Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) for the past 2 years. Her first loan was in the amount of S/.300 nuevos soles which was invested in the purchase of acrylic yarn.

She now requests a loan in the amount of S/.500 nuevos soles to purchase more acrylic yarn used in the creation of her craft, such as finger puppets, gloves, scarves, etc.

Her greatest wish is to have a career in her field of studies, but for now she has to keep at her work to be able to provide for her family.

She appreciates the spirit of collegiality found in the Community Bank.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase yarn.

loans.name: Sabougnouma 3 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabougnouma 3 est  constitué de 10 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans et  2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Djambougou  un des villages de la commune rurale de Tingolé,  sous préfecture de Fana, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités hivernales. Les spéculations sont l’arachide et le petit mil. Elles sont à leurs troisièmes collaborations avec l’institution, les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, des semences, des intrants, des petits équipements et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 14  hectares.
Les productions seront vendues au niveau de Marka-Coungo, Fana et Tingolé après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40 000FCFA par campagne.
texts.en:
The Sabougnouma 3 group is composed of 10 married women who average 28 years of age and 2 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Djambougou, one of the villages in the rural city of Tingolé, Fana subprefecture, 2nd administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, in order to realize their rainy season activities. They mainly grow peanuts and millet. They are seeking their third loan from Soro Yiriwaso, and the previous loans ended without problems. With this new loan, they intend to buy seeds, fertilizers, small materials, and to pay for the cost of labour and hoeing of 14 hectares. After the harvest, the production is sold at the following markets : Marka-Coungo, Fana and Tingolé, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

They intend to turn an average profit of XOF 40'000 (ca US$ 85) per campaign.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, small materials, and to pay for the cost of labour and hoeing of 14 hectares

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cajas Reales”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Chucuito, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 48 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 02 hijos.  Tiene estudios de secundaria incompleta (4to grado). Vive en la Comunidad de Chinchero Sector Nueva Alianza.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde la fundación del Banco Comunal, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra de lanas para la confección de Artesanías.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1300.00 Nuevos soles, para comprar lana de alpaca para elaborar chompas y lana acrílica para elaborar títeres de dedo, gorros, guantes y mantas.

Su mayor  deseo es seguir trabajando y vender sus productos al por mayor.

A ella le gustan la forma de trabajo y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Community Bank "Cajas Reales" located in the Chucuito district in Puno. She is 48 years old and she is married. She is mother of 2. She has a grade 10 education, and she lives in the Chinchero sector of Nueva Alianza.

She has been with Maneula Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) since the inception of the program. Her first loan was in the amount of S/.300 nuevos soles and the funds were invested in the purchase of wool for use in her crafts.

She now requires a loan in the amount of S/.1300 nuevos soles to purchase alpaca wool to make sweaters and acrylic yarn to make finger puppets, hats, gloves and blankets.

Her greatest wish is to be able to keep working and to sell her products wholesale.

She loves her work and enjoys being able to save money.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wool in different colors.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Carmen pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cajas Reales”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Chucuito, Provincia D. Puno, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 78 años D. edad, estado civil viuda es madre D. 6 hijos todos ya mayores e independientes, no tiene estudios. vive en el Comunidad D. Chinchero Sector Nueva Alianza.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 1 año, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que utilizó para la compra D. lanas para la elaboración D. artesanías en miniaturas.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, para compra D. lana acrílica para la elaboración D. artesanías.  Ella también tiene un puesto D. venta D. condimentos.
 
Su mayor  deseo es continuar trabajando para solventar los gastos familiares.

A ella le gustan las facilidades D.  los préstamos que ofrece Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the “Cajas Reales” Village Bank located in the Chucuito district in the Puno province. She is a 78-year-old widow and mother of six children who are now grown and independent. For the past year she has worked with field partner Manuela Ramos and her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which she used to buy wool for her miniature handicrafts. This time she requests a loan for 1500 nuevos soles to buy acrylic wool for her handicrafts. She also has a stand selling seasonings. Her greatest wish is to continue working to pay off family-related expenses. She likes the ease that the Manuela Ramos loans offer her.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase wool

loans.name: Faustina Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Luisa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cajas Reales”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Chucuito, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 35 años de edad, de estado civil casada, es madre de 4 hijos.  Tiene estudios de secundaria incompleta (3er grado), vive en la Comunidad de Chinchera Sector Nueva Alianza.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que utilizó para la compra de lanas para la elaboración de artesanías.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos soles, para compra de lana para la producción de artesanías en miniatura, como títeres de dedo y animalitos diversos.
 
Su mayor  deseo es continuar trabajando para así poder salir adelante y ayudar en su hogar.

A ella le gustan los ahorros ya que dice que de esa forma también gana dinero.
texts.en:
Luisa belongs to the Cajas Reales Community Bank, which is located in the Chucuito district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 35, married, and has four children. She completed her third year of high school. She lives in the Chinchera community in the Nueva Alianza sector. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year. She used her first loan of 500 PEN to buy wool to make handicrafts. She now needs a loan for 300 PEN to buy wool for the production of her miniature handicrafts like finger puppets of different animals. Her biggest wish is to keep working to be able to get ahead and to be of help at home. She likes the savings, and she says that this way she also makes money.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy different colors of wool

loans.name: Sabougnouma  4 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe Sabougnouma 4 sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 2 enfants et  vivant dans des familles polygames à Djambougou  un des villages de la commune rurale de Tingolé,  sous préfecture de Fana, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités hivernales. Les spéculations sont l’arachide et le petit mil. Elles sont à leurs troisièmes collaborations avec l’institution, les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, des semences,  des intrants, des petits matériels et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 17.5 hectares.
Les productions seront vendues au niveau des marchés de Marka-Coungo, Fana et Tingolé après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40 000FCFA par campagne qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêts et  aider les maris à subvenir aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The ten women of the Sabougnouma 4 group are all married and average 36 years of age and 2 children. They live in polygamous families in Djambougou, one of the villages in the rural city of Tingolé, Fana subprefecture, 2nd administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, in order to realize their rainy season activities. They mainly grow peanuts and millet. They are seeking their third loan from Soro Yiriwaso, and the previous loans ended without problems. With this new loan, they intend to buy seeds, fertilizers, small materials, and to pay for the cost of labour and hoeing of 17.5 hectares. After the harvest, the production will be sold at the following markets : Marka-Coungo, Fana and Tingolé, to a clientele comprising both men and women. They intend to turn an average profit of XOF 40'000 (ca US$ 85) per campaign, to be used to repay the loan and help their husbands to provide for the family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, small materials, and to pay for the cost of labour and hoeing of 17.5 hectares

loans.name: La Union Group 4

texts.en:
Melania M. is the leader of the La Union group, which takes out microloans in the small village of Manchado. Melania started a business selling bedsheets with her first loan, and she has been so successful that she is now on her sixth loan cycle! She is now also selling purses and blouses since there is a high demand for these products in her area. With this loan she will buy more blouses to sell to attract more customers.

Melania lives with her husband and five children. With the success of her loans she has been able to send all of her children to school and provide them with enough food. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver (a very popular form of transport in the Dominican Republic) and is very supportive of her business. Melania hopes that she can grow her business even further so that she might be able to send her children to college one day.

On behalf of Melania and the entire La Union group, thank you for providing opportunities to those who need them most!

loans.use: To purchase blouses to sell

loans.name: Las Mujeres Capacitadas Group

texts.en:
Justa V. is 37 years old and is the coordinator for the Women of Ability microfinance group in Puerta Barrabas, Dominican Republic. She is a single mother and lives at home with her one child, Yeseña.

Justa owns her house from which she cooks and sells food. Among other recipes, she is particularly proud of her pollo frito (fried chicken) and chichaharon, a popular pork dish in Latin America.

With the two loans she has already received and paid back, Justa has been able to buy more ingredients and has recently purchased a larger stove, leading to higher profits. She has only recently been able to make ends meet and pay her bills, thanks in large part to the loans she has been taking from Esperanza. Over the past year, she has improved her lifestyle with a wage that allows her to think past day-to-day subsistence and plan for her family’s future.

Ultimately, Justa would like to open her own restaurant in Puerta Plata. In the short run, she will improve the business in her own home by purchasing increasing amounts of inventory and upgrading her equipment. Your contribution will give her the means to realize these aspirations. Thanks for your consideration.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food and upgraded cooking equipment

loans.name: Veronica Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Verónica López, tiene la edad de 42 años, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino, casada y con un hijo de 18 años de edad, que estudia, su esposo es albañil, doña Verónica trabaja como conserje en una empresa privada desde hace tres años. Lo difícil es que no le han aumentado su salario. Este es su tercer ciclo en Afodenic el cual da las gracias por el apoyo de prestar a plazos para llevar a cabo sus objetivos de hacer mejoras a su vivienda, con este crédito va invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para repellar su cuarto. Sus planes es poder cambiar de trabajo donde gane mejor y le permita sastifacer sus necesidades.
texts.en:
42-year old Señora Verónica López lives in the neighbourhood of Memorial Sandino. She is married and has an 18-year old son who is a student. Her husband is a bricklayer. Verónica has been working as a janitor in a private company for three years. The problem is that her wages have not increased. This is her third loan with Kiva partner Afodenic; Verónica is very grateful that she can pay off her loan in instalments and achieve her goal of improving her home. She plans to use the money to buy building material and plaster the walls of her bedroom. In the future she would like to change job where she will earn more money and allow her to buy the things she needs.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy building material

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Doña Isabel de edad de 42 años, casada, reside en el bario Santa Ana Sur en la capital de Managua, su esposo trabaja como albañil, sus planes es poder seguir mejorando su casa. Su negocio es la venta de ropa y zapatos el cual inicio en sociedad con una amiga. Este crédito lo quiere para hacer mejoras en su casa en levantar el techo. Para esto va a comprar materiales de construcción. Su objetivo es poder tener mas inventario para crecer en las ventas y tener mejores utilidades. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo para hacer sus mejoras.con el crédito anterior reparo su baño y compro materiales de construcción ya que es la única forma de poder construir ya que todo esta caro.
texts.en:
Isabel is 42 years old and married. She lives in the Santa Ana Sur neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. Her husband works as a builder. They hope to be able to continue improving their home. Isabel works selling clothes and shoes, for which she started a business with a friend. This loan will be used to make improvements to their house, raising its roof. For this they will need to purchase construction materials. Isabel's goal is to be able to keep more inventory in order to generate more sales and increase profits. She thanks the institution for its support. With previous loans she was able to repair her bathroom and purchase construction materials. This is the only way they are able build as materials are expensive.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to raise the roof of her home

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa María R. Pérez tiene la edad de 59 años. Es una mujer viuda. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es lun cafetin. Hace más de 30 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que dio inicio a esta actividad desde muy joven ya que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y seguir adelante, por lo que al inicio no tenía un lugar estable donde ofrecer su comida, y se ubicaba en las orillas del parque, mas tarde decide seguir con este negocio y mantenerlo. Por lo que ahora el financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de gaseosas, jugos, granos básicos entre otras cosas. El sueño de Rosa es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa María R. Pérez is 59 years old and a widow. She has 2 children. She runs a cafe. She has been working in this business for 30 years. She started this business when she was very young, as she has always liked to work and get ahead. Initially she did not have a stable place where she could offer her food, and she would work around the park. Later, she decided to continue with and better equip her business. The financing she seeks now will be capital for the purchase of sodas, juices, grains and similar items. Rosa's dream is to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital

loans.name: Martha Del Socorro

texts.es: La Señora Martha del Socorro E. tiene la edad de 51 años. Es una mujer casada. Tiene 4 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica es la venta de granos básicos. Hace más de 6 años que posee este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda. Por lo que sus inicios surgen con muy poco capital, pero con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Por lo que tenía que pagar las cuentas de su vivienda y además proporcionarles a sus hijos estudios y alimentación. Poco a poco fue incrementando su inventario con las pocas ganancias que su negocio le generaba, sus clientes recurrían a su pulpería ya que la atención  de Martha es muy buena y además atiende a sus clientes con una sonrisa en sus labios. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite y maíz. Su mayor sueño es que cada uno de sus hijos logren finalizar sus estudios y que sigan adelante con esta actividad que les ayudo a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Martha del Socorro E. is 51 years old and married. She has four children. She works selling basic grains. She has run this business for more than six years. Her shop is located in her home. Her business is run with little capital, but with much desire to get ahead. She must pay her household expenses as well as provide food and education for her children. Little by little she has increased her inventory using the small income her business generates. Her customers return to her shop because Martha is very helpful and always attends to her customers with a smile. The funds she is requesting will be used as capital to purchase rice, sugar, beans, oil and corn. Her greatest dream is for her children to complete their studies and get ahead. With this work she is able to help them succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Presentacion Jesus

texts.es: El Señor Presentación Jesús Álvarez Áreas, tiene  45 años de edad. Tiene 4 hijos a su cargo, debido a la situación económica que el presenta ninguno de sus hijos estudia. Su actividad económica es el destace y la venta de cerdo. Hace más de seis años que se dedica a este negocio. Anteriormente su mama se hacía cargo del negocio y con forme paso el tiempo se fue instruyendo en este tipo de actividad, debido a las circunstancia su mama presento problemas de salud por lo que él se hizo cargo del negocio y toda la popularidad que poseía la obtuvo por medio de su madre,  pesar de las dificultades que enfrento a como es la crisis económica es por eso que solicita este financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo como es la compra de maíz, masa, leña entre otras cosas. El mayor sueño de Presentación  es de ampliar su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de él y poder dejarles este medio de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
45-year old Señor Presentación Jesús Álvarez Áreas has four children in his care. Due to his financial situation, not one of the children is in school. He earns his living by butchering pigs and selling pork, a job he has been doing for more than seven years. Beforehand, his mother was in charge of the business, and as time passed she taught her son how to do the work. When she got sick, her son took over the business--its popularity is due to the efforts of his mother. Because of the difficulties that Presentación has faced such as the economic crisis, he is seeking a loan for working capital and to buy corn, masa (corn flour), firewood etc. His greatest dream is to expand and improve his business so that his children can continue this way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Success

texts.en:
Success A. is married and her husband is a petty trader. She has received tertiary education.

Success sells a variety of provisions in Tsakpe New Town. She has been selling provisions since 2001 and uses her income in helping her husband in paying the housekeeping expenses and other utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more of the provisions to sell. She hopes to reinvest the new profit in her expanded business.

loans.use: To buy more of the provisions to sell

loans.name: Adela Francisca

texts.es: Adela Francisca Sánchez García tiene la edad de 33 años, es madre soltera. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es ofrecer los servicios de costura. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella inicio con este oficio por cuenta propia, por lo que anteriormente cuando su Papa estaba con vida, el se hacía cargo de los gastos de la familia, pero por debido a las circunstancias su Papa fallece por lo que su Mama empezó a trabajar como doméstica y ayudar junto con su hija a sacar a su familia adelante, ahora Adela se hace cargo todos los gastos de su familia. Y es así que solicita el financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra tela, tijeras, hilos, alfileres entre otros. Sus sueños son de engrandecer su negocio para obtener mejores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Adela Francisca Sánchez García is a 33 year old single mother. She is raising two children. She is a seamstress, and she has worked at this business for more than 15 years. She started this work on her own. Previously, when her father was alive, he was in charge of the family expenses. But, due to the circumstances of her father’s death, her mother started working as a domestic employee. Her mother helped her to keep the family going. Now Adele is in charge of the family expenses. That is why she is asking for a loan to buy fabric, scissors, thread, and needles among other things. Her dreams are to expand her business in order to get better income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es: Magdalena V. M. tiene la edad de53 años. Es madre soltera. Tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, debido a la difícil situación económica del país decide, recorrer las diferentes calles en busca de clientes, ya que no solamente recorría estos lugares sino que también las comarcas aledañas, y fue así que su inventario fue creciendo debido a la buena administración que ella le proporciona a su negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo en la compra de pantalones, camisas, ropa interior, faldas y camisolas. El sueño de Magdalena es comprar un lugar en donde pueda establecerse con sus productos.
texts.en:
Magdalena V. M. is a 53 year old single mother. She is raising one son. She sells clothes. She has been in this business for over five years. Due to the country’s difficult economic situation, she travels the different streets looking for customers. She not only goes to those places, but she also travels to neighboring regions. That is how her inventory has been growing; it is due to her good administration of the business. The loan she is asking for is to buy pants, shirts, underwear, skirts, and undershirts. Magdalena’s dream is to buy a place where she can establish herself with her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Ellas Group

texts.es: El Grupo solidario Ellas está conformado por Dorgeri Guadalupe F. Calderón y Leticia Carolina A. C.. Dorgeri tiene 29 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos, hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este oficio y medio de vida, por lo que es una de sus principales F. de ingresos. Por lo que  solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de lápiz labial, sombras, brillo entre otras cosas. En cambio su amiga Leticia A. C. tiene 27 años de edad. Es madre soltera. Tiene 1 hijo a su cargo y como toda mujer responsable decide realizar la venta de cosméticos, para proporcionarle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida, por lo que es ella quien se hace cargo los gastos de su familia. Por lo que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo y así realizar la compra de perfumes, cremas, lociones entre otras cosas. El sueño de Leticia es mantener este negocio porque es por medio de este oficio que ha logrado trabajar.
texts.en:
El Grupo Solidario Ellas is comprised of Dorgeri Guadalupe F. Calderón and Leticia Carolina A. C.. Dorgeri is 29 years old and is raising one child. She sells cosmetics and has been in this business for more than 3 years, as it is one of her main sources of income. She is asking for this loan for working capital to buy lipstick, shadow, and lip gloss, among other items. Her friend, Leticia A. C. is 27 years old and is a single mother. She has a son and just like any other responsible woman, she decided to sell cosmetics to provide her son with a better quality of life, as she is the one in charge of the family expenses. She is asking for this loan for working capital to purchase perfumes, creams, and lotions, among other items. Leticia’s dream is to maintain her business because it is through this that she has been able to work.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Arelis Yesenia

texts.es: Arelis Yessenia C. López tiene la edad de 26 años, es madre soltera. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio. Anteriormente ella se dedicaba a la venta de especies, por lo que su familia sobrevivía de este negocio, para proporcionar el alimento diario, pero Arelis tenía problemas para cuidar a su Mama,  ya que tenía problemas de salud y esto le ocasionaba mucho cansancio ya que algunas veces no dormía por estar al pendiente con su Mama cuidándola, y la Mañana siguiente tenía que levantarse más temprano para atender el negocio. Por lo que más tarde decide comenzar con la venta de banano, y al ver los ingresos decide seguir adelante con su trabajo. Es por eso que el financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de más bananos. El sueño de Arelis es construir su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Arelis Yessenia C. López is 26 years old and is a single mother. She sells general merchandise and has been doing so for more than 11 years. Previously, she sold spices to provide daily food to her family, who survived on this business. However, Arelis had trouble caring for her mother because of her mother’s health problems. This caused Arelis to be very tired because sometimes she didn’t sleep because she was keeping an eye on her mother. Then, the next morning, she would have to get up early to attend to the business. As a result, Arelis decided to begin selling bananas and decided to continue with this job after seeing the income. It is because of this that Arelis is asking for a loan for working capital to buy more bananas. Arelis’s dream is to build her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kristhel Margota

texts.es: Kristhel Margota C. M. tiene la edad de 25 años. Es una mujer soltera. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella da inicio a este pequeño negocio por que una amiga le entrego mercadería como calzado y ropa, para que la distribuyera a los diferentes clientes, luego de 2 años decide iniciar por cuenta propia y con mucho esfuerzo logra independizarse con el fin de poseer su propio negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de faldas, camisas, pantalones y vestidos. El sueño de Kristhel es seguir adelante con su negocio, ya que enfrento muchos problemas porque no tenía ayuda de nadie.
texts.en:
Kristhel is a 25-year-old single mother. She has been selling clothing for over seven years. She began this small business because a friend gave her merchandise like shoes and clothing for her to distribute to different customers. After two years she decided to start on her own and with a great deal of effort she achieved self-independence and had her own business. The loan that she requests is for the purchase of skirts, shirts, pants, and dresses. Her dream is to keep moving forward with her business since she already faces a lot of problems because she didn’t have anyone’s help.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando M. is 31 years old and runs his own motorcycle repair shop in El Seybo, a medium-sized town in the eastern part of the Dominican Republic. With seventeen years of experience working with motorcycles, and three years in the motorcycle repair business, Armando brings a wealth of skills and expertise to his trade. In a community where most people get around on their own motorcycle (here just called a "motor") or by hiring a motorcycle driver (called a "motoconcho"), Armando's business has no want of customers. 

Yet, Armando is not quite like any of the other motorcycle repairmen in the city. At 8 months old, Armando suffered a terrible fall off of a bed, and has since been unable to walk without the help of leg braces and prosthetics. Despite these constraints, Armando maintains a sunny outlook on life, which makes him very popular in the neighborhood of Ginandiana where he lives and works. Armando also has dreams for his business: he says that he hopes to expand his workshop over time, and he aspires to someday be a great businessman.

This is Armando's first loan from Kiva and Esperanza International, and he intends to invest the loan in his business and buy additional motorcycle replacement parts for his shop. Revenues from Armando's workshop constitute his primary source of income. He currently lives with his mother and younger sister. Here he is pictured in his workshop with some of his merchandise.

loans.use: To buy new replacement parts for motorcycles

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es: La Señora María Elizabeth López López tiene la edad de 21 años. Actualmente es casada. Solamente tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. La actividad económica de María es la venta de mercadería en general. María comenzó este negocio en compañía de su Mama,  hace 35 años ya que desde muy joven  aprendió este negocio y decide seguir adelante con la actividad. Por lo que ahora solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será utilizado para la compra de perfumes, pantalones,cremas, faldas y camisolas. Por lo que necesita diversificar para que sus clientes tengan mayores oportunidades de comprarles sus productos. Su mayor deseo es ampliar su negocio de tal forma que le permita mejorar la situación económica de su familia y brindarle a sus hijos la mejor educación posible.
texts.en:
Ms. María Elizabeth López López is 21 years old. She is currently married and has only one child in her care.

Maria's business is selling general merchandise. She started this business in the company of her her mother who has 35 years of experience in the field, starting from a very young age, and who decided to continue with the profession. She is looking for a loan to buy perfume, pants, creams, skirts, and camisoles, in order to diversify her merchandise and give her clients more opportunities to buy from her.

Her goal is to increase her business to better the economic situation of her family and provide her children the best education possible.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine-V Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying new merchandise

loans.name: Juana Rafaela

texts.es: Juana Rafaela Dávila M. tiene la edad de 51 años. Es madre soltera. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Doña Juana obtuvo este negocio por su Mama ya que, tenía que mantener a su familia por lo que su Mama no tenía el apoyo de sus padres y decidió luchar, con esfuerzo propio, pero al fallecer su Mama fue Juana quien se hizo cargo del negocio, ya que esto le ayudo para que sus hijas pudieran estudiar y aspirar por otros niveles académicos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, jabón y golosinas. El deseo de Juana es lograr que sus hijas culminen su estudios.
texts.en:
Juana Rafaela Dávila M. is 51 years old and a single mother with 3 children. The economic activity to which she is dedicated is a grocery store, to which she has been devoted for more than 15 years. Ms. Juana got this business through her mother who had to sustain her family because her mother did not have the support of her parents and decided to fight, with her own strength; but when her mother died, it was Juana who took charge of the business because this helped so that her daughters could study and aspire to other academic levels. The financing that she solicits is for the working capital to buy basic grains, detergents, soap and candies. The wish that Juana wants to fulfill is that her daughters finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Las Poderosas Group

texts.es: La Asociación Comunal “Poderosas”  es parte del Centro Focal “Villa Adela” cuentan con casi 1 año de vida, con 17 integrantes que tienen variados negocios como: confección de edredones, deportivos, mochilas y otras venden  cosméticos, verduras y fruta, las que se dedican a la confección necesitan el préstamo para comprar materia prima como: tela y forro, las que se dedican al comercio necesitan el préstamo para la compra de mercadería. A las integrantes de “Poderosas” les gusta confraternizar, así que todas se sirven un rico plato organizadas por su presidenta Mercedes C..
texts.en:
The Community Association called Poderosas is part of the Villa Adela community center. They have been in existence for one year. The members have various businesses like making quilts, sports clothes, and backpacks. Some sell cosmetics; others sell fruits and vegetables. The members who make products need a loan to buy raw materials like fabric and lining. The members of the Poderosas like to get together and have great food; the get-togethers are organized by their president, Mercedes C..

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material/merchandise

loans.name: La Union En Progreso Group 2

texts.en:
Juana Barroa is the leader of the group La Union en Progreso (or the Union in Progress) from the small village of Morquecho.

Juana started her business of selling empanadas (a pastry turnover filled with savory ingredients and baked or fried) seven years ago and began taking out loans two years ago to expand her business. She has proven herself extremely credit-worthy and is now on her sixth loan. With this loan she will buy more supplies to make more empanadas, which she sells to her friends, to stores and on the street. Her business has grown so much with these loans that she has been able to buy a motorcycle which allows her to distribute her empanadas to even more locations. 

Juana is the single mother of three children, aged 13, 10, and 8. She says it has been very difficult raising all of them by herself but, with the growth of her business from her loans, she has been able to provide them with enough food and can afford to send them to school. She hopes to continue to grow her businesses so that one day she can send her children to college. 

On behalf of Juana and the entire La Union en Progreso group, thank you for providing opportunities to people who need it most!

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for making empanadas

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: La señora Martha Lorena tiene 39 años de edad, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, su esposo es conductor, tiene un hijo de 10 años de edad que estudia la primaria. Sus planes es poder hacer mejoras a su casa y apoyar a su hijo para que estudie. Su negocio es una pulpería y tiene cinco años que la administra la cual inicio con ahorros y préstamo con la iniciativa de ayudar a sus esposo con los gastos del hogar, y con prestamos que Afodenic otorgo este es su noveno ciclo el cual,  va invertir en la compra de granos básicos, pollo, carnes y productos lácteos que es el alimento diario  de los Nicaragüenses. Con esto espera aumentar sus ventas y captar nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Martha Lorena, 39, lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. Her husband is a driver, and she has a ten year old son who attends elementary school. Her plans are to be able to make improvements on her house and support her son so that he can go to school. She has a mini market, a business she started five years ago. She wanted to help her husband with the household expenses, so she used savings and a loan to start her business. This is her ninth loan cycle with Afodenic. She will use this loan to buy basic grains, chicken, meat, and dairy products. These are daily foods for Nicaraguans. By doing this she hopes to increase her sales and gain more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains, meat, and dairy products

loans.name: Encuentro Con Jesus 3 And 4 Group

texts.en:
Luz N. (second from right) is a thirty-year-old businesswoman who lives about an hour outside of the capital, Santo Domingo, in a city called Los Alcarrizos. She is a coordinator for the Bank of Hope “Encuentro con Jesus” (Encounter with Jesus). While this is the third loan that Luz has taken out with Esperanza International, it is the first loan for many of the other women in her group.

Luz took out her first group loan in February 2008 and has consistently and persistently made her payments. However, the previous members of her group struggled to accept the responsibilities associated with microfinance and thus the group suffered from solidarity and cooperation problems. Esperanza International utilizes group lending, which means that the other members of the group are held responsible if one member defaults. Luz is excited because she has great hope for the responsibility and solidarity of this new group. She shared that it is directly evident that these women are ready to flourish with the opportunity that microfinance provides and are simultaneously ready to be dependable group members.

In February 2008, Luz ran a colmado, a small store that sells primarily durable goods and foods such as rice and potatoes. Almost a year and a half later, Luz now runs a cafeteria where she sells a variety of lunch foods including fresh juices, fried chicken, empanadas (a pastry turnover filled with savory ingredients and baked or fried), and tostados (a tortilla fried in deep fat with various fillings piled on it). Currently, Luz is unable to satisfy the demands of her customers (certainly a good problem to have); thus, she will use her loan to purchase more primary materials so she can expand the amount of food she produces with her mother.

Luz hopes to use her increased profits to not only expand her business but also to save up to replace her tin roof with a more stable cement block roof since it rains frequently in Los Alcarrizos. This new roof will truly be a manifestation of the stability and improvement that microfinance can foster.

Luz lives with her husband, who sells construction materials, and her two children (4 and 6). She is excited for her children’s future and wants them to grow up studying hard, attending church, and making good friends. The children are not the only ones studying in this family. In fact, Luz has been taking night classes in the capital. While she is currently between sessions, she plans to resume classes in August. 

On behalf of Luz N., the Bank of Hope Encuento con Dios, and the microfinance institute Esperanza International, thank you for providing opportunities to those who need it most!

loans.use: To buy more primary materials for cooking

loans.name: Edwing Antonio

texts.es: Don Edwin C. tiene 36 años de edad, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, su esposa le tiene tres hijos de 6,17 y 19 años de edad, los cuales estudian y ella trabaja como docente de primaria para apoyar a su hogar. El señor Edwin es dueño de una unidad de Taxi  el cual día a día recorre la ciudad de Managua, para obtener el sustento de su familia, aunque cansado por la trayectoria que hace buscando cliente. Tiene cuatro años de trabajar como cadete, anteriormente trabajaba en una empresa privad, pero al recortaron personal y con su liquidación compro el taxi. Con esta solicitud de crédito lo invertirá en repuestos y mantenimiento de la unidad de taxi para dar un buen servicio al usuarios. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo con sus préstamos a plazo ya que podrá realizar las mejoras. Su meta es poder tener otra taxi para obtener mejoras utilidades.
texts.en:
Edwin C., 36, lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. He and his wife have three children; they are 6, 17, and 19 years old. The children go to school. His wife works as an elementary school teacher to help the household. Edwin has a taxi. He uses it every day to travel the streets of Managua in order to support his family, even though he gets very tired from his travels looking for customers. He has worked as a driver for four years. Before that he worked for a private business. But, they cut back on personal, and with the liquidation he bought the taxi. He will use the loan to invest in replacement parts and maintenance for his taxi to be able to give his customers good service. He is grateful to the institution for the support of loans and terms because he will be able to make the improvements. His goal is to be able to have another taxi to get better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement parts and do maintenance on his vehicle

loans.name: Mirna Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Mirna del Socorro es una mujer trabajadora que a sus 57 años de edad, sigue en las ventas y con el deseo de lograr una tienda botánica, su labor es la venta de medicina botánica el cual le ha ido bien ya que las personas optan por productos naturales. Reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, tiene dos hijos mayores de 25 y 30 años de edad. Este negocio lo inicio con fondo que su familia otorgo. Este es su noveno ciclo de préstamo en Afodenic el cual va invertir en la compra de productos botánico para elevar las venta y obtener mas ganancia. Sus planes para personales es poder hacer unas mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mima del Socorro is a hard working woman of 57 years. She continues working in sales with the goal of having a botanical store. Her work, selling botanical medicine, has been going well since people are choosing natural products. She lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the capital of Managua and has two older children, 25 and 30 years old. She began this business with funds her family provided. This is her ninth loan cycle with AFODENIC and she will invest it in the purchase of botanical products to increase her sales and increase her earnings. Her personal plans are to be able to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy botanical products

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Doña Ángela tiene la edad de 53 años, casada con cuatro hijos mayores de edad, reside en el barrio Manuel Fernández en la capital de Managua, su esposo es supervisor industrial. Su negocio es una pulpería que inició hace un año con el propósito de generar ingresos esto lo logro con prestamos que Afodenic presto y ahorros que tenia. Sus planes es poder hacer mejoras a su casa. Con este préstamo lograra invertir en granos básicos, productos enlatados, cereales, carnes, y otros productos para obtener mejores ventas. Sus metas es poder crecer en inventario para mejores beneficios.
texts.en:
Doña Ángela is 53 years old, married with four adult children, and lives in the neighborhood Manuel Fernández in the capital Managua with her husband, an industrial supervisor. Her business is a grocery store she started a year ago to increase her income with the help of a loan from Afodenic and her own savings. Her plan is to make improvements to her home.

With this loan she wants to invest in grains, canned goods, cereals, meat, and other products to obtain better sales. Her goal is to increase inventory to increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grains and canned goods

loans.name: Fatima De Jesus

texts.es: La joven Fátima de Jesús G., tiene la edad de 26 años, tiene una hija que cursa la primaria, su esposo es mecánico y reside en el barrio Sabana Grande en la capital de Managua. Tiene una comidería que desde hace ocho años administra, este negocio lo inicio con prestamos y ayuda de su esposo. Con este préstamo lo quiere invertir en granos básicos, carnes, productos lácteos y otros de consumo diario para sus clientes. Lo cual espera incrementar las ventas para tener mejores ganancias y poder ahorrar para que sus pequeña pueda tener un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Fátima de Jesús G. is 26 years old and has a daughter in elementary school. Her husband is a mechanic and lives in the Sabana Grande neighborhood of the capital city of Managua. She has an eatery that she has been managing for eight years. She started the business with loans and the help of her husband. With this loan, she wants to invest in staple grains, meats, dairy products and other daily use items for her customers. She hopes to increase sales to have better profits and to be able to save so that her daughter can have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy staple grains, meats, and other products to prepare delicious dishes.

loans.name: Rudy Domingo

texts.es: Don Rudy T. tiene 28 años de edad, es Soltero de oficios Sastre,  “Confección de Playeras” cuenta con un taller de 3 maquinas, habita junto  a sus Papas, él y sus Papas se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 6 años de elaborar Playeras en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Estación Rodríguez Cantón Nimapá, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Rudy T. is single, 28 years old, and makes t-shirts. He has a shop with 3 machines and lives with his parents. He and his parents share the same profession and they have 2 employees. He has made t-shirts for 6 years from his home, which is located in Paraje Estación Rodríguez Cantón Nimapá in the department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. Currently, customer demand has increased. However, the current economic conditions do not allow him to increase his capital, which is why he is turning to Asociación ASDIR to ask for a loan so that he can buy raw materials. This way, he can increase his sales, hoping to be able to help his family get ahead and have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to buy raw materials

loans.name: Fatima Del Socorro

texts.es: La joven Fátima del Socorro tiene la edad de 29 años, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, soltera y con una hija que estudia la primaria. Trabaja en una empresa de la zona franca el cual lleva nueve años laborando,  a pesar que no es un buen salario ha podido subsistir. Su anhelo es poder terminar de hacer su casa ya que es insegura y esta dispuesta a robo ya que su casa la mitad es de concreto y la otra de láminas de zinc pero que están en mal estado. Con este crédito va a comprar materiales de construcción para hacer las paredes de concreto y poder tener una casa digna para su hija. Da las gracias  Afodenic por el apoyo con los préstamos a plazo ya que es la única manera para sobresalir adelante.
texts.en:
Fatima del Socorro is 29 years old, and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the capital, Managua. She is single, and has a daughter in elementary school. She has been working for 9 years in a free trade zone business, and even though she does not make a good salary, she has been able to survive.

Her wish is to be able to finish building her house, since it is unsafe and ready to be robbed. Half of her house is made of wood, and the other half of zinc sheets, but they are in bad condition. With this loan, she is going to buy construction materials in order to build concrete walls and to be able to have a decent home for her daughter. She thanks AFODENIC for the support with the term loans, since it is the only way to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a concrete wall

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Ángela tiene 44 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus hijos. Desde hace más de 5 años se dedica a la crianza de cuyes, en un espacio que habilitó en su casa para esto. Todos los días se levanta muy temprano para realizar la limpieza y alimentación de sus cuyes para que los fines de semana los venda en la feria de animales de su localidad. También hay algunas personas que le hacen pedidos para evento o banquetes donde el plato principal será el cuy. Con los años de experiencia, Ángela ha notado que este negocio es muy rentable, además de la ventaja de estar en su casa para poder atender a su familia, convirtiéndose en un sostén más de la economía de su familia. El gran deseo de Ángela es tener un espacio más grande y adecuado para criar cuyes con calida de exportación. Esta es la séptima vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está muy contenta de haber trabajado durante varios ciclos con su banco comunal, donde es conocida como una de las integrantes más colaboradoras. El dinero que está solicitando será invertido en la compra de semillas para sembrar alfalfa para alimentar a sus cuyes y nuevos galpones.
texts.en:
Ángela is 44 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and children. She has been selling guinea pigs for more than five years, and has arranged a space in her house for them. She gets up early everyday to clean and feed her guinea pigs so that she can sell them at the local animal market on weekends. She also has people who make requests for events or banquets where the main dish will be guinea pig. With years of experience, Ángela has noticed that this business is very profitable, in addition to the advantage of being at home to attend to her family, which has made her more of an economic support for her family.
