Ángela’s biggest wish is to have a bigger, more adequate space to raise export quality guinea pigs. This is her seventh loan with MFP and she is very happy to have worked several cycles with the communal bank, where she is known as one of the most collaborating members. The money that she is asking for will be invested in the purchase of seeds to plant alfalfa to feed her guinea pigs and for new barns.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase alfalfa seeds and barns for her animals

loans.name: Flor De Vida Group

texts.es: En el Centro Focal “Villa Adela” se encuentra la Asociación Comunal “Flor de vida” con 13 integrantes, todas tienen diferentes negocios como; venta de medias, juguetes, detergentes, fruta, carne y otros, ellas necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería y así tener mayor movimiento económico, solo como ejemplo Julia M. necesita el préstamo para diversificar sus productos, ahora quiere comprar deportivos porque  ha visto que tiene más demanda.
texts.en:
In the community center of Villa Adela, you will find the “Flor de Vida” communal bank group with its 13 members. All of them have different retail businesses: socks, toys, detergents, fruit, meat and other items. They need a loan to purchase merchandise and improve their cash flow.

One example is Julia M., who needs a loan to diversify her inventory of products. She wants to buy sportswear since it is in great demand.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo y sus 7 hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a la venta de comida típica de su zona, la cual está hecha a base de carne de cerdo y de oveja que ella misma cría en su establo desde hace 10 años. Pero Carmen se inició vendiendo estos platillos hace 26 años con muy poco capital, comprando apenas unos kilos de carne y con el tiempo y sus ahorros pudo adquirir sus propios animales. Diariamente por las mañanas cuida y limpia a sus animales, ya que por las tardes y los fines de semana se ocupa de preparar la comida y de venderla en las principales calles, festividades o cualquier evento social de su localidad. Con el paso del tiempo ha notado el resultado de su esfuerzo en las ganancias  satisfactorias que obtiene, por lo que desea seguir trabajando en este tipo de negocio y adquirir más animales que le permitan mayores ganancias. Esta es la octava vez que Carmen tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es muy solidaria y emprendedora en el banco comunal que integra y desea seguir adelante en el trabajo con su grupo. El dinero que ahora está solicitando será invertido en la compra de cerdos y ovejas en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Carmen is 47 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and her 7 children. She sells food typical to the region which she makes using pork and sheep meat that she has been raising herself in her stable for 10 years. Carmen began selling these dishes 26 years ago with very little money, buying only a few kilos of meat and over time, with her savings, she was able to buy her own animals. Each morning, she cleans and takes care of her animals because she spends the afternoons and weekends preparing the food and selling it on the main streets, at festivities, or at any social event in her area. Over time, she has noticed the results of her efforts in the satisfactory earnings that she has obtained. As a result, she wants to continue working in this type of business and purchase more animals that will provide her with larger earnings. This is Carmen’s eighth loan with MFP. She is very supportive and enterprising at the communal bank and she hopes to continue moving forward with her group. The money that she is asking for will be invested in the purchase of wholesale pigs and sheep.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more animals

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 54 años, es viuda y vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 20 años cría animales, ya que desde hace muchos años atrás su familia se ha dedicado a estas actividades, pero Maria también cultiva la tierra sembrando papa y maíz principalmente; sus animales los lleva a zonas donde haya praderas de abundantes pastos frescos para alimentarlos, esto lo hace con la ayuda de sus hijos. Después de varios meses, según el peso y tamaño de sus animales los vende en la feria ganadera de su zona. Para su futuro, Maria planea intensificar su actividad ganadera, obteniendo mayores cabezas de ganado. Esta es la sexta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está muy agradecida con su banco comunal porque es un gran espacio para fomentar la solidaridad, es por eso que renueva su compromiso de trabajo. El dinero que ahora está solicitando será destinado a la compra de un torete de raza para incrementar la cantidad de animales que posee.
texts.en:
Maria is 54 years old, a widow, and she lives with her 2 children in her own house. For more than 20 years she has been breeding animals as her family did for many years before, but Maria also farms sowing mostly potatoes and corn. She takes the animals to areas with abundant fresh grassland with the help of her children. Several months later the animals are sold at the stockbreeders' fair according to weight and size. For the future, Maria plans to increase her stockbreeding activities buying more cattle. This is her sixth loan with MFP and she is very grateful to the community bank for being a space that promotes solidarity and therefore she renews her work commitment. The requested loan will be spent to buy a young bull of breed in order to increase the number of animals.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a young bull

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío tiene 36 años, vive con su hijo de 11 años en la casa de su hermana. Desde hace 6 meses tiene un negocio propio, el cual es una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad. Antes lo hacía de manera ambulante, pero su hermana la apoyó en este proyecto para instalar la tienda en su casa. Rocío atiende todos los días, incluido los domingos, para poder tener los ingresos necesarios para los gastos de su hogar. Durante este tiempo de trabajo está empezando a ver los frutos de su esfuerzo. Para un futuro cercano le gustaría tener una tienda más completa, con variedad de productos y ampliar el espacio de su negocio. Esta es la primera vez que tiene una experiencia de trabajar con MFP, ella ingresó a este grupo por invitación de los demás integrantes al informarle de las ventajas de trabajar en equipo por el bienestar común. El dinero que ahora está solicitando será destinado a la compra de mercadería en abarrotes.
texts.en:
Rocio is 36 years old, she lives with her 11 year-old son in the house of her sister. For the past 6 months she has had her own business where she sells groceries. Before that she used to be a street vendor, but her sister supported her with this project to set up a store at her house. Rocío works every day, including Sunday, in order to obtain the necessary income to cover the family expenses.She is now starting to see the fruits of her effort. For the near future she would like to have a store with more variety of products and increase the space of her store. This is the first time she has the experience of working with MFP, she entered the group on invitation from the other members as they explained to her the advantage of working in a team for the common well-being. The loan requested will be spent on buying groceries.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene tiene 36 años, es una mujer muy atenta y trabajadora, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 2 hijos, en la casa de su madre y tiene muchos anhelos de casarse. La siembra de sus productos agrícolas es su actividad diaria, de pequeña se levantaba a las 4 de la mañana en apoyo de su madre para el preparado del almuerzo de los numerosos peones que trabajaban en las cosechas de papas y arvejas. Ahora, con su esposo, no sólo siembran esos productos, sino también los comercializa. Marlene es una mujer muy que le gusta bromear y es muy atenta con sus clientes, es por ello que cada vez que sus arvejas están listas, ella se encargada de realizar los tratos con los comerciantes del mercado mayorista, buscando un mejor precio para captar mayores ingresos, mientras que su esposo la ayuda cargando y contabilizando los sacos del producto. En el caso de las cosechas de papas, prefieren enviarlas al mercado mayorista de Lima por generarle mayores ganancias, ya que con ese dinero cubren la alimentación y educación de sus hijos. Para más adelante, Marlene piensa comprar más terrenos cultivables para incrementar sus siembras. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP; durante los anteriores periodos trabajados demostró puntualidad en sus pagos, asimismo trata de no faltar a las reuniones de su banco comunal, donde la estiman todos sus compañeros. Con el dinero solicitado invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes químicos, para sus siembras de papas y arvejas.
texts.en:
Marlene, 36 years of age, is a very careful and hardworking woman. She lives in her mother’s house with her partner, the father of her 2 children, and they intend to marry. Every day they tend to the crops raised on their farm. Ever since she was little, Marlene wakes up at 4am to help her mother prepare lunch for the many laborers who work in the fields planting potatoes and peas. Along with her husband, not only does she help plant the crops, but she also sells them.

Marlene is a lighthearted woman who is very attentive to her customers. When her crops are ready to be sold, she is in charge of making deals with traders in the wholesale market, always looking to get the best price and generate more income. Meanwhile, her husband is responsible for taking orders and keeping track of the sacks of produce. With her potato crops, she prefers to ship them to the wholesale markets in Lima because she can earn bigger profits over there. The extra income helps to cover her food bill and her children’s education expenses. At a later point, Marlene thinks she should buy more farmland to increase her crop yield.

This is her tenth loan from MFP, and the payments from her previous loans have been on time. She tries not to miss her communal bank meetings, where she is regarded by the other group members. The money she requested will be used to buy chemical fertilizers for her crops of potatoes and peas.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Suma Yawar Group

texts.es: “Suma Yawar” es una Asociación Comunal con casi 7 años de vida, su presidenta es Teodosia T., ella menciona  que a las integrantes del grupo les gusta asistir a las reuniones porque comparten, hablan y se olvidan de sus problemas. La mayoría se dedica a la venta de ropa de niño, mujer y hombre y otras a la venta de calzados, huevo y comida. Todas necesitan el préstamo para la compra de mercadería y así tener variados productos que ofertar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
“Suma Yawar” is Community Association with 7 years of life. The Association’s president is Teodosia T.; she mentions the group members enjoy attending their meetings because they share, talk, and forget their problems. The majority of the members sell clothing for children, women, and men, and others sell shoes, eggs, and food. They all need this loan to purchase merchandise to be able to offer clients varied products.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Adela Megina

texts.es:
Adela, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Ana”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 44 años y es madre de 01 hijo que aun depende de ella.

Con la seguridad de tener una buena sazón para la preparación de diferentes tipos de comidas, por iniciativa propia con  su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 emprendió su negocio de venta de comida diaria tipo menú, ubicada en su misma casa.

En la actualidad, pese al tiempo transcurrido continúa con el mismo negocio, contando con una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su puesto de venta, donde ella los atiende con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 2.000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como sacos de arroz, azúcar; aceite en paquetes, pollos en javas y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Esta preparada para todo y aun se siente con muchas fuerzas para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante, Adela, agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Adela belongs to the Village Bank “Santa Ana” in the Moyobamba District, Province of Moyobamba, Department of San Martin. She lives with her partner, is 44 years old, and is a mother to 1 child that depends on her. With the security of having a great seasoning mix to prepare different types of foods, and with her own initiative, she used her first loan of 300 PEN to launch her business in the sale of food; she sells meals daily in her business which is located in her home. Currently, though time has passed she continues in the same business, relying on a loyal client base that seeks her food stall daily, where she attends to them with the charisma that she is known for. With this loan of 2,000 PEN, she will purchase supplies to prepare her daily meals such as a sack of rice, sugar, oil in packages, chicken, and also utensils to use in her business that will allow her to give her clients a better service. She is ready for anything and still feels strong enough to continue working and continue moving forward. Adela thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies to prepare her food.

loans.name: Beti

texts.es:
La señora Beti, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Está Casada, tiene 45 años, 04 hijos, 02 que aun están bajo su poder y están estudiando.

Su fuerza  y anhelo de sacar adelante a sus hijos, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes, que se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa, un ambiente muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. 

Las ganancias que genera a diario le ayuda a mejorar el ingreso económico de su familia. Desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes y hoy en la actualidad tiene clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su puesto a comprar porque ella  tiene todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad y carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,500.00, comprará sacos de arroz y azúcar, fideos, sal y aceite en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Beti, se siente muy bien, para continuar trabajando y se prepara día a día para asumir los retos  que la vida le presenta y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Beti belongs to the Community Bank “Mujeres Emprendedoras” in the Moyobamba District, San Martin Province, Department of San Martin. She is married, 45 years old and has 4 children, 2 of whom she is still responsible for and are studying.

Her strength and desire to give her children a future motivated her to start up her own business selling groceries, which she runs from her home in an environment that has been tailored to best serve her customers.

Her daily earnings enable her to increase her family’s income. From the day she started out, she has been winning customers and now she has regulars who come to her each day because they can buy all the products that a housewife needs and she personally serves them with her characteristic kindness and charm.

With this loan of 2,500 soles she will buy bags of rice and sugar, packets of noodles, salt and oil, milk and various brands of tinned fish, eggs and personal hygiene products so as to continue offering the best service to her customers.

Beti is glad to continue with her work and prepares every day to meet life’s challenges. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping women like herself to have opportunities and develop in their professions.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries to add to her product range

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
La señora Consuelo, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 42 años, 04 hijos que aun dependen de ella.

Se dedica a la Venta de Aguajes y diferentes preparados a base de maní, desde hace muchos años atrás, se inició con un capital de S/. 100.00, hoy en día continúa con el mismo negocio en horas de la mañana y tardes, en un esquina, frente a la Botica “Central” de la Ciudad de Moyobamba, donde hay mucho movimiento y sus ventas le salen a pedir de boca. Nos cuenta que le va muy bien en sus ventas y esta muy  contenta con lo que hace.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará 50 sacos de aguajes (fruta silvestre de esta parte del país). Como complemento también comprara sacos de maní, para preparar sus manís salados, dulces y confitados.

Se siente muy contenta, ya que pese a las dificultades supo salir adelante junto a su familia, por lo que reconoce el gran apoyo que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos le viene brindando a ella y otras mujeres de la región San Martín.
texts.en:
Consuelo belongs to the Community Bank “Mujeres Emprendedoras” in the Moyobabma District, Moyobamba Province, Department of San Martin. She lives with her partner, is 42 years old and has 4 dependent children.

She sells aguajes and different items made from peanuts. Many years ago she started out with 100 soles and now continues the same business in the mornings and the afternoons, on a corner opposite the “Central” pharmacy in the town of Moyobamba where it is very busy and her sales come from word of mouth. She tells us that her sales are very good and that she is very happy in what she does.

With this loan of 3,000 soles she will buy 50 bags of aguajes (a wild fruit from this part of the country). She will also buy bags of peanuts with which to prepare her salted and sweet peanut snacks.

She is very happy that despite her difficulties she has moved forward together with her family and recognises the huge help that the Manuela Ramos Movement has given to her and to other women in the San Martin region.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of aguajes (local wild fruit) and peanuts

loans.name: Cori

texts.es:
La señora Cori, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Ramón Castilla”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 30 años y es madre de 02 hijos, los 02 aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de ropas y tenia que viajar a los pueblos aledaños, para ofrecer su mercadería. Para el implemento de su nuevo negocio Cori se inicio, con un capital de 250.00.
Nos cuenta que tuvo que pasar por altas y bajas, para llegar a ser una pequeña empresaria y administrar su propio negocio y generar sus propios ingresos, sin dar cuentas a nadie. 
Por ser una Mujer trabajadora y el esfuerzo que le puso, llego a implementar ahora su bodega, es muy conocida por sus clientes en el barrio donde vive y sus ventas diarias son buenas. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su misma casa.

Este préstamo de S/. 700.00, lo invertirá en la compra de más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en sacos, insumos para el aseo personal, gaseosas en paquetes y productos variados para mantener contenta a su clientela. 

Ella es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante para el bienestar de su familia y de ella misma. 

Cori, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer, así mismo ayudar a otras mujeres a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Cori belongs to the Community Bank “Ramon Castilla” in the Tarapoto District, Department of San Martin. She is married, 30 years old and is the mother of 2 children, both of whom are dependent upon her and are studying.

Previously she sold clothes for a living and had to travel to surrounding towns to sell her merchandise. Cori started with 250 pesos to set up her new business. She tells us that she had to work long and hard to succeed at being a small entrepreneur and to be able to run her own business, generating her own income without having to rely on anyone else.

She is now well known in her local area as a working woman who put in a lot of effort to set up her shop and her daily sales are good. She runs this business from her own home.

This loan of 700 soles will buy more products for her business such as bags of rice and sugar, personal hygiene products, fizzy drinks and various products to keep her customers happy.

She is a woman eager to move forward in life for her and her family’s wellbeing.

Cori is grateful to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as an entrepreneur and as a woman, as well as helping other women to get on in life.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries to increase her stock

loans.name: Erica Consuelo

texts.es:
La señora Erica Consuelo, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 29 años y es madre de 03 hijos, los 03 que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Ante la necesidad de aportar al ingreso económico de su hogar, motivada por su mamá emprendió un pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 obteniendo muy buenos resultados desde un inicio por la calidad de sus productos, sus precios cómodos y la buena atención al cliente.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su propia casa, donde sus principales clientes son los vecinos y amigos de su barrio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en kilos, huevos en javas,  insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes, golosinas  y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela.

Hoy se siente muy feliz de la labor y servicio que brinda y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Ms. Erica Consuelo is a member of Mujeres Emprendedoras Community Bank in the District of Moyobamba, Moyobamba Province, State of San Martin. She is 29 years old and a single mother of three. She supports her children, all of whom go to school. Since she needed to contribute financially at home, and encouraged by her mother, Ms. Erica Consuelo launched a small grocery business with her first loan of S/.300.00. She was successful right from the start thanks to the high quality of her products, fair prices and excellent customer service. She currently operates this same business out of her home. Neighbors and local acquaintances are her main customers. With the loan of S/. 3,000.00, she will buy additional products to add variety to the merchandise she sells. She plans to buy rice and sugar in kilogram packages, eggs in cartons, cleaning products and personal hygiene items, packaged soft drinks, sweets and other products attractive to her customers. She is very happy with her endeavors and the service she provides and is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for supporting people like her, who want to work and get ahead. She hopes the organization will be around for a long time and willing to help many more families and enterprising women.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries and improve her store offerings

loans.name: Exsilda's Group

texts.es:
La señora Exsilda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Ana”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 63 años y 10 hijos, todos ya independientes y cada uno con su familia.

Exsilda es una mujer luchadora, que a su edad le gusta trabajar y generar sus propios ingresos, decidió implementar su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes, que se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, empezó poco a poco y ahora a mejorado bastante y sus productos están al alcance de sus clientes y amas de casas, donde encuentran lo que necesitan. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien.  

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal, paquetes de gaseosas de diferentes sabores y marcas para de esta manera satisfacer y brindar una mejor  atención a sus clientes. 

Exsilda, se siente una mujer muy satisfecha con lo que ha  logrado. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y a cumplir sus sueños y metas y otras  mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Ms. Exsilda is a member of Santa Ana Community Bank in the District of Moyobamba, Moyobamba Province, State of San Martin. She is 63 years old and has 10 children, all of whom are own their own and raise their own families. She lives with her common law husband. Ms. Exsilda is determined and strong-willed. At her age, she still wants to work and earn a living. She decided to start her own grocery business in her home. She started gradually and has improved it considerably. Her products are within reach of her customers and housewives, who are able to find what they need at her store. She currently owns the same business and reports that things are going well. With the S/ 1,000.00 loan she will buy rice and sugar by the sack, packaged noodles, a variety of brands of boxed milk and canned fish, cleaning supplies and personal hygiene items, as well as several flavors and brands of soft drinks that will allow her to better meet her customers' needs. Ms. Exsilda is very satisfied with her success. She would like to thank the Manuela Ramos Movement for the help provided to launch her business and fulfill her dreams and goals, and for the help they provide other enterprising women.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries with the goal of offering a greater variety

loans.name: Grimanesa

texts.es:
La señora Grimanesa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Ana”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 63 años y 07 hijos que ya son independientes.

Grimanesa, se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo, nos cuenta que para empezar tuvo que pasar por muchas dificultades, se inicio poco a poco y ahora ya tiene un negocio establecido ubicado en el Mercado Central de la ciudad, un ambiente acondicionado tanto para ella como para sus clientes, esta muy orgullosa por haber salido adelante con el apoyo de Manuela Ramos que le ayudo bastante a mejorar su servicio. 

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su puesto en el mercado a comprar  carne y  es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará 04 cerdos enteros desvicerados. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando cuchillos y bandejas nuevas.

Grimanesa, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de seguir adelante hasta donde Dios le de vida. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio a ella y a otras mujeres Sanmartinenses.
texts.en:
Ms. Grimanesa is a member of Santa Ana Community Bank in the District of Moyobamba, Moyobamba Province, State of San Martin. She is single and has seven children, all of whom are on their own.

Ms. Grimanesa sells pork for a living. She has told us that she had to overcome many difficulties at the beginning and started her business gradually. Her business is now well established in the city's Central Market, in an area well equipped for her and her customers. She is very proud to have been able to get ahead with the support of the Manuela Ramos Movement, which helped her considerably to improve her services.

She currently operates the same business and has a loyal customer base. Her customers come to her stall at the market to buy meat on a daily basis, where she personally takes care of them with her usual charisma.

With this S/. 2,000.00 loan she will buy four eviscerated pigs. She will use a portion of the money to buy new knives and trays.

Ms. Grimanesa is very satisfied with her accomplishments and is eager to continue to get ahead as long as God gives her the ability to do so. She thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for the help provided in establishing her business and those of other women in San Martin.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy 4 whole eviscerated pigs

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 50 años y 01 hijo que aun depende de ella.

Desde hace muchos años, Charito se dedica a la venta de leña, en sus inicios nos cuenta que le fue un poco bajo en sus ventas, pero con el tiempo ya sus amigos, vecinos y familiares, conocían su negocio y sus ventas aumentaron. Se inicio con S/. 300.00 y poco a poco fue ahorrando, en la actualidad complementó   su negocio con la venta de  juanes, ubicada en su misma casa.

Uno de sus sueños y metas por lograr, es implementar una bodega grande de abarrotes, para generar más ingresos y aportar económicamente dentro de su hogar.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00, comprará 2,780 unidades de leña. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en insumos para preparar sus juanes como: arroz   y pollo en kilos, colorantes  y hojas de bijao. 

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Isabel belongs to the Community Bank of Entrepreneurial Women in the District of Moyobamba, San Martin Province, in the Department of San Martin. She lives with her partner, is 50 years old, and has one child that is still dependent on her. For many years Charito has worked selling firewood. When she began, she tells us, her sales were a little low but with time once her friends, neighbors, and family learned of her business her sales grew. She began with 300 Soles and little by little continued to save. Now she has added to her business with the sale of juanes [leafy packets stuffed with rice, chicken, and olives] from her own house. One of her dreams and goals to achieve is to start a large grocery store in order to generate more income and contribute economically in her home. With this loan of 1,200 Soles she will buy 2,780 units of firewood. Part of the money will also be invested in supplies to prepare the juanes, like rice, chicken by the kilo, food colors, and bijao [an Amazonian plant] leaves. These days she feels like a very fulfilled woman with more hopes of reaching her dreams and making them real. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her begin her business and also for helping many other women who want to succeed in business.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy 2780 units of firewood and supplies to prepare her juanes

loans.name: Jeysi

texts.es:
La señora Jeysi, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Ana”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 24 años y no tiene hijos.

El espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes al por mayor, donde por ahora se esta estableciendo, ya que se cambió de su casa a un local alquilado, ubicado en una parte céntrica de la ciudad, poco a poco esta siendo conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad. 

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio donde vende todo el día. Tiene mucho tiempo trabajando en este negocio y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00,  comprará abarrotes como: 40 paquetes de papel higienico, 10 cajas de bocaditos, galletas, biscuitas, chicitos, leches y aceites. Vende diferentes abarrotes surtidos; para así de esta manera mantener a sus clientes satisfechos y contentos. 
  
Jeysi, se siente muy tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Jeysi belongs to the Santa Ana Community Bank in the Moyabamba district, Moyabamba province, San Martín department. She is 24, in a common law marriage, and she does not have children. The fighting spirit that has always characterized her and the desire to get ahead by her own means served her well in setting up her own business. She sells wholesale groceries. She moved the business from her house to a rented location, which is located in a center part of the city. Little by little she is becoming known among her customers. She is now doing very well in her business. She is currently continuing with the same business, where she sells all day. She spends a lot of time working in her business, and she is very happy with what she does. With this loan for 1,000 PEN she will buy groceries like 40 packages of toilet paper, 10 boxes of snacks, crackers, biscuits, cheese chips, milk, and oil. She sells different stocked groceries. This is the way to keep her customers satisfied and happy. Jeysi feels happy and peaceful with what she does, and she is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to increase the amount in her store

loans.name: Julisa

texts.es:
La señora Julisa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 37 años, 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Julisa, una mujer que se siente capaz de cumplir sus metas, por lo que decidió implementar su propio negocio. Nos cuenta que se inicio con la venta de  bebidas que los vendía en su misma casa, poco a poco fue ahorrando y juntando su propio capital y con el prestamo de Manuela Ramos implementó su negocio de venta de abarrotes, ubicada en su misma casa y hoy ya tiene mucha experiencia en este tipo de actividad, es muy conocida y muy querida entre sus clientes.  

En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su tienda a comprar donde cuenta con todo lo necesario que el ama de casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Julisa, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de seguir adelante y hacer realidad sus sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarial.
texts.en:
Ms. Julisa C. is a member of the “Mujeres Emprendedoras” Microfinance Institute in the Moyobamba district and province, department of San Martin. She is a 37-year-old married mother with 2 children who still depend on her financially. Julisa, a woman who feels capable of reaching her goals, decided to start her own business. She states that she started out by selling beverages from home. Little by little, she kept saving up her own money, and with the loan from Manuela Ramos, she established her general store, located in her house. She is now very experienced in this business, and is well-known and loved by her customers. She currently has faithful customers who frequent her store daily to shop because they can find everything a homemaker needs. She personally attends to her customers with the charm that she is noted for. With this 1,500.00 PEN loan, she will purchase sacks of rice and sugar, packages of noodles, crates of milk, boxes of assorted brands of canned fish, household cleaning tools, and personal hygiene products so that she can continue giving the best customer service. Julisa now feels very fulfilled and has the desire to keep moving forward and making her dreams come true. She gives thanks to Manuela Ramos for helping her to start her own business, as well as for having helped other women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods for general store

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
La señora María Victoria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 69 años, 12 hijos que ya son independientes y tiene su familia.

María Victoria, es una mujer luchadora, se dedica a la venta de verduras y a su edad no tiene dificultad de seguir adelante con el trabajo que realiza, nos cuenta que se siente muy bien con lo que hace, se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. para ir al mercado central de la Ciudad de Moyobamba, para vender sus productos.

En la actualidad ya es conocida por sus clientes, que a diario acude a su puesto a comprar donde cuenta con todo lo necesario que el ama de casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00, comprará sacos de yucas, sacos de frejoles, y otros productos para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Vicki, como le dicen de cariño hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de seguir adelante hasta donde Dios le de las fuerzas. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por haberla ayudado a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria Victoria A. is a member of the “Mujeres Emprendedoras” Microfinance Institute in the Moyobamba district and province, department of San Martin. She is a 69-year-old married mother with 12 children who are all independent and have their own families.

Maria Victoria is a hardworking woman who sells vegetables for a living. At her age, she does not have difficulty moving forward with her business. She states that she feels satisfied with what she does. She wakes up at 4:00 a.m. to go to the central market in the city of Moyobamba to sell her produce.

She is currently well-known by her customers, who go to her stand daily to purchase everything that a homemaker needs. She personally attends to her customers with the charm that she is noted for.

With this 1,500.00 PEN loan, she will purchase sacks of cassava, sacks of beans, and other products so that she can continue giving the best customer service.

Vicki, as she is affectionately called, now feels very fulfilled and with the desire to keep moving forward, as far as God gives her the strength to go. She thanks Manuela Ramos for having helped her to start her own business, as well as for having helped other women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La señora Marina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 43 años, 03 hijos, que aun están a su cargo y es la razón por la cual, trabaja muy duro día a día.

Su espíritu  alegre y su anhelo de sacar adelante  a sus hijos, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes con cuyas ganancias ayudaría al ingreso económico de su familia, desde sus  inicios a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. En la actualidad tiene clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque en ella encuentran todo los productos que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Marina, muy tranquila y segura para continuar trabajando y perseverando día a día y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Ms. Marina L. is a member of the “Mujeres Emprendedoras” Microfinance Institute in the Moyobamba district and province, department of San Martin. She is a 43-year-old woman with a live-in partner and 3 children—her reason for working so hard day by day—under her care.

Her cheerful spirit and her desire to help her children get ahead motivated her to start her own general store so that she could contribute to the household income. She has been gaining customers ever since she started out. She currently has a fixed clientele that comes to her store everyday to shop because there, they can find all the products that a homemaker needs. She personally attends to her customers with the charm that she is noted for.

With this 2,000.00 PEN loan, she will purchase sacks of rice and sugar, packages of noodles, crates of milk, boxes of assorted brands of canned fish, eggs, and personal hygiene products so that she can continue giving the best customer service. Marina calmly and confidently continues to work and persevere everyday. She gives thanks to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping women like her get the opportunity to develop their entrepreneurial skills.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods for general store

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es: Clorinda tiene 42 años, es una madre muy trabajadora; tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales sólo tres viven con ella en su casa propia. Clorinda trabaja diariamente desde muy joven, puesto que la agricultura es la única actividad que conoce y que le ha generado muy buenas ganancias durante todos estos años. Por ello es que quiere mucho a sus siembras de papa y oca, ya que gracias a ellas sus hijos no pasan dificultades y necesidades económicas. Algunas veces trabaja también en chacras de sus vecinas, donde le pagan 12 soles diarios incluido su almuerzo y con este dinero solventa los gastos de su anciana madre y los estudios de sus hijos. Pero cuando tiene que cultivar sus propias chacras, Clorinda y su esposo priorizan esta labor hasta terminar enviando sus productos al mercado. Con las ganancias anteriores ha aprovechado en comprar vacas, de las que vende su leche a 1.5 soles el litro, además, cada vez tiene más becerritos. Por ello, sus  anhelos son de comprar más vacas que le generen ingresos extras a su hogar. Los demás integrantes están en el décimo crédito con MFP, mientras que Clorinda va por el octavo préstamo, pues ingresó a su banco comunal cuando ya tenía un año de formado; por otro lado, ella se siente muy alegre por lo que viene ahorrando junto a su grupo. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra de funguicidas que erradiquen los gusanos que atacan la oca y la papa, el resto lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes químicos.
texts.en:
Clorinda is 42 years old. She is a very hardworking mother with 4 children, 3 of whom live in her house. Clorinda has been working everyday since she was very young because agriculture is the only activity that she knows and that has been yielding great profits all these years. For this reason, she really likes her potato and oca (a root vegetable) crops. Thanks to them, her children have not experienced financial difficulties. Sometimes she also works on her neighbors’ farms, where she gets paid 12 PEN daily, including lunch. With this money, she can pay for her elderly mother’s expenses and for her children’s studies. However, when she has to cultivate her own crop fields, Clorinda and her husband make it a priority until they end up sending their products to market. She has made the most of her previous earnings by purchasing some cows, selling their milk at 1.5 PEN a liter. Furthermore, her cows keep having more and more calves. For this reason, she hopes to purchase more cows, which will increase the household income. The rest of the members are on their tenth loan with MFP, while Clorinda is on her eighth loan because she joined the microfinance institute a year after it was formed. Nevertheless, she feels very happy because she has been saving money with her group. The money that she is now requesting will be used in purchasing fungicides to eradicate the pests that attack her potatoes and oca. She will also invest in purchasing chemical fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fungicides and fertilizer

loans.name: Mari

texts.es: Mari tiene 32 años, es una mujer de noble y trabajadora que vive con el padre de sus 2 hijos, en su casa propia hecha a base de adobes y tejas. Durante los siete días de la semana y a veces en horas de la noche Mari trabaja regando sus siembras según el turno que tiene para el agua, por ello trata de regar al máximo para que sus siembras fructifiquen de manera uniforme. A ella le gusta mucho los trabajos agrícolas, puesto que los desarrolló desde niña, aprendiendo todas las técnicas del agricultor y desde entonces es muy independiente en las actividades que realiza. Una vez que cosecha la papa su esposo es el encargado de trasladar los sacos de producto hasta el carro para transportarlos directo al mercado de la ciudad de Tarma, donde los comercializa al mejor postor. Por ello, Mari piensa seguir trabajando duro para reunir dinero para el bienestar de sus hijos, que es su mayor anhelo. Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP y durante los anteriores ciclos no ha defraudo a su banco comunal, por el contrario se ha ganado el cariño y respeto de los demás, a los que también tiene mucho aprecio. El dinero que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de otro tipo de semillas de papa que aumente su producción.
texts.en:
Mari is 32 years old. She is a very noble and hardworking woman who lives with the father of her 2 children in their own house made of adobe with a tile roof. Seven days a week—and sometimes in the evening—she irrigates her crops when it is her turn to do so. She tries to irrigate as much as possible so that her crops can produce evenly. She really likes agriculture because it is something that she has been doing since she was a young girl, learning the techniques at that time. Ever since then, she has been very independent. As soon as she harvests the potatoes, her husband is in charge of taking them to the truck and transporting them directly to the market in Tarma, where he sells them to the highest bidder. For this reason, Mari plans to keep working hard to save up money for her children’s well-being, which is her greatest wish. This is her seventh loan with MFP. During her previous loan cycles, she has not let her microfinance institute down. On the contrary, she has gained the love and respect of her fellow group members, whom she greatly appreciates. She plans on investing this loan in purchasing another type of potato seed to increase production.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potato seeds

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes cuenta con 25 años de edad, es una muchacha muy trabajadora, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 3 hijos en la casa heredada por sus suegros. A los 15 años se convirtió en madre, pero a su vez en una mujer muy responsable, con su pequeña cargada en la espalda labraba la tierra de sus vecinos; juntamente con su esposo, a ella le pagaban 8 soles diarios y a su esposo 12 soles. Posteriormente se propusieron alquilar chacras y sembrar sus propios cultivos, iniciaron sembrando 764 m2 de papas, en ese entonces sus cosechas le resultaron muy buenas, permitiéndole acumular dinero que le sirvió para adquirir sus propios terrenos cultivables. Desde entonces siembra cada año papa y arveja; para ello, muy temprano por la mañana su esposo se adelanta a sus chacras y ella va luego con el almuerzo, muy contenta puesto que le agrada trabajar en sus cultivos. Mercedes está convencida de progresar mediante la agricultura, para ello quiere adquirir otros terrenos cultivables para evitar pagar alquiler. Mercedes es una nueva en MFP, se está incorporando a un banco comunal que ya va por décimo crédito. Por lo que hace compromisos de cumplir con cada una de sus cuotas, asimismo tiene muchos anhelos de empezar a juntar sus ahorros en su grupo. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus siembra de papas.
texts.en:
25-year old Mercedes is a hardworking woman. She lives with her partner and their three children in a house inherited from her parents-in-law. She became a mother at the age of 15--having a baby made her become a responsible woman. With her little daughter on her back she worked in the fields for her neighbours alongside her husband. She was paid 8 soles a day; he earned 12 soles. Later they decided to rent fields and grow their own crops, beginning with 764 m2 of potatoes. They had good harvests which allowed them to save enough money to buy their own land. Since then they have planted potatoes and peas every year. To achieve this Mercedes’ husband goes to their fields very early every morning, and she follows along soon afterwards with lunch, happy because she enjoys working the land. Mercedes is convinced that farming will enable them to get ahead; she wants to buy more arable land so they don’t have to spend money on renting it. As a new member of MFP (which incorporated as a community bank and is already on its tenth loan cycle), Mercedes has committed to repaying all loan instalments and is looking forward to saving together with the rest of her group. The loan will be used to buy chemical fertilizers to put on her potato crop.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es: Ofelia tiene 38 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, actualmente vive con su pareja y padre de sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde las 4 de la mañana se levanta para preparar los alimentos, mientras que su esposo se adelanta a trabajar en sus cultivos de papa o arvejas y a eso de las 8 de la mañana ella se incorpora hasta las 6 de la tarde. Trabajar de este modo le agrada mucho a Ofelia, no siente cansancio ni pesadez en su cuerpo, ya que esta actividad la realizó desde niña; pero lo que más la llena de regocijo es comercializar sus productos en el mercado de Tarma, ya que en la mayoría de las veces llega a venderlos a buen precio. Pero últimamente los está enviando directamente al mercado de la ciudad de Lima por generarle mayores ganancias, es así que le alcanza cubrir la educación de sus hijos, asimismo le sirve de capital para volver a sembrar. Para más adelante, Ofelia quiere comenzar a sembrar hortalizas porque son productos muy rentables. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, durante estos ciclos ha demostrado pagar fielmente cada una de sus cuotas, del mismo modo asiste a todas las reuniones de mes, ya que se siente muy cómoda con los demás integrantes de su banco comunal. El dinero solicitado lo piensa utilizar en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para abonar sus cultivos de papas y de flores.
texts.en:
38-year old Ofelia is a hardworking woman who lives with her partner and their two children in their own home. She gets up at 4 am to prepare food while her husband sets off to work in their fields of potatoes or peas. She joins him at 8 am and they work till 6 at night. Ofelia enjoys agricultural work—she doesn’t feel tired or get worn out by the hard work as she has been doing this since was a little girl. What really delights her is selling their products in the Tarma market since most of the time she gets a good price for them. Recently she started sending them directly to the market in Lima as she earns more money that way. The profits will be used to cover the cost of educating her children and as capital to buy more seeds. In the future Ofelia wants to grow vegetables which are very profitable. This is her tenth loan with Kiva partner, MFP, and she has clearly demonstrated that she will repay her loan faithfully. She also attends all the monthly meetings as she feels very comfortable with the other members of the community bank. She is planning to use the loan to buy chemical fertilizer to spread on her potato and flower fields.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Reydo

texts.es: Reydo tiene 39 años, es un hombre trabajador muy dinámico y tiene tres hijos. Actualmente vive con su pareja y madre de sus hijos en una casa de adobes. Desde muy joven se dedicó a trabajar en las chacras de sus padres; ahora que tiene su esposa, trabaja con ella sembrando papas, arvejas y también flores pero en menor cantidad. Para él, dedicarse a sus cultivos le llena de mucha satisfacción y antes de iniciar su jornada chacarera mastica hoja coca para no sentir cansancio durante la dura jornada. Reydo cuida y cultiva cada una de sus siembras en su debido momento, ya que dependerá de ello la producción de sus productos. Una vez acumuladas las cosechas contrata un camión para el transporte de su carga hasta el mercado mayorista de Tarma, donde los compradores lo esperan y él pacientemente escucha a todos los postores para elegir al mejor. De este modo le son muy rentables sus siembras y con esas ganancias piensa comprar otras chacras, ya que quiere incrementar su producción. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, donde ha demostrado pagar puntualmente cada una de sus cuotas y donde también se siente muy a gusto. Asimismo es muy apreciado por los demás integrantes de su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos de papas y arvejas, otra parte la utilizará en la preparación de sus chacras para sus nuevas siembras.
texts.en:
39-year old Reydo is a hardworking, energetic man. He lives with his partner and their three children in a house made of adobe. Ever since he was a young man, he has worked in his parents’ fields. Now that he has a wife, he works alongside her in the potato and pea fields. They also grow a small quantity of flowers. Working the land gives Reydo much satisfaction. Before beginning his daily tasks, he chews coca leaves so that he doesn’t feel tired during the day’s hard work. Reydo does what is necessary with each of his crops at the appropriate time—a successful harvest depends on him. Once the crops are gathered, he hires a truck to transport them to the wholesale market in Tarma where buyers are waiting. Patiently he listens to all the bidders before choosing the best one. He earns good money from his crops, and with the profits he is thinking of buying more land as he wants to increase production. This is his tenth loan with Kiva partner, MFP. He has shown that he pays back the instalments punctually, and he feels very comfortable with the organisation. He in turn is much respected by the other members of the community bank. Part of the loan will be used to buy chemical fertilizer to spread on his potato and pea crops; part will be used to prepare the fields for new seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and prepare his fields

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
La señora Marisol, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Ramón Castilla”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 34 años, 01 niño que aun depende de ella y esta estudiando.

Su impulso  y empeño de ver a sus hijos profesionales, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes, se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. 

Las ganancias que genera ayuda al ingreso económico de su familia, como es una mujer muy esmerada con su trabajo, aprendió a seguir adelante. 
En la actualidad, es muy querida por sus clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque ella cuenta con todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es ella misma quien les brinda su atención con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal en paquetes para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Marisol, se siente muy joven y con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, día a día agradece a la vida, por brindarle una gran oportunidad de salir adelante como mujer, igualmente al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por   iniciarla a convertirse en una mujer empresaria.
texts.en:
Marisol belongs to the Ramón Castilla Community Bank and lives in the district of Tarapoto, department of San Martín, Peru. She is 34 years old, lives with her partner and has one son, who goes to school and still depends on her. Her goal is to see her son become successful, and it motivated her to start her own business selling groceries. She runs her store out of her home, and it's a well-conditioned to serve her customers. The earnings she generates helps with the family income. She is very careful with her work and learned how to make headway. Currently, her store is in high demand from a fixed clientele who visits her daily to make their purchases because she has all the products a housewife needs, and she herself tends to the customers with the charisma she is known for. With the loan of 3,000 soles she is requesting, she plans to purchase sacks of rice and sugar, packets of noodles, various brands of canned milk and fish, eggs and personal hygiene products so she can continue providing high-quality service to her customers. Marisol feels very young and strong with her work, and day to day she feels grateful for the great opportunity to make progress as a woman. She also thanks Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for starting on the path of becoming a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase general grocery supplies (rice, sugar, etc.)

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La señora Nancy, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Abejitas”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 38 años y 03 hijas que dependen de ella y son la razón por la cual se esfuerza día a día. 

Teniendo la profesión de Técnica en Industrias Textilas, no dudo en implementar su propio taller de costura, en un local muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa, lleva varios años dedicándose a la Confección de Vestidos, tanto de damas, caballeros y niños. Con el trabajo que realiza esta muy contenta, por que le gusta y así genera sus propios ingresos para aportar en su hogar.
Nos cuenta que le va muy bien en sus ventas, trabaja con pedidos de sus clientes anticipadamente.

Uno de sus sueños y meta por lograr, es implementar su propio taller de confección de vestidos, con maquinas industriales modernas.

En la actualidad continua con sus confecciones de vestidos y tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su casa para realizar sus trabajos y pedidos, es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes géneros, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Nancy, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nancy is a member of the “Las Abejitas (The Little Bees)” Communal Bank in the District of Moyobamba, Province of Moyobamba, Region of San Martin. She is married, 38 years old, and has three daughters who depend on her and are the reason for which she works day to day.

Being a technician in the textiles industry, there are no doubts in her opening her own seamstress shop in a well equipped location in her own home. She has several years of experience in the sale of fine clothes for ladies, gentlemen, and children. She is very happy with the work she is doing because she likes it and is earning her own income to contribute to her household. She tells us that her sales are going very well, and she works with advance orders from her customers. One of her dreams and goals to achieve is to open her own seamstress shop for the sale of fine clothes with modern, industrial machines. At the moment she continues with her sale of clothes and has a faithful clientele who come to her home daily to see her work and orders. It is she who personally attends to them with the friendliness that characterizes her.

With this loan of 1000 PEN she will purchase fabrics by the yard of different types, instruments she uses such as scissors, sewing needles for hand and machine, pins, and buttons.

Today Nancy feels like a very fulfilled woman with more goals to reach and dreams to realize. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos movement for helping her to start her business and to the many growing enterprising women.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics by the yard and different colors of threads

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann D. is from the village of San Antonio, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Mary Ann is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Mary Ann owns & operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making longganisa—or homemade sausage—to sell in the community. Mary Ann is just starting this business.

In 2009, Mary Ann joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Ann is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mary Ann from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Nisida

texts.es:
La señora Nisida, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 22 años, y un 01 hijo pequeño.

Su espíritu  alegre y su anhelo de sacar adelante a su hijo, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes con cuyas ganancias ayudaría al ingreso económico de su familia, desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. En la actualidad tiene clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega ubicada en el Mercado “Los Ángeles” – Moyobamba a comprar porque en su negocio encuentran todos los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00,  comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Nisida, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, y perseverando día a día y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Nisida belongs to the Mujeres Emprendedoras Community Bank in the Moyobamba district, Moyobamba province, San Martín department. She is 22, in a common law marriage, and has a small son. Her happy spirit and her desire to help her son’s future motivated her to start her own business selling groceries. She would use her earnings to help her family. From the beginning she has been steadily gaining customers. She currently has fixed customers who come to her store, which is located in the Los Ángeles market in Moyabamba. They come every day to buy because they find everything a housewife needs. She personally waits on them with her characteristic charisma. With this loan for 2,000 PEN she will buy sacks of rice and sugar, packages of noodles, milk, boxes of various brands of canned fish, eggs, and personal hygiene products to continue giving good attention to her customers. Nisida feels that she has a lot of strength to keep working and persevering day to day. She is thankful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women like her have opportunities to develop in the midst of where they can blossom.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries to increase her stock

loans.name: Rosa Nery

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Nery, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 38 años, 08 hijos, 06 de ellos que aun dependen de ella.

Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque en ella  tiene todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos; galletas, fideos y sales en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Rosita, como le dicen de cariño, se siente muy tranquila para continuar con su trabajo y se siente muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela R. por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Nery belongs to the "Banco Comunal "Mujeres Emprendedoras", District of Moyobamba, Province Moyobamba, Department of San Martín. She is married, 38 years old, has 8 children of whom 6 still are dependent on her.

Her personality and her wish to make her dreams come true, motivated her to start her own business selling groceries in order to support the family income. From the beginning up to now the clients have increased. Today she can count on stable clients who visit her store daily to make their purchases as it has all the products a housewife needs and she personally assists with charisma.

With this loan of S/.2,000.00 she will buy sacks of rice and sugar, cookies, pasta, and packs of salt, milk and boxes of variety of canned fish, as well as "javas" of eggs and personal hygiene items, all of this to offer better service to her clients.

Rosita, as her loving nickname is, feels calm to continue her work and she is grateful to Movimiento Manuela R. for supporting women like her to have opportunities to improve within their environment.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in buying groceries to increase products.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel B. is from the village of Yumbing, Camiguin. She is 35 years old, single, and has one infant child. Rachel owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rachel is just starting this business. In 2009, Rachel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rachel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rachel is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
La señora Santos, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 56 años y es madre de 09 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes.

Emprendió su negocio de Venta de verduras, se inicio con un capital de           S/. 150.00. Nos cuenta que no le fue fácil implementar su negocio, esta ubicada en el Mercado Central de la Ciudad, un puesto que ocupó con mucho esfuerzo, ya que no le fue fácil obtenerlo, hoy en día esta muy contenta por lo logrado.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, donde sus principales clientes son moradores de la comunidad y amigos que ya conocen el trabajo que realiza.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00, comprará racimos de plátano, sacos de yucas  y camote.

Santos, aprendido a tomar sus propias decisiones,  tanto en lo personal como en su negocio. Nos manifiesta su agradecimiento al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Santos belongs to "Banco Comunal "Mujeres Emprendedoras", District of Moyobamba, Province Moyobamba, Departmetn of San Martín. She is married, 56 years old, a mother of 9 who are all independent.

She started a business selling vegetables with a capital of S/.150.00. She tells us that it was not easy to get her business started, it is located on the central market, "Mercado Central" of the town, she got the stall with much effort as it is not easy to obtain one, and today she is very happy because of her success. Presently she has the same business and most of her clients are inhabitants of the community and friends who are all aware of her work.

With this loan of S/.2,500.00 she will buy bunches of banana, sacks of yucca and sweet potato. Mrs. Santos has learned to make her own decisions, personally as well as businesswise. She expresses her gratefulness to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a businesswoman and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of vegetables.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La señora Teodora, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Ana”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 47 años y es madre 04 hijos, que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Agradece a sus padres, por haberla apoyado en sus estudios de Cosmetodologia, ya que supo valerse de esto, para implementar su pequeño salón de belleza, ubicada en su misma casa, un local bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes.
Nos cuenta que hoy en día le va muy bien, ya que es conocida por sus amigos y vecinos, realiza diferentes tipos de tintes, peinados y cortes, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños.

En la actualidad ofrece en el mismo servicio  y con el préstamo de  S/1,500.00, comprará sus materiales de trabajo como: laca en frascos, tintes de cabello en diferentes colores, oxigenta, talcos, shampos y cremas de pelo.
También brinda el servicio, de manicure y pedicure y para esto comprara esmaltes en diferentes colores y detalles.

Es ella quien toma las decisiones en los gastos y ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal,  se siente una Mujer independiente, decidida y más segura, responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por brindarle el apoyo, para iniciarme con su actual negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teodora belongs to "Banco Comunal "Santa Ana", District of Moyobamba, Province Moyobamba, Department of San Martín. She is married, 47 years old and a mother of 4 who are still dependent on her and are students.

She is grateful to her parents for having supported her in her studies of cosmetology as it enabled her to start her small beauty salon, a well-conditioned facility located at her house, where she treats her clients. She tells us that presently she is doing very well as she is well-known by friends and neighbors and she makes different kinds of dyeing, sets, and haircuts, for ladies, gentlemen, and children.

Presently she works at the same place and with the loan of S/.1,500.00 she will buy work material such as: cans of spray, different colored dye, oxigenta (peroxide solution), talcs, shampoos, and hair cream. She also gives manicure and pedicure for which she will buy nailpolish in different colors.

She herself is in charge of making the decisions on expenses and earnings regarding her business. Personally she feels independent, decided and self-confident, responsable for the repayment. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for giving her support to set up her present business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material such as hair dye and hair cream.

loans.name: Bron

texts.en:
The two persons shown in the above photo are Mrs. Bron S. and her husband, and they both live in Siem Reap Province.

Bron S. cultivates rice and vegetable crops to earn a living. She can collect all her mature produce to sell them in retail in the market every two months after she plants. Her husband helps be responsible for the entire family by fishing in Tunle Sap Lake. This couple has five children who have work in different jobs. Two of their children have been married for years and live separately.

Bron S. will be using the loan to buy extra tools to support her husband’s fishing business. This will help them to accrue a greater quantity of fish than before.

loans.use: To buy extra tools to support her husband’s fishing business

loans.name: Haidee

texts.en: Haidee G. is from the village of San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 29 years old and is single. Haidee owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling both clothes and daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc., in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2008, Haidee joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Haidee is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

location.town: San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily E. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao Camiguin. She is forty years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Emily owns and operates a specialized retail business, selling fish in the local market, and also selling Avon, Fullerlife, and Natasha products. Emily has been engaged in her business for over twelve years and earns approximately $215 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emily joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by giving her the ability to engage in business activities. Emily has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. That loan was used to purchase new items of Fullerlife to expand her product offerings. Emily is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used for her fish-vending business, and also to purchase a school uniform for her college student. This will be Emily's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by the loan to expand her business and to provide educational support for her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Bet
