texts.en: Bet C. is a thirty-five-year-old clothing vendor residing in Siem Reap Province. She currently sells clothing for both men and women from her store in the local market. She is married with two children who are enrolled in school. Bet is an energetic woman who never wastes time as she works to earn the money to encourage all her kids to attain the highest levels of education. She has managed her investment carefully and has attracted a large number of clients due to her communication skills.  In order to better meet her customers' demands, she would like a $1000 loan to purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena S. is from the village of Sta. Maria, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is forty-four years old and is married. To make a living, Elena owns and operates a business preparing and selling "ginamos", or salted anchovies, to local community members. Elena has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $64 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Elena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by giving her the ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC. Elena is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Anatolia

texts.en:
Anatolia L. is from the village of Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is a fifty-nine-year-old widow with seven grown children. To make a living, Anatolia owns and operates a business selling different fruits in the community. Anatolia has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $145 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Anatolia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to give her the ability to engage in business activities. Anatolia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. Anatolia is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus E., 37, is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin and a mother of 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Venus owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling dried fish to her established customers in the local community. She is also into selling "Ready to Wear" clothing of GTY. Venus has been engaged in her business for over 17 years and earns ~3,200 PHP a month.

In 2009, Venus joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Venus has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase dried fish to sell. Venus is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP as additional capital for her businesses. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children’s education.


About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her businesses

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah L., 27, is from the village of Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Leah owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products in the local community. Leah has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns ~5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Leah joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leah is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn R. is from the village of San Antonio, Ozamiz City,Misamis Occidental. She is 21 years old and single. To make a living, Jovelyn owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling peanut butter. Jovelyn has just started this business.

In 2009, Jovelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients such as peanuts to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jovelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions.


About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make products for sale

loans.name: Khum

texts.en:
Mrs. Khum C., 56, and her husband, Mr. Khoeun Phun, 46, live along National Road Number Two about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1987 and have three sons. One son attends school and the other two assist their farther in farming. Besides her children, she also has an elderly mother living with her.

Chum has been selling vegetables for two years. Her husband is a disabled solder and he is a farmer as well. She is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorized hand tiller for her husband’s farming business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorized hand tiller for farming

loans.name: Pheary

texts.en:
Mrs. Pheary M., 38, is a widow with two daughters, both of whom are in school. She lives on an island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. 

Pheary has been a silk weaver since she was 15 years old. She learned this skill from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Pheary doesn’t have enough capital to purchase silk materials for her weaving business, so she is requesting her first loan of $300 to use for this purpose.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Mony

texts.en:
Mrs. Mony U., 51, and her husband, Mr. Doeun Pon, 54, live on an island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. They have been married since 1979 and have three children: one son who is a security guard and two daughters. Their daughters are married and live outside the family home.
  
Mony has been a silk weaver since she was 16 years old. She learned to weave silk from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman who in turn sells them in the market in Phnom Penh. Mr. Doeun Pon is a farmer who grows different kinds of crops and vegetables in his village.

Mony doesn’t have enough capital to purchase silk materials to continue her business so she is asking for her first loan of $300 to use for this purpose.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe L. is from the village of Mahayahay, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 56 years old. Fe is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Fe owns and operates a sari-sari or general store. She sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC. She used the previous loan to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Fe is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP that she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Fe's second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership includes farmers, fisher folks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeun V., age 44, is a widow with one son and two daughters (shown in the picture with her daughter). Two children are in school and the other one weaves silk at home. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Savoeun has been a silk weaver for over 10 years. She sells her finished products to a middle man in the village who then takes them to sell in the market in Phnom Penh. She hopes to set up one more loom for her daughter, which would help her to earn more income. Savoeun is requesting a loan of $600 USD to purchase silk material for her weaving business and to set up one more loom.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials and a loom

loans.name: Phearom

texts.en:
Mrs. Phearom, 33, is a widow with one daughter. She lives in a small village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and has one sister who is a tailor. 

Phearom has been selling medicine in her village since ten years. She wants to create another coffee-selling business, therefore she is applying for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase materials for her coffee shop and use part of the loan for building her house.

loans.use: To buy materials for her coffee shop and partly to build house

loans.name: Sophoin

texts.en:
Sophoin C., 33, and her husband, Sovan Heng, 39, have been married since 1992 and have three children - two sons and one daughter. One of them is in primary school. Besides her children, her old parents also live with her. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Since two years Sophoin has been into silk weaving, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to a middle man in the village, who then sells them in the market located in Phnom Penh. Sovan Heng is a farmer, who grows corn and tomatoes in his farmland and who also raises cows. 

Sophoin is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase silk material for her weaving business, to set up one more loom and to buy cows for her husband to raise.

loans.use: To purchase silk for weaving, set up one more loom and buy cows for her husband to raise

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia T., 30, is from the village of Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Virgilia owns and operates a business venture in the wholesale sector selling fruits. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fruits. Virgilia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns ~5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Virgilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virgilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. Virgilia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions.


About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita C. is a strong and determined 57-year-old woman from the island village of Binangonan, Rizal province, in the Philippines. She is widowed with a son, Harold, who is 31 years old and a priest.

In 1995, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines. She was then full of hope to alleviate the status of the family from poverty. Of her almost 15 years of membership in ASHI, she is noted for her exemplary performance. Now on her 11th loan, she is seeking the amount of 45,000 pesos to purchase three sets of fish nets and one engine for their boat.

She dreams of having a sustainable business and of being able to build her dream house that is more durable and spacious.

loans.use: To purchase three fishing nets and one motor for her fishing boat

loans.name: Sokchan

texts.en:
Ms. Sokchan T., 22, is single (shown in the picture with her mother). She lives with her parents on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. Her brother is a construction worker.

Sokchan has been a silk weaver since she was 13 years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Sokchan is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business

loans.name: Long's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of three people, all of whom are living in Phnom Penh. Mrs. Long L., 49, has been selected by the members to be the leader. Long L. owns a bigger plot of plantation where she plants various crops to earn a living. She collects her mature produce to sell in bulk to her buyer every three months. She is married with eight children all of whom are single and live at home, while three of her sons are employed (two are painters and one is a teacher). Her husband is a local teacher at the secondary school. Long L.’s sons have been running the painting business for years, but their sector actions still need equipment. Therefore, Long L. has decided to ask for a loan for her sons to use as capital to purchase extra painting tools. 
The other borrowers who have jointL. requested the loan are listed below:
It S. is a sweets seller who is asking for a loan to develop her investments.
Nun S. is a farmer applying for a loan as capital to buy hairdressing tools to begin providing beauty services.

loans.use: To purchase extra tools for their painting services

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Mrs. Ny D., 41, and her husband, Mr. Ny Chhen, 39, have been married since 1999 and just have one young son. The family lives along National Road number one about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Ny and her husband have been selling soy milk and akor for ten years. Akor is a Cambodian snack made of sticky rice and coconut milk cooked in steam. They make their own soy milk and akor and then transport them to sell in the Korki market. Ny is asking for her first loan of $500 to build a fence around her house.

loans.use: To build a fence around her house

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Mr. Sophat Y., 37, and his wife, Mrs. Phalla Kong, 36, live along National Road number one about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2000 and have three children, two sons and one daughter. Two of them attend school, and the other one is still very young. 

Sophat and his wife have been selling kachay cake in their village for 26 years. It is a kind of fried cake of Chinese origin. He is applying for his first loan of $1,200 to build a new house with concrete for its foundation.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Rat

texts.en:
Mr. Rat C., 52, has three children: two sons and one daughter. One of his sons has full-time employment in a factory, and another one attends school. The daughter is married, but lives in the family home. The family lives along National Road number two about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Rat has been driving a motor-taxi in Phnom Penh for 20 years. He is asking for his first loan of $600 to fill up the land behind his house and purchase a motorbike for his son-in-law to replace the old one.

loans.use: To fill up the land behind his house and purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Somaly

texts.en:
Mrs. Somaly N., 25, and her husband, Mr. Run Horm, 30, were married in 2002 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Both of the children are still young. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number 5 about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Somaly has been a garment factory worker for one year. Her husband has been selling recycling materials for seven years. He buys it from his villagers and the nearby village for resale at other districts far away from his house. 

She is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike and level up her house's foundation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and level up her house foundation.

loans.name: Sokkea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokkea M., 35, and her husband, Mr. Sorphea Srun, 37, were married in 1991 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. All of them are in school. The family lives along National Road Number 6, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sokkea and her husband have been raising pigs since 1996.  Besides raising pigs, they grow vegetables as well. Now she is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase additional piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Sarith

texts.en:
Ms. Sarith Y., 37, is single and lives with her parents along National Road Number 6 about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sarith has been growing vegetables and raising pigs for two years. She wants to expand her pigpen; it would be easy for her to raise her pigs. That is why she is asking for a loan of $1,000, to use for that purpose and to grow vegetables as well.

loans.use: To use for growing vegetables and raising pigs.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith U. is from the village of Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Edith is married and has 10 school-aged children. To make a living, Edith owns & operates a business making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling snacks in the local community. Edith has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Edith joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edith has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC. Edith is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Edith from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en: Khorn V. is a 26-year-old handicraft maker who stays at home to weave bamboo for baskets for sale. She also boils corn to sell to her neighbors in the village for daily profit. She is married to Vann Veasna, 26, who sells fresh clams in the market to earn a living. Beside their current work, they have always cultivated a rice crop. Khorn V. has given birth to two kids who are still minors and enrolled in school. Due to the cost of clams is commanding cheapest price. Khorn V. is looking for a loan for capital in order to purchase clams for her husband to sell. She will use some of the loan to grow her rice crop.

loans.use: To purchase clams for her husband to sell

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona M. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 31 years old. Jona is married and has three infant children. To make a living, Jona owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jona has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Jona joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Jona is requesting a new loan of 19000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Jona from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanny B., 28, and her husband, Mr. Run Kong, 25, live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2005 and have two young sons. 
Vanny has been selling mangoes. Her husband is a horse cart driver and wooden house builder. Unfortunately, his horse was old and got sick. Therefore, he decided to sell it. Now, Vanny is asking for her second loan of $300 to purchase another horse for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To purchase a horse for her husband’s business.

loans.name: Edmar

texts.en:
Edmar E. is from the village of Acad, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 35 years old. Edmar is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Edmar owns & operates a buy and sell business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling coconut in the local community. Edmar has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Edmar joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edmar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional coconut to sell. Edmar is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Edmar from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family and to pay tuition for his children. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mr. Sophal K., 30, and his wife, Mrs. Rin Chheng, 32, live along National Road Number 5, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2002 and have one daughter who is in school. He also has his parents living with him. 

Sophal and his wife have been working as garment factory workers for eight years. He doesn’t have his own transportation to commute to work, so he is requesting his first loan of $700 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to drive to work.

loans.name: Bunthoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Bunthoeun R., 35, and her husband, Mr. Sothea Keo, 47, live in a small village on National Road Two about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They were married in 1990 and have three children: one son and two daughters. Two of their children work in a garment factory.

Bunthoeun cuts grass to sell for cows' feed. Her husband has been a mason for over 15 years. He does his work in his village and in a nearby province, but sometimes he has a job in Phnom Penh City too. He doesn’t have his own transportation, and he travels with his relatives to work very often. Therefore, Bunthoeun is requesting a loan of US$600 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina V. is from the village of Water Fall, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 36 years old. Gina is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns & operates a sari-sari or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste etc., in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Gina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Gina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Gina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and pay for tuition for her children. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Water Fall, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Thida

texts.en:
Mrs.Thida R., who is thirty-five years old, and her husband, Mr. Chinda Duk, who is thirty-four, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penn, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 1991 and have five children - two sons and three daughters. 
 
Thida has been selling flowers and bananas for twelve years. Her husband assists his wife in the business. They buy bananas and flowers from villagers and transport them to sell in the Phnom Penh market. 

Thida is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to build a fence around her house. She hopes that she will have no problem with her loan.

loans.use: To build a fence around her house

loans.name: Sokunthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokunthy Keo, who is thirty-seven years old, and her husband, Mr. Sokchea Chry, who is thirty-nine, were married in 1992 and have two sons, both of whom are in school. The couple lives along national road number one about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sokunthy is a scarf weaver. Her husband has been a Tuk Tuk taxi driver (Tuk is a motorbike with a passenger trailer at the back) in Phnom Penh for ten years. Sokunthy is asking for her first loan of $1,000 in order to purchase cotton thread and set up a loom.  She plans to build a fence around her house as well.

loans.use: To purchase cotton thread and set up a loom

loans.name: So's Group

texts.en:
There are four people who are jointly taking this loan. Its leader, Mr. So K., is 47 years old and a rice farmer. He also climbs many palm trees to tap palm juice and boils the palm juice into palm sugar to sell in the market. He typically makes around 10 kilos of sugar per day and sells it to buyers at the price of $0.50 per kilo. His wife stays at home and makes a few clayish pots for a profit. This old couple has eight children; one of the children lives separately and the others are living in home and assist in their parent’s works. So K. requested a loan to buy a trailer, which he will use to pick up firewood for boiling palm juice. The other borrowers are:
Mrs. Chen N. will be using a loan to decorate the ladder of her house.  
Mr. Oem K. is a local farmer, who is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for his crop.
Mrs. Long B. is a grocer who is requesting a loan to purchase additional essential ingredients for cooking.

loans.use: To buy a trailer to pick up firewood

loans.name: Faheema Group

texts.en:
Faheema is the group leader of the Faheema group. There are four members in this group, and they hope to obtain a loan of 40,000 Afghani.

- Faheema wants to take out a loan for her husband who has general store.

- Raema hopes to receive a loan for her son who runs a Public Call Office.

- Haneta would like to use her loan for her husband, who is a taxi driver.

- A. G. would like a loan to use for his business, where he sells flour and oil.

They are all very grateful to Kiva lenders, who support so many entrepreneurs.

loans.use: For expanding the businesses of the group members

loans.name: Bashorat

texts.ru: Махмудова Башорат 1964 года рождения, имеет 4 детей. Имеет среднее образование. Торгует в Чкаловске 6 лет бижутерией. Она начинала свой бизнес с  продажи семечек , сигарет и жвачек на небольшом прилавке. После получения кредита постепенно увеличила свой  товарооборот.  Первый кредит получила 2003 года на расширение  своей точки. Теперь благодарна КИВА за поддержку и увеличения капитала.
texts.en:
Bashorat M. was born in 1964, has four children and has a secondary-school education. She has been trading in jewelry in Chkalovsk for six years. She began her business selling sunflower seeds, cigarettes, and chewing gum from a small table. After receiving a loan, she gradually increased her trade turnover. She received her first loan in 2003 in order to expand the table which she sells from. Now, thanks to Kiva's support, she has been able to increase her capital.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cosmetics and  jewelry

loans.name: Ponsinna

texts.en: N. Ponsinna is a 42-year-old business lady. She has a lubricant selling shop; she started the business two years back. She is using the loan to expand her business by purchasing more lubricants to sell in her shop. She has three children, two of whom are going to school. Her future plan is to build rental houses and educate her children in good schools.

loans.use: Purchasing more lubricants for sale.

loans.name: Nuri

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Нури Рахмонова  1954 года рождения., замужем имеет 4 детей. Имеет среднее неоконченное образование. На рынке торгует 5 лет. Продает детские вещи, женское белье а также детскую обувь. Раньше торговала только детской одеждой. Кредит получила в 2003 году на покупку детских вещей. Со временем поняла что продажей только детской одеждой  прибыли больше не будет.С каждым разом увеличивала свой оборот и прибыль. Благодарна КИВА за поддержку и рада за полученный кредит.
texts.en:
Nuri R. was born in 1954. She is married and has four children. She did not complete secondary school. She has been trading at the market for five years. She sells childrens items, women's underwear, and children's footwear. Earlier, she only sold children's clothes. She took out a loan in 2003 to buy them. With time, she understood that by only selling children's clothing, she wouldn't make much of a profit. With each loan, she's increased her turnover and profit. She is grateful to Kiva for its support and glad to receive loans.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of summer clothing

loans.name: Ernesto Macassa

texts.pt:
Ernesto Macassa M. natural da M., de 51 anos de idade, casado e pai de sete filhos dos quais quatro são maiores de idade e os restantes três com idades compreendidas entre 11 e 15 anos estudam nas escolas oficiais de boane.
Ernesto estudou ate sete classes e parou devido à dificuldade financeira dos seus pais.
Vivem numa casa própria com sua família mais 3 sobrinhos que estão sob sua responsabilidade.
É negociante e comerciante dono do negocio a mais de 30 anos de actividade que aprendeu fazendo no seu próprio estabelecimento com ajuda de um trabalhador. Vende também cervejas, como o seu negocio mais forte, que compra a caixa a 240,00MT e vende a 360,00MT.
Consegue um rendimento diário de 2.500,00MT e poupa 1.500,00MT no esquema tradicional de poupança (xitique).
Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo com a hluvuku e nunca teve algum relaciomento com bancos ou outras instituições de micro finanças e que conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema através da divulgação feita pelos trabalhadores.
Com o empréstimo de 25.000,00MT, pretende reforçar o negocio e satisfazer seus clientes. 
Espera reembolsar sem problemas para, no futuro, aceder a mais empréstimos para cumprir com o sonho de tornar se empresário de sucesso e montar um negocio de fabrico e venda de blocos.
texts.en:
Ernesto Macassa M. is a native of M., he is 51 years old, married and a father of seven children,of which four are adults and the other three (between the ages of 11 and 15) study at official schools in Boane.He lives in his own home with his family and three nephews who are also his responsibility. Ernesto studied until the 7th grade and had to stop because of his fathers financial difficulties. He has been an entrepreneur , a salesman and owner of his own business for more than 30 years. He learned his trade at his own business and with the help of an employee. He also sells beer and that is the strongest area of his business, he buys a case of beer for 240,00MT and sells it for 360,00MT. He is able to make 2.500,00MT daily and saves1.500,00MT in a traditional savings account (known as xitique). This is his first loan with Hluvuku . He has never had a relationship with other banks or micro finance companies and found out about Hluvuku-Adsema through advertisement made by employees. With the loan of 25.000,00MT he plans to strengthen his business and satisfy his customers. He anticipates repaying this loan without problems so, in the future, he can take out more loans to fulfill his dream of being a successful entrepreneur and the owner of his own brick factory.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Hungria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock in his shop

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie M. is from the village of Sibula, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Rosemarie is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosemarie owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a "sari-sari", or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste etc. in the local community. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Rosemarie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13000 PHP from GDMPC. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Rosemarie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Cacilda Ananias

texts.pt:
Cacilda Ananias M. nasceu na província de Gaza (a 300 km a norte de Maputo) tem 38 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 4 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 5 e 17 anos. Os três primeiros estudam nas escolas oficiais de boane.

Cacilda parou de estudar na segunda classe porque a mãe não tinha condições financeiras para sustentar os estudos. Foi abandonada pelo o pai ainda pequena.
Saiu de manjacaze (Gaza) há 22 anos, quando casou se com seu falecido marido.

É comerciante, dona de negocio há 15 anos com ajuda do seu irmão que esta sob sua responsabilidade. aprendeu esta actividade a 18 anos e vende fatos para senhoras, que os compra a 875,00MT e vende  a 1.500,00MT. Consegue um rendimento quinzenal no valor de 7.000,00MT e poupa 1.000,00MT, mensalmente num esquema tradicional de poupança (xitique).

Cacilda nunca teve empréstimos com outros bancos e este é o seu primeiro com a Hluvuku-Adsema no valor de 15.000,00MT e que pretende aumentar o volume do seu negocio e satisfazer seus clientes.
Compromete se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para no futuro aceder a mais creditos assim como dar assistência aos filhos, são órfãos de pai.
texts.en:
Cacilda Ananias M. was born in the province of Gaza, 300 km north of Maputo. She is 38 years old, a widow and the mother of four children aged 5 to 17 years. The first three study in official Boane schools. Cacilda stopped her schooling in second grade because her mother did not have the financial wherewithal to support her studies. She was abandoned by her father when she was still small. She left Manjacaze (Gaza) 22 years ago, when she married her late husband. She is a merchant and has been a businesswoman for 15 years with the help of her brother, whom she has taken in. She learned this business 18 years ago, selling womens clothes, which she buys for 875 MT and sells for 1,500 MT. She manages to make 7,000 MT income every two weeks, and sets aside 1,000 MT per month in a traditional savings plan (xitique). Cacilda has never had loans with other banks, and this is her first with Hluvuku-Adsema in the amount of 15,000 MT, with which she plans to increase the volume of her business and satisfy her customers. She promises to repay the loan without problem so that in future she can accede to more loans and in this way help her children, who are orphans without their father.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stocks in her shop

loans.name: Caddy

texts.en: Caddy K. is a businesswoman of forty-eight years old. She has a hardware shop which she started four years ago. She is using the loan for purchasing more hardware items for her shop. She is blessed with four children and her dream is to educate her children up to university level.

loans.use: For purchasing more hardware items in her shop.

loans.name: Sergio Salomão

texts.pt:
Sergio Salomão M., natural de Maputo, de 28 anos de idade, com nível médio de escolaridade já concluído, casado e pai de um filho menor de idade escolar.
Vive na sua casa construída no mesmo espaço físico no bairro da Massaca, em Boane.
Nunca mudou de residência e sempre viveu com a sua família.

Trabalha para o governo como Docente numa das escolas primarias de boane. Aprendeu esta profissão no Instituto de Magistérios Primários da Matola e exerce esta tarefa desde 2003. Ganha um salário, mensalmente, no valor de 5.500,00MT e consegue poupar na sua conta bancaria 500,00MT.

Nunca teve empréstimos com outros bancos e este é o seu primeiro com a Hluvuku-Adsema no valor de 20.000,00MT para compra de materiais de construção/ ampliação da sua casa.

Compromete se a pagar sem problemas para no futuro aceder a mais empréstimos e cumprir o sonho de iniciar uma actividade comercial.
texts.en:
Sergio Salomão M. is a native of Maputo. He is 28 years old, has finished high school, is married and the father of a child who is still a minor in school. He lives in his house, built in the very same place in the neighbourhood of Massaca in Boane. He has never moved and has always lived with his family. He works for the government as a teacher in one of the elementary schools in Boane. He learned this profession in the Institute of Elementary Teachers of Matola, and has practiced this job since 2003. He earns a monthly salary of 5,500 MT and manages to set aside 500 MT in his bank account. He has never had loans with other banks; this is his first with Hluvuku-Adsema in the amount of 20,000 MT, for purchasing construction materials to build onto his house. He promises to pay the loan back without problem so that in future he can accede to more loans and fulfill his dream of starting his own business.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build onto family home

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
With her desire to help her husband earn money for their family, Charito M. decided to operate a general store in their village. Through that, she earns PHP4,500 a week, most of which is being used to sustain the store. Though all of their children have already finished schooling, she and her husband, Alfredo, still want to improve their lifestyle.

In connection to this, Charito wants to avail of a PHP7,000 loan from Kiva lenders to purchase more commodities for her store. She knows that through that, her income will increase to soon uplift her family’s life. “I have a strong faith in our God, thus I know that he will grant my wish,” Charito shares.

loans.use: To purchase more commodities

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Having a husband who works as a soldier is very difficult for Mrs. Flordeliza S. of Barangay Research Minante 1, Cauayan Isabela. Aside from being far from her husband, she solely takes care of her four children, three of whom are attending elementary school. Her youngest child is only three years old. Though she sometimes feels anxious with the nature of her husband’s job, she is really proud of him.

In order for her to help her husband earn a living, she decided to manage a rice retailing business in their village. Moreover, she is also venturing into direct selling of personal collections. At present, she earns PHP1,000 a week. Wanting to increase her income, she thought of borrowing a loan from Kiva for an amount of PHP20,000 pesos. With that loan, she can buy more rice to sell through her retailing business. With her trust in Kiva, she knows that her loan will be granted.

loans.use: To buy more rice

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen C. is already 59 years old. She is married to Vicente, a foreman in a construction site in Cauayan. They are blessed with six children. The couple proudly said that all of their children have graduated from college. The family is residing at Barangay Research Minante 1, Cauayan City Isabela, in a large community with many residents.

Helen is engaged in direct selling. Aside from that, she also sells some kitchenwares to her friends and neighbors. Being a business-minded person, Helen had also ventured into meat vending three months ago. She usually sells her meat products at Gamu, Isabela. With that, she is earning PHP1,000 daily which is very helpful to her family. Wanting to make her meat vending business grow, she decided to avail of a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP20,000 as additional capital.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Armando Jorge

texts.pt:
Armando Jorge X. nasceu no distrito da Manhica (a 72 km a norte de maputo), masculino de 40 anos de idade, casado e pai de 4 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 8 e 13 anos, todos a estudar.
Estudou ate 10 classe e parou divido as condições financeiras dos seu pais. 

Vive com sua família e mais 3 pessoas sob sua responsabilidade.
Saiu de Manhica no ano de 1983 com seus pais e chagado a boane nunca mais saiu distrito.

É técnico de frio e faz actividade de compra e venda de eletrodoméstica assim como recondicionar artigos avariados. Compra cada geleira a 7.500,00MT e vende a 12.000,00MT, ganha mensalmente 8.000,00MT e consegue poupar algum valor na sua conta bancaria.

Já teve empréstimos numa Associação de credito, este é o seu primeiro com a Hluvuku-Adsema no valor de 12.000,00MT com os quais pretende comprar eletrodomésticos para vender. Conheceu a instituição através de amigos. Compromete se a pagar o credito sem problemas.

Armando pretende fazer um workshop de material convencional, onde clientes possam mandar reparar seus aparelhos de frio e construí 3 casas de aluguer.
texts.en:
Armando Jorge X. was born in the district of Manhica, 72 km north of Maputo. He is 40 years old, married and the father of four children aged 8 to 13, all students. He studied until tenth grade, and then stopped due to his parents' financial situation. He lives with his family and three other people that he has taken in and supports. He left Manhica in 1983 with his parents, arrived in Boane and has never left that district. He is a refrigeration technician; he buys and sells household appliances and reconditions damaged goods. He buys each refrigerator for 7,500 MT and sells it for 12,000 MT, earning 8,000 MT per month, and manages to set aside some funds in his bank account. Armando has already had loans with a credit association. This is his first loan with Hluvuku-Adsema in the amount of 12,000 MT, and with it he plans to buy household appliances to sell. He found out about this institution through friends. He promises to pay back the loan without problems. Armando plans to build a workshop where customers can bring their freezers and refrigerators to be repaired, and to construct three houses to rent out.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stocks in his shop

loans.name: Abdukhalil

texts.en: T. Abdukhalil is 50 years old and lives in Shahristan, Tajikistan, with his wife who helps him with household expenses. They have three children: two help with the agricultural work, and one is studying. For his family’s sake he hopes to make improvements to his house that is too old. For the past five years, Abdukhalil has worked as a farmer; he began working as a farmer with the support of his parents. The biggest difficulty that he faces is a lack of financing and the pests that affect his crop. His future plan for his crops is to be able to make irrigation channels. With the loan Abdukhalil will purchase fertilizers and supplies to apply to his crop to be able to harvest a good crop to sell for better prices in the market. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Shrijana

texts.en:
Shrijana B. has just opened a new restaurant business in the city of Patan located in the Kathmandu Valley, Nepal. Her restaurant has only been open for one week and already there have been many satisfied customers.

Shrijana is applying for a loan of $150 to stock up on food supplies for her restaurant. She and her husband work together cooking the food and make traditional Newari meals which are popular with people belonging to the Newari ethnicity. Buffalo is used to make most Newari foods and a favourite Newari snack is dried buffalo spiced meat, similar in taste to beef jerky.

Shrijana and her husband have been married for one year and do not have any children as yet. Their family home is opposite the restaurant which will make getting to work very easy for both of them. Prior to opening the restaurant she and her husband were working in handicrafts.

loans.use: To buy food supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Umri

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


 Умри Самадова  1958 года рождения, замужем имеет 5 детей. Имеет среднее образование. Торгует на рынке оптом одеждой. Первый кредит получила в 2003 году на покупку фруктов и овощей. Но 2 года назад изза суровой  зимы  все продукты замерзли и она потеряла  свой товар.  И поэтому перешла на торговлю одежду.  Ей нравиться торговать женской одеждой. Кредит получает на  покупку летней одежды.
texts.en:
Umri S. was born in 1958. She is married and has five children. She has a secondary school education. She trades in clothing on the wholesale market . She received her first loan in 2003 to purchase fruits and vegetables. But two years ago due to a harsh winter, all her goods were frozen and she lost her stock. She therefore proceeded to trade in clothing. She likes selling women's clothing. She would like to take out a loan to purchase summerwear.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of women's summer clothing

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en: For Dilorom the most important thing is the well-being of her family. Through her work, she tries to cover their expenses and give them peace. Dilorom dedicates herself to the production of vegetables, especially potatoes. Although her work is very hard and tiring because of the strong sun, she knows that she is being rewarded with the love and smiles of her children. Without a doubt, her labor makes her feel useful as she helps her husband sustain their family - they both make an effort to succeed and do their best at their jobs. The difficulties that they face now come from a lack of money to acquire the necessary fertilizer for their cultivated lands. For this reason they request this loan. To better themselves and to increase their production, a quality fertilizer will produce quality vegetables. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine Q. wants to borrow a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP 35,000. She manages a general store business where she sells different items: snacks, kitchen supplies, soft drinks, and many other commodities. She wants her business to become more progressive. Also she wants to venture into other types of business like selling vegetables and food. 

Having a harmonious relationship with her neighbors and other residents of their community is such a blessing to Josephine’s family. Through that, she is able to have more customers. Being simple and friendly, according to her, is her secret in having more companions.

Josephine and her husband are blessed with four children and three of them are attending elementary school. A better future and a happy family is her dream for her children.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Being engaged in fish vending for 30 years is such an achievement, and while it has been a challenge to maintain a business in those long years, Marilyn M. has done it. At the age of 54, still very energetically selling her fish in the market and at the same time operating a food processing business, she says that patience is really her foundation in achieving her dreams. Her monthly income of PHP 4,000 is used to help meet their household expenses.

Marilyn’s husband, Wenceslao, is a carpenter. Her oldest child, Alfredo, is a construction worker while her other child is only eight years old and currently enrolled in Grade 2. They are peacefully living at barangay Research Minante 1, Cauayan, Isabela. With her desire to improve her business, Marilyn is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to use as additional capital that will enable her to buy different kinds of fish to sell to her customers.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina E. is from the village of Panduma Sr., Tukuran, Zamoanga del Sur. She is 43 years old. Merlina is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Merlina owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a sari-sari, or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Merlina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Merlina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Merlina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Merlina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and pay the tuition of children.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Panduma Sr. Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie A. really values education; thus she is working hard in order to give her daughter a good quality education. She knows that with an education her child will be able to have a fruitful future. Marjorie has operated a general store for many years now. It is situated at their house at Research Minante 1, Cauayan, Isabela. Aside from her store, Melchor, her husband, manages a small poultry operation for their other source of income.

With her desire to give her daughter a good life, Marjorie decided to take out a loan of 25,000 PHP from Kiva. The loan will be used as additional capital for her store. Furthermore, she can save part of the loan for the education of her child, for she is now a high-school student.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Khamiat

texts.en: N. Khamiat has been in the retail business for over ten years. She has a retail shop in Nateete. She is using the loan to purchase retail shop items such as soap, sugar, salt, tea leaves, sweets, breads, etc. to sell in her shop, hence adding stock and expanding her business. She is encouraged by her husband, who is also a hardworking businessman. They are blessed with five children who are going to school. Her dream is to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as soap, sugar, salt, tea leaves, sweets, breads, etc. to sell in her shop

loans.name: Venturada

texts.en:
Venturada has managed a hog-raising business for three years already. She started with only one piglet and has been able to improve her business and eventually have the number of her animals multiply.

But due to insufficient capital to sustain her livestock business, Venturada is requesting Kiva to lend her PHP 7,000. With this amount, she will then be able to buy enough feed supply for her pigs. She will also be able to purchase vaccines for the protection of her animals. She hopes that her hog-raising business will grow and eventually turn into a bigger piggery business.

Venturada is already 38 years old. She is married to Victorino A. and they are blessed with three children, namely: Ryan - 17 years old; followed by Victorino A. Jr. - 14 years old, a second-year high school student; and their youngest is Mae Ann - 7 years old who is a grade 1 pupil. They are presently residing at Barangay Allangigan, Angadanan, Isabela, a rural and plain area.

loans.use: To buy feed and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Behildes

texts.en: Behildes D. is from the village of Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 22 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. Behildes owns and operates a business selling crabs and shrimps in the local community. She has been engage in the business for three years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Behildes joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Behildes is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Babita

texts.en:
Babita S. is an experienced weaver who makes warm winter accessories such as socks, shawls and hats. Babita is requesting a loan of Rs. 15,000 to purchase new woolen material so she can continue to make her winter accessories which she supplies to a number of shops in Kathmandu and also to buyers overseas.

Babita explained that it is very easy to sell her stock during the colder months, but since it is very hot right now in Nepal, there is little demand for her products. She is certain that the demand will increase in winter and this loan will help her increase her stock in preparation.

Babita’s husband helps her in the business, and the couple has two children, a daughter who is in primary school and a son who is five months old.

loans.use: To buy materials for making winter accessories.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Мавлуда Холикова  1956 года рождения, замужем имеет 5 детей.  Имеет среднее образование. Торгует на рынке калошами, женской и детской одеждой. Товар привозит с Уратюбе каждые 2 -3 недели.  ежедневная продажа приносит неплохой доход от каждой прибыли она оставляет небольшую часть на погашение а остальное что бы поехать еще раз за товаром. За домашним хозяйством отвечает ее муж и старший сын.  Кредит получает на покупку летнего сезона .
texts.en:
Born in 1956, Mavluda K. is married and has 5 children. She has a secondary education. She sells shoes and women’s and children’s clothing. Mavluda brings her merchandise from Uratube every 2-3 weeks. Her everyday sales bring in a good income, and she uses part of each profit for repayment and the rest to obtain new merchandise. Her husband and oldest son look after the household. Mavluda is obtaining this loan to purchase summer merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of summer merchandise

loans.name: Charibel

texts.en:
Charibel M. is a responsible mother who aims to improve their standard of living. She wants to have their own house in their village in Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. In order to fulfill this dream, and also to provide for the needs of their family and the educational needs of their children, she and her husband are working hard. 

Charibel operates a passenger tricycle as her source of income while her husband works as a bus conductor. She can earn a daily income of PHP 150 to PHP 200 a day which is quite enough to meet their basic needs.

With her desire to achieve her dream house, Charibel would like to borrow PHP 9,000 to further maintain her motorcycle-transport business which is her source of income. With her motorcycle, she believes that she can save some of her income for their house. She also wants to put up her own store in the future. Charibel says that “nothing is impossible to a person who keeps on trying.”

loans.use: To further maintain her motorcycle-transport business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy D. is from the village of Panay Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old, married and has four school-aged children. Nancy owns and operates a sari-sari or general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc., in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Nancy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bidya

texts.en:
Bidya N. is requesting a Kiva loan of Rs. 15,000 to purchase steel materials for her factory.

Bidya and her husband own a small factory on Ring Road, the main road circling the city of Kathmandu in Nepal. The factory makes steel meat-cutting machines and also makes repairs to small machines. Her husband does a lot of the manual labour in the factory and there are also two to three workers employed at a time, depending on how many orders the factory has received.

Bidya is the mother of four children: three daughters and one son, all of whom are currently in school. She hopes that her factory can continue to generate a stable income for her family so she can provide her children with many opportunities.

loans.use: To purchase steel to make new meat-cutting machines

loans.name: Kamarniso

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Камарнисо женщина - 40 лет. Замужем имеет 3-х детей.Она занимается продажей женской одежды. Она торгует в Торговом Центре "Бадри Мунир" находящийся в районе "Панчшанбе" города Худжанда.В пятницу она выходит на рынок "Джума-базар", а в воскресенье на рынок "Якшанбе-базар". Камарнисо закупает товар в городе Бишкек  Республики Кыргызстан. Она ездит за товаром 2 раз в месяц.Камарнисо уже 4 года кредитуется у нас.Когда она начинала у нее было маленькое количество товара. но сейчас Камарнисо расширилась и за свой последний кредит, она закупило партию женских костюмов.
texts.en:
Kamarniso is a 40-year-old woman. She is married and has 3 children. She sells women’s clothing at the Badri Munir Shopping Center, located in the Panchshanbe district of Khujand. She goes to the Djuma-bazar on Fridays and to the Yakshanbe-bazar on Sundays. Kamarniso buys her merchandise in the city of Bishkek in the Kyrgyzstan Republic. She travels there twice per month. Kamarniso has been our client for 4 years. When she first started, she had a small quantity of merchandise, but now Kamarniso expanded and bought a stock of women’s suits with her last loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline R. is from the village of Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 62 years old, widowed, and has six adult children. Evangeline owns and operates a sari-sari or general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2008, Evangeline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jenette

texts.en: Jenette R. is from the village of San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 44 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. Jenette owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Jenette joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. Jenette is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to pay for the tuition of her children. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
