She lives in one with her husband. She gave the other one to her son so that could live there with his family. Due to the hard work she did in her youth, she suffers from pains in her feet. But, that does not discourage her from continuing to work on her farm. In spite of her limitations, she helps her husband take care of the plants. She really likes to think about her crops, and she likes working with them. She gets up at five in the morning to cut wood and prepare food. Then, at eight in the morning she heads for the field, where her husband is already doing the agricultural work. She happily joins the work. During all of these years, agriculture has given them much happiness. Thanks to agriculture they could build their houses and proviD. comforts for their children. Therefore, this couple does not think about leaving their crops. On the contrary, while they have the strength they continue acquiring more land to rent out in their old age. Estela has been working with MFP for ten consecutive loans. During these years she has demonstrated punctuality in her payments. She is very used to all of the members of her community bank, and she greatly appreciates them like they were family. She will use the money she is now asking for to buy ten sacks of chemical fertilizer, which she calculates will cost 1,900 PEN. With the rest of the money she will pay the workers who clean and prepare her farm for planting.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers and pay their workers

loans.name: Bokk Xalaat Group

texts.fr:
LE GROUPEMENT BOKK XALAAT  est un groupe composé de cinq femmes tres dynamiques qui font du petit commerce et habitent au quartier concorde
elles font des activités génératrices de revenu telles que la restauration,la vente de tissus ,de jus et de parfum;avec le pret qu'elles sollicitent ,elles envisagent d'augmenter leur fonds de roulement
texts.en:
The group BOKK XALAAT is composed of 5 energetic women who are involved in petty trading and live in the Concorde neighborhood.

They make a living selling cooked food, cloth, juice, perfume, etc. With the loan that they are requesting, they plan to add to their working capital.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to their working capital

loans.name: Irma Beatriz Martínez Palacios

texts.es: Irma Beatriz M. P. vive en el departamento de San Vicente ubicado en el oriente del país. Irma tiene tan solo 24 años de edad  vive con su hija Luz de 7 años que actualmente se encuentra cursando kínder, el esposo de Irma trabaja en Estados Unidos y aporta a la familia 200$ mensuales. Irma se dedica a la venta de frutas como mango, papaya, guayaba entre otras, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado de Zacatecoluca; Irma posee buenas ventas ya que distribuye sus productos a clientes fijos en el transcurso de la semana. Irma solicita un crédito por que desea aumentar su inventario para poder comercializar su frutas al por mayor donde le permitirá obtener un mayor margen de ganancias.
texts.en:
Irma Beatriz M. P. lives in the department of San Vicente in the east of El Salvador. She is only 24 years old and lives with her 7-year-old daughter Luz, who currently attends kindergarten. Irma's husband works in the United States and supports the family with $200 a month. Irma makes a living selling fruits, such as mangoes, papayas, guavas, among others. Her business is located in the Zacatecoluca market, and she has good sales because she distributes her products to a fixed clientele over the course of the week. Irma is requesting a loan because she wishes to increase her inventory in order to sell her fruits at wholesale, which will give her better earnings margins.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of fruits

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es: Haydee tiene 35 años, es una mujer con mucha fortaleza y coraje, quedó viuda hace 6 meses y actualmente vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. La siembra y venta de diversos productos se ha convertido en la mejor actividad económica que desarrolla, tras el fallecimiento de su esposo quedó endeudada, fue entonces cuando sacó  fortaleza anímica y se propuso trabajar el doble en sus cultivos. La tierra y su esfuerzo dieron buenos frutos y pudo pagar todas sus cuentas, desde entonces se encuentra mucho más tranquila y motivada a seguir trabajando por el bienestar de sus hijos que están en crecimiento y espera que de mayores la ayuden con las siembras. A Haydee le agrada cultivar y cuidar sus plantas, sobre todo las arvejas, porque cosecha tres veces de una sola siembra y esto le genera muy buenas ganancias. Sus anhelos a futuro son de incrementar su producción para comprar más terrenos de cultivo que le generen más dinero para la educación de sus hijos. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, durante los periodos concluidos demostró mucha entrega y responsabilidad en sus pagos. Y en los diversos eventos que se organizan, como por ejemplo actividades deportivas; ella es quien les da el ánimo de triunfo a sus compañeros, por lo que se ha ganado el aprecio de todos en su banco comunal. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de dos bolsas de semilla de arvejas de una calidad que resista el clima helado.
texts.en:
Haydee is 35 years old and is a very strong and courageous woman. She became a widow six month ago and currently lives with her three children in her own home. After the death of her husband left her indebted, her main economic activity became planting and selling diverse products, and she had to stay strong and work doubly hard on her crops. The land and her efforts bared fruit, and she was able to pay off all of her debts. Since then she has been much more calm and motivated to keep working for the wellbeing of her children, who are still growing. She hopes the older ones can help with the planting. Haydee enjoys cultivating and caring for her plants, especially her peas, because she can harvest them three times with only one planting and that helps her generate very nice earnings. Her goal for the future is to increase her production to be able to purchase more land to cultivate, which will help her earn more money for her children's education. This is her 10th loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she has shown herself to be very responsible and dedicated to her payments. In the various events the community bank organizes, for example sporting functions, Haydee is who lifts the spirits of her companions because she has earned the esteem of all the bank's members. She plans to use the money she is requesting to invest in the purchase of two bags of pea seeds that resist frost.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pea seeds

loans.name: Blanca Ruth

texts.es: Blanca Ruth C. H. vive en el departamento de Cuscatlán junto a sus dos hermanos y su madre Doña Petrona de 82 años de edad. Blanca se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como perfumes, cremas para el cuerpo, desodorantes, entre otros. Blanca tiene 12 años de experiencia en su negocio donde la manera de comercializar su mercadería es de forma ambulante es decir de casa en casa, pero también Blanca posee un pequeño inventario en una vitrina de su casa donde los vecinos pueden ir a comprar para uso personal o algún regalo que quiera dar ya que también Blanca posee materiales para hacer regalos. Este crédito lo solicita por que desea comprar mercadería por mayor ya que de esta manera logra conseguir precios más baratos en sus productos y así logra obtener mayores ganancias de los mismos.
texts.en:
Blanca Ruth C. H. lives in the department of Cuscatlán along with her two brothers and her 82-year-old mother, Doña Petrona. Blanca makes a living selling beauty products, such as perfumes, lotions and deodorant, among other items. She has 12 years experience in the business, selling her products door to door, but she also has a small inventory in a display case at her home where her neighbors can come to buy something for themselves or for a gift because she also has gift-wrapping materials. She is requesting the loan because she wishes to purchase her merchandise at wholesale in order to get her products at cheaper prices, and in this way obtain better earnings herself.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase her merchandise at wholesale

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 50 años, es una mujer trabajadora y muy abnegada por sus hijos, es madre de 3 hijos varones, vive con su esposo en su casa propia. Trabaja desde las 4 de la mañana en sus tierras de cultivo y algunas veces riega sus chacras desde a las 2 de la madrugada, ya que para esa hora le programan su turno y aprovecha mejor el caudal del agua. A Julia trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo, pero para la venta de las papas, arvejas y flores, ella se levanta a la 3 de la mañana para llegar a 4 a la ciudad de Tarma, hora clave para las buenas ventas y a eso de las 9 de la mañana regresa a casa contenta y feliz con sus ganancias. Para el futuro le gustaría ahorrar dinero y comprarse más chacras para tener una vejez tranquila. Ella es una cliente muy responsable, durante sus anteriores 9 créditos consecutivos demostró puntualidad en cada uno de sus pagos y para este préstamo se compromete de seguir cumpliendo. En las reuniones de mes de su banco comunal siempre está muy atenta a todos los acuerdos de su grupo. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes químicos, en busca del fortalecimiento de sus tierras para lograr una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Julia is a very hardworking woman. She is 50 years old, married, and the mother of 3 sons. The family lives in their own home. She begins work on her farm at 4am, but sometimes she starts her shift at 2am because that is the best time to irrigate the fields.

Working with husband, Julia sells potatoes, peas and flowers. On market days, she wakes up at 3am so that she can get to the city of Tarma by 4am. Timing is the key to good sales. By 9am, she has returned home satisfied and happy with the day’s earnings. In the future, she would like to save enough money to buy more farmland and live to a peaceful old age.

Julia is a very responsible client. In her previous 9 loans, she demonstrated punctuality with each payment and she promises to do the same with her current loan. During her monthly communal bank meetings, she is very attentive and gets along well with the other group members. She will use the money to buy chemical fertilizers to improve her land for a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: La Solucion 3 Group

texts.en:
Marta P. (on the far left in the picture) is the group coordinator for a group of five women form the Sabana Perdida neighborhood of Santo Domingo. She lives in a small house near the Ozama River with her husband and three children. Two of her children are girls, ages 8 and 5, and the third is a two-year-old boy. Marta's business is a successful fruit stand located on a busy road in Santo Domingo. She sells a wiD. variety of fruit, including watermelon, papaya, mango, green bananas, pineapple, and melons.

Marta intends to use this loan for working capital to continue increasing both the stock and and variety of the fruit that she sells. Additionally, Marta has ambitions to use the larger profits she will realize from selling more fruit to begin to stock a small fantasia (a variety store, usually with underwear, school supplies, cosmetics, and jewelry) that she will operate from her home.

Where Marta lives, her home is at risk from flooding when the river swells during hurricanes and tropical storms. Also, the house that she lives in has a leaky roof and weak walls. With the money that Marta hopes to gain from her fruit stand and fantasia, she plans to first improve her house with a stronger roof and cement walls. However, in the long run, her goal is to move away from the river to a neighborhood on high ground. She firmly believes that this is the right thing to do for herself and her husband, but, particularly, she wants her children to be able to grow in a stable house so that they will be able to focus on their schooling.

This is Marta's third loan from Esperanza. She has successfully repaid the first two loans. Marta described how, at first, she was afraid to take out a loan because she was very poor and was worried that she would not be able to pay back the loan. However, after discussing the loan with her husband, and much prayer, she decided that she would take the loan. Thus far, Marta says Esperanza has helped her to expand her business and earn more money, in addition to repaying her loan. Now, she says that she has more confidence in herself and her business abilities. When asked what she had to say to potential Kiva lenders, Marta said "I hope that they will lend as much money as possible to help people like me, because it has helped people like me to live a better life and give a better life to their children."

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to sell at her fruit stand and to improve her business.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es: Nilda tiene 31 años, es una mujer de carácter pasivo y buen trato, actualmente vive con su pareja y padre de sus 2 hijos en la casa de sus suegros. La crianza y venta de animales menores (cuyes y conejos) es la actividad que realiza desde que formó su familia. Cada jueves y domingo lleva de 8 a 12 cuyes al mercado de la ciudad de Tarma por ser días de feria, en la mayoría de las veces vende cada cuy a 10 ó 12 soles y en caso de los  conejos, a 25 soles; pero cuando no termina de vender debido a la competencia los remata a los revendedores hasta 8 soles cada cuy y 15 cada conejo para regresar a casa comprando alimentos concentrados de engorde para sus animales. Mientras tanto, su esposo se dedica a la siembra de papas y arvejas, en algunas oportunidades ella lo apoya, sobre todo en los días de cosecha, es la encargada de la recolección de las papas. Nilda está muy contenta con las actividades que realiza, por ello anhela incrementar la cantidad de sus animales y comprar terrenos de cultivos para sembrar avena para alimentarlos. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP y durante los periodos concluidos demostró pagar puntualmente y ser muy respetuosa de los acuerdos de su banco comunal, donde además estima mucho a sus compañeros. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para la construcción de otras jaulas para sus animales y de alimentos concentrados para que engorden con rapidez.
texts.en:
Nilda is 31 years old. She is a quiet, well-mannered woman. She lives with her partner, the father of her 2 children, in the home of her in-laws.

Since starting her family, Nilda has been in the business of breeding and selling small animals (guinea pigs and rabbits). Every Thursday and Sunday she brings 8 to 12 guinea pigs to market in the town of Tarma. Most of the time, each guinea pig sells for 10 or 12 soles while a rabbit sells for 25 soles. Her sales come to an end when competing merchants start liquidating and lower their prices to 8 soles per guinea pig and 15 soles per rabbit. Before returning home, she stops to buy food concentrates to fatten her remaining animals.

Meanwhile, Nilda’s husband is engaged in the planting of potatoes and peas. She sometimes helps with the planting, but her main responsibility comes at harvest time when she is responsible for gathering the potatoes. Nilda is very happy with her business, so she is eager to buy more animals and acquire more farmland to grow oats for animal feed.

This is her tenth loan with MFP. During her previous loan periods, she was punctual with her payments. She is respected by her communal bank group and gets along well with the other members. The money she is requesting will be used to buy construction materials for animal cages and food concentrates to help her animals gain weight quickly.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animal feed and building materials to make cages

loans.name: Erika Yamileth

texts.es: Erika Yamileth P. U. reside en la capital de El Salvador. Erika es madre soltera de 23 años de edad vive con sus dos hijas Katherina de 5 años y Abigail de 2 años de edad. Erika posee un negocio donde comercializa ropa interior para dama y caballeros, donde recibe ingresos diarios ya que sus ventas son al contado, Erika solita un crédito para aumentar su inventario en ropa interior de esta manera lograra aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Erika Yamileth P. U. lives in the capital of El Salvador. Erika is a 23 year old mother of two children; Katherina is 5, and Abigail is 2. Erika has a business of selling women’s and men’s underwear. She receives daily income because her sales are for cash. Erika is asking for a loan to increase her underwear inventory. That way she will be able to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy underwear for her business

loans.name: Vladimir Alberto

texts.es: Vladimir Alberto R. M. reside en el municipio de Santa Tecla ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vladimir es un hombre casado de 29 años de edad vive junto a su esposa Marta de 29 años de edad y su pequeña hijita Kenia de 2 años. Vladimir se dedica a su negocio que es un pequeño taller de sastrería donde confecciona ropa para caballeros sus ingresos diarios por sus confecciones oscilan en los 50$ , Vladimir solicita un crédito para compra de tela,  ya que se acerca la época del año donde  los estudiantes buscan diferentes tipos de confecciones para el día de su graduación es por eso que Vladimir necesita surtir su inventario en materia prima para la elaboración de ropa de esta manera logara acaparar muchos clientes que busquen de sus servicios.
texts.en:
Vladimir Alberto R. M. lives in the Santa Tecla municipality, which is located in the La Libertad department. Vladimir is 29 and married. He lives with his 29 year old wife, Marta, and his 2 year old daughter, Kenia. Vladimir has a small tailor’s shop where he makes men’s clothing. He takes in about $50 a day. Vladimir is asking for a loan to buy fabric. The time of year when the students look for different types of clothes for their graduation is getting close. That is why Vladimir needs to stock his inventory of raw materials for making clothes. This is the way he will get many customers who look for his services.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material (fabric)

loans.name: El Señor Es Mi Pastor #1 Group

texts.en:
Maria lives in Barrio Azul Andres, a town in the municipality of Boca Chica, a well-known tourist area. Boca Chica is known for having soft, white sand; a place where the water is calm, clear and shallow. But what tourists don’t normally see are those who are trying to survive in the nearby communities. Especially now in the down-turning economy, many are left without employment because businesses keep on shutting their doors.

That is why Maria started her own business four years ago -- to try to secure a steady income. She has her own shop where she sells clothes, intimate wear, kids' school uniforms, school supplies, and decorations for the house. Often, when Maria finds it is time to re-stock, but doesn’t have much money saved up to do so, she borrows money from local lenders. The local lenders charge a 20% interest rate per week!

Maria found out about Esperanza through her neighbor and close friend and now she is seeking a loan through Esperanza. Esperanza charges a 2% declining balance interest rate every two weeks; 4% per month. Esperanza also helps its clients with complimentary services, such as a savings account, medical and life insurance, literacy courses, and business management training, just to name a few.

Please strongly consider lending to Maria and her group. They deserves a fair interest rate and an opportunity to grow their businesses. Esperanza thanks you for your time and consideration.

loans.use: To purchase cloth to make school uniforms, school supplies, candles, aromatics, intimate wear, and clothes to resell.

loans.name: Lubia Maritza

texts.es: Lubia Maritza V. S. de 35 años de edad vive en el departamento de La Libertad, junto a su madre Doña Esperanza de 78 años y su hija Maricela de 5 años de edad. Lubia se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de la marca Mary Kay, la manera de comercializar sus productos es de forma ambulante visitando a sus clientes  hasta sus casas y también muchos vecinos que conocen de sus productos buscan a Lubia cuando lo desean, Lubia solicita un crédito por que desea compra mercadería como perfumes, cremas y otros para poder comercializar a sus clientes y a su vez mejorar sus ingresos a través de sus ventas.
texts.en:
Lubia Maritza V. S. is 35. She lives in the La Libertad department with her 78 year old mother, Esperanza, and her 5 year old daughter, Maricela. Lubia sells Mary Kay beauty products. She is a street vendor, and she goes to her customers’ houses. She also has many neighbors who look for her when they want her products. Lubia is asking for a loan because she wants to buy more merchandise like perfume, creams, and others to be able to sell to her customers. She will increase her income through her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her inventory ( perfumes )

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: Juan Alberto R. H. de 46 años de edad reside en el departamento de La Libertad junto a su esposa y su hija de 17 años de edad que se encuentra cursando el bachillerato. Juan posee un negocio en el cual hacer reparaciones a celulares, venden recargas de celulares y accesorios para los mismo, Juan tiene 6 años de experiencia en su negocio el cual es atendido por él y un primo que le ayuda, sus ingresos diarios son aproximadamente 60$. Este crédito Juan lo solita por que quiere comprar variedad de estuches para teléfonos celulares ya que poseen gran demanda entre sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juan Alberto R. H. is 46. He lives in the La Libertad department with his wife and his 17 year old daughter who is in high school. Juan repairs cell phones. He sells cell chargers and accessories. He has been in this business for six years. He runs the business, and a cousin helps him. His takes in about $60 a day. Juan is asking for this loan because he wants to buy a variety of cell phone covers, which are in great demand by his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cell phone covers

loans.name: Kenis Beatriz

texts.es: Kenis Beatriz R. D. F. resiD. en el municipio D. San Martin ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Kenis tiene 29 años D. edad, vive con esposo y su hijo Emerson D. 6 años D. edad. Kenis posee ayuda económica D. su esposo ya que él trabaja como cocinero el  Aeropuerto D. El Salvador. Kenis tiene D. dos años D. haber montado su negocio en su casa, es una pequeña tienda la cual ha ido surtiendo poco a poco y por eso que hoy solicita un crédito ya que  desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio que le deja ganancias satisfactorias y ve necesario comprar más variedad D. productos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Kenis Beatriz R. D. F. resides in the municipality of San Martin, located in San Salvador. Kenis, 29, lives with her husband and her six-year-old son, Emerson. Kenis has economic help from her husband who works as a cook in the El Salvador Airport. Kenis started up her business in her home two years ago. It's a small store which has been stocking up little by little, and for that reason, today she's asking for a loan, desiring to continue investing in her business which gives her satisfactory earnings. She sees it necessary to purchase a greater variety of products for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking up her store

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.es:
Carmelo es productor de leche de vaca que comercializa a la empresa PIL S.A.; la esposa es pequeña agricultora y también cuentan con un pequeño taller de bordados de ropa Folklórica que alquilan para diferentes entradas (parades in english); ambos son  de la tercera edad y por esa misma condición fue discriminada en otras instituciones y negada para otorgarle un préstamo.

Viven en la comunidad Villandrani de la provincia los Andes a dos horas y media de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El crédito lo destinará para la compra de materia prima (telas de colores, hilos, forros, etc.) para poder confeccionar mayor cantidad de ropa folklórica.
 
Es el tercer crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago que demostró con nuestra institución le permite acceder a otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Carmelo is a milk producer who markets to the PIL S.A. business. His wife is a small farmer, and they also have a small embroidery of folk clothing that they rent for different events. Both are in their old age, and were thus discriminated against in other institutions and denied the opportunity to be offered a loan. They live in the Villandrani community of the Los Andes Province, two and a half hours from the city of El Alto. The loan will serve to purchase raw materials (colored fabric, thread, lining, etc.) to be able to make a greater quantity of folk clothing. It's their third loan with IMPRO; their disciplined payment will allow them to access another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of colored fabric, thread, and lining for folk clothing

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es: Petronila M. reside en la capital de El Salvador. Petronila tiene 39 años de edad vive junto a su hija Carolina de 18 años de edad. Petronila se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos posee su negocio en el mercado de Santiago Texacuango donde mantiene un clientela muy estable, el negocio también es atendido por hija Carolina que trabaja junto a ella. Petronila solicita un crédito por que quiere surtir su negocio con variedad en ropa ya que hasta el momento carece de muchos estilos que se encuentran de moda por el momento y sus clientes  los demandan.
texts.en:
Petronila M. resides in the capital of El Salvador. 39-years-old, Petronila lives with her 18-year-old daughter, Carolina. She sells clothes and cosmetics for a living, owning a business in the Santiago Texacuango Market where she maintains a stable clientele. Her business is also attended to by her daughter, Carolina, who works together with her. Petronila is asking for a loan because she wants to stock her business with a variety of clothes, since she currently lacks a number of styles that are in fashion right now and that her clients demand.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking up her store with more clothing variety

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia tiene una tienda de abarrotes y carnicería ubicada en la Zona Rio Seco de la Ciudad de El Alto, el esposo es empleado de la empresa EPSAS como plomero. De estas dos actividades provienen sus ingresos económicos para la manutención de sus tres hijos que dependen de la pareja; la familia  vive en la casa de los padres de Virginia, ubicada en Zona Rio Seco de la misma ciudad.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de mercadería para su tienda de abarrotes para poder satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que tiene en su mercado.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Virginia has a grocery and butcher's shop located in the Rio Seco Zone of the city of El Alto. Her husband is employed with EPSAS as a plumber. Their income comes from these two economic activities for the maintenance of their three children who depend on them. The family lives in the home of Virginia's parents, located in the Rio Seco Zone of the same city. The loan will serve to purchase merchandise for their grocery store in order to satisfy demand. It is the first loan with IMPRO; the completed evaluation qualifies them to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for their grocery store

loans.name: 15 De Diciembre Group

texts.en: The members of this group all live in the same community, and know each other very well. They have a surprising diversity of businesses. One woman buys and sells pigs, and would like a loan to buy more pigs to increase her business. Other women have stores that sell cosmetics, meals, and groceries, and would like to buy more stock for their stores. One member is a bricklayer who works in the area. In addition, some women have bread shops, fruit stands, and soft drink stands. All of the women are committed to improving their businesses by increasing their stock and paying back their loan on time. This group have previous experience with loans.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to increase her business

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es: Narcisa G. B. de 54 años de edad vive el departamento de San Salvador junto a su esposo Miguel  y su hijo Miguel junior de 15 años de edad quien actualmente se encuentra estudiando el bachillerato. Narcisa se dedica a la confección y venta de ropa deportiva posee siete años de experiencia en su negocio en el cual también recibe ayuda de su esposo, Narcisa solita un crédito para compra de materia prima para la elaboración de ropa deportiva ya que no cuentan con variedad de tallas en sus estilos fabricados.
texts.en:
Narcisa G. B. is 54 years old, and lives in the department of San Salvador with her husband, Miguel, and her son, Miguel Jr., who is 15 years old and is in high school. Narcisa has seven years of experience making and selling sportswear, and her husband helps her. Narcisa is asking for a loan to buy raw material to make sportswear because they do not have a variety of sizes for their styles.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw material to make clothing

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana trabaja en el magisterio como profesora de lenguaje en dos establecimientos; vive con su padre y esposo y por el momento no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona Ciudad Satelite de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de material de construcción para refaccionar la vivienda de su padre que se encuentra con deterioros.
 
Es el cuarto  crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobar otro préstamo solicitado por la prestataria.
texts.en:
Juana works as a language teacher in two establishments. She lives with her father and husband. They currently have no children. She lives in her parents’ house, which is located in the Cuidad Satelite zone in the city of El Alto. The loan is to buy construction materials to refurbish her father’s house, which has deteriorated. This is her fourth loan with Impro. Her good payment history qualifies her for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of construction materials to refurbish her father's house, which has deteriorated

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Ana Luias M. tiene ya más de siete años dedicándose a la venta de comida preparada. 
Al negocio le está haciendo falta más espacio donde poner mesas y sillas para que los clientes puedan consumir sus alimentos más cómodos. 
Pero en esté momento no cuanta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el mobiliario y ampliar el negocio, y no quiere descapitalizarse su ingreso, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo. 
La persona que aparece en la foto es su hijo quien le ayuda atender el negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Luias M. has been selling prepared food for over seven years. The business needs more space for tables and chairs so that her customers can eat more comfortably. But, she does not currently have the money that is necessary to be able to buy the furniture and expand her business. She does not want to under capitalize her income. That is why she is asking for this loan. The person in the photo is her son; he helps her take care of the business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy furniture and expand her business

loans.name: Mbaye

texts.fr: MR MBAYE F. est un chauffeur de profession né en 1962 à thies ;il est marié et est père de trois enfants ;son activité consiste à livrer du ciment vers le mali et envisage d'acheter des marchandises à bon prix pour pouvoir les revendre à thies dans le but d'améliorer ses revenus;avec ce pret il veut renforcer son fonds de roulement
texts.en:
Mr. MBAYE F. is a professional driver, born in 1962 in Thies. He is married and the father of three children. His business consists in transporting cement to Mali and he would like to buy merchandise at good prices to re-sell in Thies so as to increase his income. With this loan he hopes to bolster his working capital.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to his working capital

loans.name: Ariel Ignacio

texts.es:
El microempresario Ariel Ignacio Salieron Obregón tiene 43 años de edad es casado tiene 2 hijos, uno estudia en secundaria y otro se encuentra estudiando en la universidad. El señor Salmerón es dueño de un vehiculo (Taxi) con el cual brinda labores de transporte selectivo en esta ciudad de Bluefields.

Sin embargo por las condiciones de las vías (calles) los vehículos se dañan con bastante frecuencia lo que obligan a los dueños de estos a tener que darle mantenimiento con bastante frecuencia, por tal razón el conducto Salmerón requiere comprar algunos repuestos para su taxi. Por lo que esta solicitando se le financie para comprar lo siguiente:

1 vulvo de freno el que le cuesta US 130, 1 radiador cuesta US 150, 2 focos delanteros US 70 cada uno, 4 llantas Rucyer US 60 cada una, 1 compresor para aire acondicionado cuesta US 190 y 1 vidrio delantero cuesta US 150.
texts.en:
Ariel Ignacio Salieron Obregón, an entrepreneur, is 43 years old and married. He has two children. One is in high school, and the other is in the university. Mr. Salmerón owns a vehicle, which he uses to provide taxi services in the city of Bluefield. Due to the road conditions, cars get damaged frequently. The vehicle owners, therefore, must perform maintenance frequently. That is why Mr. Salmerón needs to buy some replacement parts for his taxi. He will use the loan to buy the following: Brake repair that costs US 130, radiator that costs US 150, headlights that cost US 70 per light, 4 Rucyer tiles that cost US 60 per tire, compressor for the air conditioning that costs US 190, and front windshield that costs US 150.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Part for the brake, radiador, 2 headlights, 4  Rucyer tires, air conditioner compressor and front windshield

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria Luisa es artesana, elabora masitas (pequeños pasteles muy sabrosos) que comercializa en la Ciudad de El Alto; vive con su padre de la tercera edad y sus dos hijos que están en la escuela estatal. La casa donde vive es de su padre y está ubicada en la zona Ciudad Satelite de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de materia prima, como ser harina, manteca y otros, para poder satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que tiene en su mercado.

Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por la prestataria.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa is a food artisan, producing “masitas” (small pastries that are quite delicious) which she sells in the city of El Alto. She lives with her elderly father and her two sons who attend state schools. Her father’s house, in which she and her family live, is located in a suburb of the city of El Alto.

Her loan will be used to purchase raw materials such as flour, lard and other ingredients to meet the high demand encountered by her business.

This is Maria Luisa’s first loan with IMPRO. Her evaluation indicated she meets the qualifications for approval of the requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, lard and other ingredients

loans.name: Alvina

texts.es:
Alvina trabaja como vivandera (vende comida) y tiene un puesto de venta en el mercado de su zona; el esposo es chofer asalariado. Ambas actividades constituyen su principal fuente de ingreso con que mantienen a sus dos pequeños hijos de 3 años y el otro de 6 meses; la familia vive en alquiler  en una casa ubicada en la zona German Busch del barrio Alto Lima.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de víveres como  papa, arroz, fideo, etc., por cantidad, así podrá tener un stock de materia prima para poder trabajar por un determinado tiempo.
 
Es el segundo  crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobar otro préstamo solicitado por la prestataria.
texts.en:
Alvina works selling food and she has a stand in the marketplace of her area. Her husband is a driver and he is paid a salary. Alvina and her husband use the incomes from their two jobs to support their two young children, who are 3 years old and 6 months old. The family rents a home that is located in the German Busch area of the neighborhood Alto Lima.

The loan that Alvina is requesting will be used to buy ingredients like potatoes, rice, pasta, etc. in bulk. That way she will be able to have a reserve of the ingredients that she needs to prepare the foods that she sells.

This is the second loan that she has received through Impro and her good history of making her payments on time has led Impro to approve her request for a second loan.

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of potatoes, rice, pastas and other ingredients used to prepare foods to sell.

loans.name: J Manuel

texts.es:
El señor J Manuel M. tiene ya mas de un años con su negocio de venta de (nieve y paletas de helo), es la fuente de ingresos para su familia.

El quiere compara mercancía y una amasadora para empezar un nuevo negocio de panadería, en este momento no cuanta con el dinero necesario para poder invertir.

Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo y empezar el negocio de panadería.
texts.en:
Mr. J Manuel M. has been in business for over a year selling snow cones and popsicles in order to support his family.

He wants to buy merchandise and a mixer to start a new bakery business. At the moment, he does not have the money for the initial investment.

For this reason, he is requesting a business loan to start the bakery.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Start a bakery

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi 2 est composé de  dix femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des familles polygames à Massoukou  un des villages de la commune rurale de Tingolé, sous préfecture de Fana, 2ème région administrative de la république du Mali.
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de  réaliser leurs activités hivernales. Elles font exclusivement la culture d’arachide qui reste la principale culture de la zone. 
Par rapport à l’utilisation de ce prêt, elles comptent acheter,  des intrants, des petits matériels, des semences et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 10 hectares.
La production sera vendue au niveau des marchés de Marka-Coungo, Fana et Tingolé, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 17500FCFA par campagne.
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi 2 ambitionnent avoir des montants à hauteur de souhait.
texts.en:
The Benkadi 2 group is composed of 10 married women who average 30 years of age and 3 children. They live in polygamous families in Massoukou, one of the villages in the rural city of Tingolé, Fana subprefecture, 2nd administrative region of Mali.

They are seeking their first loan from Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, in order to be able to realize their rainy season activities. They exclusively grow peanuts, which is still the main crop in the area. This loan will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers, small materials, and to pay for the cost of labour and hoeing of 10 hectares. After the harvest, the production will be sold, mainly for cash, at the following markets : Marka-Coungo, Fana and Tingolé, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

They intend to turn an average profit of XOF 17'500 (ca US$ 35) per campaign. The women of the Benkadi 2 group ambition to obtain loans corresponding to their wishes.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, small materials, and to pay for the cost of labour and hoeing of 10 hectares.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es:
Benedicta trabaja en el Hotel Sucre de la Ciudad de La Paz como cocinera; el esposo es albañil y ambas actividades constituyen la principal fuente de ingreso con que cubren la manutención de sus dos hijos que dependen de ellos; tiene su casa propia ubicada en la zona Ciudad 16 de febrero de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de material de construcción (arena, cemento, piedra principalmente) para refaccionar su vivienda que se encuentra deteriorada.
 
Es el tercer  crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarle el préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Benedicta works as a cook at the Hotel Sucre in the city of La Paz. Her husband is a bricklayer and both of their jobs are the main source of income to support their 2 dependent children. They have their own home located in the “16 de Febrero” district in the city of El Alto.

Her loan will be used to purchase construction materials (sand, cement and stone) to repair her house, which has been deteriorating.

This is Benedicta’s third loan with IMPRO. Her excellent payment history allowed her to be approved for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sand, cement and stone to repair her house

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
El microempresario Benito Cárdenas R. tiene 73 años de edad es viudo es padre de 4 hijos los cuales son adultos y desde hace mas de 20 años tiene un taller de ebanistería con el cual ha podido sacar a sus hijos adelante y poder verlos graduar.

El señor Cárdenas tiene muchos clientes a quienes les fabrica puertas, muebles tales como sillas abuelitas, comedores, camas entre otros productos. El trabaja con uno de sus hijos en el taller quien le ayuda a la fabricación de sus productos.

Uno de los problemas que enfrentan es que la materia prima (madera) al igual que otros insumos (pintura, barniz) sube constantemente de precio por lo que tienen  que comprarlos en cantidades para evitar estos incrementos, por tal razón esta solicitando se le financie para comprar lo siguiente: 

300 pies de Madera Cedro Macho a US 0.90 cada pie, 250 pies de  Acetuno a US 0.56 cada pie y  300 pies de Caoba a US 1.30 cada pie.
texts.en:
The small businessman Benito Cárdenas R. is 73 years old and is a widower. He is the father of 4 adult children. For the past 20 years he has had a cabinetmaking shop which has allowed him to earn the income needed to take care of his children and send them to school. His children were able to graduate.

Mr. Cárdenas has many customers who he makes doors for, and furniture pieces like chairs, dinning room sets and beds among many products. He works with one of his children in the workshop.

One of the problems that Benito is confronting is the constant rising cost of the materials that he needs to make his furniture. Because of this he needs to buy the materials in large quantities so that he can avoid the rising costs. He is requesting this loan so that he will be able to buy the following materials; 300 feet of Cedar wood at .90 US a foot, 250 feet of olive wood at .56 US a foot and 300 feet of mahogany at 1.30 US a foot.

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of wood like cedar, olivewood and mahogony.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Marco Antonio M. es padre de familia y tiene tres hijos los cuales están estudiando.
A la vivienda del señor Marco Antonio le está haciendo falta las protecciones en las  ventanas y puestas en los cuartos de su hijo en la planta alta, pero no cuanta con el dinero necesario para pagarle a la persona que realizara las protecciones. 
El está solicitando un préstamo y planea pagarlo con los ingresos que recibe como maestro de una universidad.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio M. has three children who go to school. Marco Antonio’s house lacks protection on the windows and doors of his children’s rooms on the second floor. But, he does not have the money to pay someone to install the protection. He is asking for a loan, and he plans to repay it with his income from being a university teacher.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install protection on the windows and doors

loans.name: Youssou

texts.fr: Youssou C.  est un distributeur de cartes de crédit téléphonique .Chaque il fait le tour de la ville de Mbour pour vendre des cartes téléphoniques .Avec l’essor du téléphone mobile au Sénégal le marché de la distribution de carte de crédit téléphonique marche  fort. A 29 ans il  est toujours célibataire .Les revenus titrés tiré de son activité lui permettent de faire des économies en vu de préparer son mariage. Avec le prêt qu’il sollicite il compte accroitre  ses activités en achetant plus de  produits pour faire face à la forte demande des clients.
texts.en:
Youssou C. is a distributor for telephone cards. He goes around the town of Mbour every day to sell these phone cards. With the expansion of the use of cell phones in Sénégal, the market for phone cards is strong. At 29, he is still unmarried. The income from his work allows him to put aside savings in view of preparing for his marriage. With the loan that he is requesting, he intends to grow his business by buying more phone cards so as to keep up with customer demand.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying more phone cards to sell

loans.name: Yanapasiñani Group

texts.es:
“Yanapasiñani” significa “nos ayudaremos”, es una Asociación Comunal que pertenece al Centro Focal “Los Andes”, con 12 integrantes desarrollan su reunión con mucho orden. Algunas de las integrantes  tienen negocios que se dedican a la comercialización como ser: venta de cosméticos, dulces, ropa, comida, verdura y juguetes, otras se dedican a la producción de deportivos, joyas, sombreros. Las primeras necesitan el préstamo para la compra de mercadería y las segundas para comprar materia prima.

Verónica G. es una de las más antiguas socias, ella recuerda que cuando ingresó a la Asociación Comunal no tenía negocio pero poco a poco incursionó en la venta de cosméticos y con el pasar del tiempo pudo conseguir un puesto fijo, ahora su meta es contar con más productos que ofertar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
“Yanapasiñani” means we will help. It is a community association that belongs to the Los Andes Community Center. There are 12 members who get together in a very orderly way. Some of the members have businesses selling things such as cosmetics, sweets, clothes, food, vegetables and toys. Others make sportswear, jewelry, and hats. The sales people need a loan to buy merchandise. The others need to buy raw materials. Verónica G. is one of the oldest members. She remembers that when she joined the Community Association she did not have a business. But, little by little, she got involved in selling cosmetics. With the passage of time, she was able to get a fixed place to sell from. Now, her goal is to carry more products to offer her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise/raw material

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr: Maimouna D.   agée  de 42 ans est une vendeuse de tisane.  Elle  est mariée et mère de trois enfants avec qui elle vit dans le domicile conjugal. Chaque matin elle se rende dans les jardins situés à la périphérie de la ville de Mbour pour acheter ce tisane pour thé elle revende aux boutiquiers de la ville. Elle fait ce travail depuis 10ans  les revenus tirés de son activité lui permettent de soutenir son mari dans la dépense quotidienne. Pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle elle sollicite un prêt.
texts.en:
Maimouna D. is 42 years old and she sells herbs used for making herbal teas. She is married with three children and they live together in the family home. Every morning, she goes to the gardens on the outskirts of Mbour to buy the herbs used for making tea, which she then resells to the shopkeepers in the town. She has been doing this work for 10 years and the revenue she generates allows her to help her husband out with the daily expenses. She is requesting a loan to keep up with the demand of her clientele.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Santa Martina

texts.es:
La microempresaria Santa Martina C. Z. tiene 50 años de edad, es viuda con 4 hijos todos adultos, tiene una pulpería que compartió por más de 30 años con su marido (actualmente fallecido) quien era de origen chino. Esta pulpería además de vender granos básicos y abarrotería en general, vende productos para elaborar comida china, en este caso el  tallarín, lo que aprendió de su futuro marido.

Este es el segundo crédito que obtiene de Kiva ya que había obtenido uno el cual ya cancelo en tiempo y forma. Hace aproximadamente un año esta microempresaria a enviudado y por tal razón esta solicitando un crédito para darle seguridad a su negocio ya que la construcción aun tiene una pared de madera y por el nivel de robos que impera es necesario garantizar seguridad a dicho negocio.

Por lo que necesita se le financie para la construcción de una pared y requiere comprar: 250  Bloques de 6 pulgadas los que cuestan US 0.80 cada uno, 2 quintales de hierro a US 71 cada quintal,  2 metros de piedra a US 36 cada metro, 2 metros de arena a US 18 cada metro  y 10 bolsas de cemento a US 10 cada bolsa.
texts.en:
Santa Martina C. Z. is a 50 year old entrepreneur. She is a widow with four adult children. She has a mini market, which she shared with her husband for over 30 years. He passed away; he was of Chinese origin. In addition to selling basic grains, her store is a general grocery store. She sells products for making Chinese food like noodles, which she learned from her husband. This is the second loan she has had with Kiva. She repaid the first one as agreed upon and on time. About a year ago, she became a widow. That is why she is asking for a loan to provide better security for her business, which has one wooden wall. The number of robberies makes it imperative to guarantee security for her business. To do that she needs to pay for constructing a wall; she will need to buy: 250 six inch blocks @ US 0.80 per block, 2 quintales (a quintal is 46 kg) of metal @ US 71 per quintal, 2 meters of rock at US 36 per meter, 2 meters of sand at US 18 per meter and 10 bags of cement @ US 10 per bag.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Six inch blocks, metal, rock, sand, and cement

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr: Oumar S.  habite un quartier périphérique de Mbour  ville située à 80 km de Dakar la capitale sénégalaise .son activité principale est l’embouche bovine .Il achète des bœufs pour les stabiliser avant de les revendre. Avec le prêt qu’il sollicite il compte acheter un bœuf à emboucher.
texts.en:
Oumar S. lives on the outskirts of Mbour city, about 80 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. His main business activity is buying and selling cattle. He buys the cattle to strengthen them up before reselling them. With this loan that he is requesting, he intends to buy cattle.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Hamet Boubacar

texts.fr: Hamet boubacar  S.   est un mécanicien garagiste   il fait de la réparation et de l’entretien des automobiles .pour diversifier son activité il sollicite un prêt lui permettant de monter une station de lavage de véhicule dans son garage.
texts.en:
Hamet Boubacar S. is a garage mechanic. He repairs and services automobiles. In order to diversify his business activity he is asking for a loan that will allow him to set up a car wash station in his garage.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To set up a car wash station

loans.name: Wipala Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “Wipala” es parte del Centro Focal “Los Andes”, con 11 integrantes, su presidenta es Basillia C. que organiza a su grupo para llevar adelante su reunión bajo un orden del día.

La mayoría de las integrantes de “Wipala” se dedican a la venta de remedios caseros, es decir, venden hierbas naturales que ayuda aliviar alguna dolencia, comúnmente se conoce con el nombre de CHIFLERAS, ellas necesitan el préstamo para adquirir más productos, ya que generalmente viajan a las provincias o pueblos para adquirir los productos.
texts.en:
The communal association "Wipala" is part of the "Los Andes" center, which has 11 members. The president is Basillia C., who organizes the group to move ahead. The majority of the "Wipala" members sell homemade remedies - a.k.a. natural herbs - to relieve pain. Communally, it's known as Chifleras. The members need a loan to acquire more products, as they generally travel to the provinces or towns to get their products.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Dior Ndiaye

texts.fr: Dior ndiaye C. a vend des tissus, des sacs, et des ustensiles de cuisine aux femmes de son quartier à Mbour  ville située à 80 km de la capitale sénégalaise. Elle est marié  et mère de  famille. Les revenus  tirés du commerce lui permettent de participer aux dépenses du manage  et à l’entretien des enfants. Elle sollicite un prêt pour194  accroitre son activité.
texts.en:
Dior Ndiaye C. sells fabric, bags and cooking utensils to women in her neighborhood in the town of Mbour, located 80 km from the Senegalese capital. She is married with children. The income she makes from her business allows her to contribute to the household expenses and the care of the children. She is requesting a loan to expand her business.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Carmen Group

texts.en: The members of Carmen Group have close ties and many of them belong to the RivA. M. family. The members live in different parts of town, but meet up in the same house for their group meetings. The members run a variety of different businesses including the sale of cosmetics, costume jewelry, meals, and groceries. Some of the other members make clothing, one works as a radiology technician, and one drives a school vehicle. Though there is competition in all of these industries, the members hope that the loans will help them surpass other businesses in their industries by buying more inventory to make their businesses bigger. The majority of the members have previous experience taking out loans and are looking forward to pushing their businesses to the next level with future loans.

loans.use: Increasing stock, buying tools

loans.name: Saliou

texts.fr: Saliou  N.    est un commerçant   il vend  des marchandises   denrée alimentaire  et produit de premières nécessité depuis de cinq. Le prêt sollicité lui permet de renforcer son commerce .A 26 ans il est marié et père de  famille  les revenus tires de son activité lui permettent de gérer sa famille.
texts.en:
Saliou N. has been a storekeeper for five years, selling foodstuffs and staples. The loan he is requesting will enable him to expand his business. At 26, he is married and a father. The income from his business allows him to pay for the upkeep of his family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Ndeye  Aby

texts.fr: Ndeye  Aby N.  est un handicapé physique   elle est évolue dans le secteur  de la couture .Elle a démarrer avec ses propre moyens en achetant une machine a coudre pour confectionner des habits.les habit cousus sont vendus au niveau des groupement de promotion féminine. Avec le prêt qu’elle sollicite elle veut renforcer son activité  en achetant des tissus  et accessoire pour la couture.
texts.en:
Ndeye Aby N. is physically handicapped and has always worked in dressmaking. She began by using her own money to buy a sewing machine to make clothes. She sells the clothes through a “group for women’s advancement" (one of a number of local groups in Senegal that work to promote women’s programs). She wants to use the loan she is requesting to build her business by buying fabric and dressmaking supplies.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: El Hadji Ngary

texts.fr: El hadji Ngary  K. est un commerçant, il vend de l’aliment de bétail et du charbon de bois. ce célibataire de23 ans a quitté l’école très top pour se lancer dans le commerce a fin d’aider ses parents dont le niveau de revenu est très bas. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d’entretenir ses parents mais aussi de faires quels économies pour préparer son mariage. Avec le prêt qu’il sollicite il veut accroitre son commerce en achetant plus de marchandises pour la saison des pluies période pendant laquelle les aliments de bétail se vendent chère.
texts.en:
El Hadji Ngary K. is a storekeeper who sells animal feed and charcoal. Single and 23 years old, he left school very early to start a business in order to help his parents, whose level of income is very low. The money he makes from his business enables him to provide for his parents as well as save up for when he gets married. He wants to use this loan to expand his business by buying more merchandise in time for the rainy season, when animal feed commands a high price.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fodder

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
El socio Hernán, pertenece al banco comunal “MOSOC KILLA”, es natural del barrio de santiago en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio,  tiene 44 años de edad, es soltero y tiene 3 hijos, se dedica al arte, el es pintor, es un gran artista, el requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales acrílicos para pintar lienzos, el socio realiza diversos trabajos de arte y los vende en las diferentes ferias.

Nuestro socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Hernan belongs to the community bank "MOSOC KILLA", and he is from the town of Santiago in the city of Cusco.

He is 44 years old, is single and has 3 kids. He dedicates himself to art as he is a painter and a fantastic artist. He needs a loan to invest in buying acrylic materials to paint canvases. He does a lot of different art work and sells it in different markets.

Hernan is grateful for the opportunity that has been given to him by this means, and he is committed to repaying the corresponding loan on time.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy acrylic materials for his paintings/Comprar materiales acrílicos para sus pinturas.

loans.name: Santos Celestina

texts.es: Santos Celestina R. G. de 40 años de edad reside en el municipio de Mejicanos en el departamento de Salvador. Santos reside en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos, Carla de 17 años, Sergio de 16 años y Marlon de 8 años. José el esposo de Santos trabaja como albañil profesión que no es muy estable y también poco remunerada, José logra generar aproximadamente 100$ mensuales ingresos que no son suficientes para la manutención básica de toda la familia, es por eso que Santos tiene que buscar otra manera de apoyar a su esposo para los gastos y es así como Santos se dedica a su negocio que es una venta de tortillas, su producción de tortillas es todos los días ya que este es un acompañamiento importante para la hora del almuerzo de los salvadoreños, Santos posee buenas ganancias y una venta muy estable ya que en la zona ella es la preferida de sus vecinos. Santos solicita un crédito para aumentar su producción de tortillas comprando mayor cantidad de materia prima.
texts.en:
Santos Celestina R. G. is 40 years, and lives in the Mejicanos municipality of the Salvador department. Santos lives in her own home with her husband and their 3 children: Carlos (17), Sergio (16), and Marlon (8). José, Santos' husband, works as a mason. His work is not very stable, and does not pay well. He earns roughly $100/month, which is not enough to support his family. For that reason, Santos had to look for another source of income in order to help her husband meet the family's expenses. Santos decided to sell tortillas, which she does daily, as tortillas are an important part of Salvadorean cuisine. Her business does quite well, as people prefer her tortillas over those made by her neighbors. Santos is asking for a loan to increase her production of tortillas by purchasing more raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Adonai

texts.es: Adonai C. M. de 44 años de edad reside en el departamento de La Libertad, vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijas Maria de 9 años e Imelda de 7 años, ambas niñas estudian nivel básico en la escuela. Adonai es un hombre muy trabajador ha establecido su negocio donde fabrica teja y ladrillos de manera artesanal, su negocio genera empleo a tres familias mas, ya que Adonai cuenta con tres empleados quienes ayudan en la elaboración de sus productos, Adonai solicita un crédito para compra de materia prima como leña, tierra y barro para la elaboración de ladrillo y leña; de esta manera lograra aumentar su producción al igual que su volumen de ventas.
texts.en:
Adonai C. M. is 44 years old and lives in La Libertad department (state), alongside his wife and their 2 children, 9 year old Maria, and 7 year old Imelda. Both daughters currently study at primary school. Adonai is a hard-working man, and has established a business where he makes bricks by hand. His business creates work for 3 other families as well, so Adonai has 3 employees who help him produce his goods. Adonai requests a loan to purchase raw materials in order to make more goods; in this way, he will be able to increase his production to match his high volume of sales.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: José Luis M. de 60 años de edad reside en el municipio de Zaragoza del departamento de La Libertad. José vive en casa propia con su esposa y dos hijos mayores de edad  profesionales universitarios. José y su esposa se dedican a su negocio que es una tienda ubicada dentro de su casa, cuenta con un inventario total de 700$ dólares en su negocio, el deseo de José es tener más variedad de productos en su tienda ya que carecen de muchos productos que son demandados por sus clientes es por eso que José solicita un crédito para surtir su negocio y generar mayores ganancias a través que sus ventas incrementen.
texts.en:
José Luis M. is 60 years old, and lives in the Zaragoza municipality of the La Libertad department (state). José lives in his own home with his wife, and two grown children who are at university. José and his wife have a store inside their home with $700 of inventory. His wish is to increase his inventory, and his store lacks some of the products requested by his customers. For this reason, José requests a loan in order to stock his store, and increase his revenue by selling more goods.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock his business.

loans.name: Rebeca Ester

texts.es: Rebeca Ester P. Vda. D. S. resiD. en el departamento D. La Libertad. Rebeca tiene 48 años D. edad vive con sus dos hijas Rebeca D. 19 años y Sthefany D. 17 años ambas niñas se encuentran estudiando el bachillerato. Rebeca recibe 177$ mensuales D. pensión y se dedica a su negocio que es la venta D. perfumes y cremas D. marca, su promedio mensual D. ventas son 700$, Rebeca solicita un crédito para compra D. productos para aumentar su inventario y tener más variedad D. marcas para ofrecerle a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rebeca Ester P., widow of D. S., lives in the La Libertad department. Rebeca is 48, and she has two daughters, Rebeca is 19 and Sthefany is 17. Both girls are in high school. Rebeca receives $177 in a monthly pension. She sells brand name perfumes and creams. Her average monthly sales are $700. Rebeca is asking for a loan to buy products to increase her inventory and have a greater variety of brands to offer her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to stock her inventory

loans.name: Aida Patricia

texts.es: Aida Patricia N. de 30 años de edad reside en el departamento de La Libertad en el municipio de Zaragoza. Aida vive con su esposo y  sus dos hijos José de 13 años y Joselin de 8 años de edad ambos niños estudian en la escuela.  Silvino el esposo de Aida aporta mensualmente 150$ mensuales trabajando de hacer viajes en su carro, Aida se dedica a su negocio que es una tienda ubicada dentro de su domicilio donde vende productos de consumo diario, Aida solicita un crédito para la compra de bebidas para vender en su tienda y también para comprar tarjetas de recargas para teléfono móviles ya que sus clientes las demandan mucho.
texts.en:
Aida Patricia N. is 30 years old and lives in an area called La Libertad, in the municipality of Zaragoza. Aida lives with her husband and 2 children - Jose, who is 13 years old, and Joselin, who is 8. Both of her children attend school. Silvino, Aida's husband, earns about $150 a month as a driver. Aida works at a small general store located inside their home. Aida is requesting a loan to stock her small store with drinks as well as pre paid mobile phone cards which her customers are always requesting.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase items for her general store including drinks, and prepaid cards for mobile phones.

loans.name: Angela Felicitas

texts.es: Ángela Felicita Vásquez B. tiene la edad de 73 años. Es madre soltera. Tiene 6 hijos.la actividad económica a la que Ángela se dedica es una pulpería. Hace más de 30 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicio vendiendo refrescos naturales y golosinas y por medio de sus clientes que solicitaban otro tipo de productos decide, mantener el negocio de la pulpería, y así es como decide invertir en otro tipo de productos para que sus clientes recurran a su pulpería. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de gaseosas, refrescos, golosinas, aceite, detergentes y jabón. El deseo de Ángela es seguir adelante con este negocio porque fue por medio de este que logro preparar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Senora Angela is 73 years old and is a single mother of 6 children. For more than 30 years, Angela has run a small shop in order to generate income. She began selling fruit drinks and sodas, and when her customers began asking for more products, she decided to open a small general and offer more variety to her customers. With the loan she is requesting, she will purchase sodas, sweets, cooking oil, detergents and soap to stock her store. Angela's goal is to continue to run and grow this business as it has enabled her to care for her family.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her store such as sodas, sweets, detergents, soap, etc.

loans.name: Malang

texts.fr: Malang  F.  est un pompiste  employé dans une station d’essence à Mbour ville côtière située à plus de 70km de Dakar la capitale Sénégalaise. A   trente trois ( 33)ans Malang est marié et père de famille. Ses revenus lui permettent tout juste de nourrir sa famille .Pour construire une chambre pour sa famille il sollicite un prêt.
texts.en:
Malang F. is a pump operator at a gas station in the coastal town of Mbour, more than 70 km from Dakar, the Senegalese capital. Aged 33, Malang is married and a father. His income barely enables him to feed his family. He is requesting a loan to build a bedroom for his family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bedroom

loans.name: Aissata

texts.fr: Aissata S.   vend  des sandwichs de la boisson, et du repas dans sa buvette. Elle exerce ce métier depuis plus de dix ans. A coté de cette activité, elle vend des tissus aussi qu’elle achète au près des grossistes de la ville.  La cinquantaine dépassé Aissata  avec son commerce aide son mari dans l’entretien du ménage  avec les revenus tiré de son commerce .Pour renforcer son commerce elle sollicite un prêt.
texts.en:
Aissata S. sells sandwiches, drinks and meals from her refreshment stall. She has run this business for more than 10 years. Along with this business, she also sells fabric that she buys from wholesalers in the town. Aissata, who is over 50, uses the income from her business to help her husband with the upkeep of the household. She is requesting a loan to expand her business.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Judit Emeleni

texts.es:
Judit is a member of the Santa Rosalia Village Bank and lives in the Peruvian jungle town of Atalaya. Atalaya is the main entry point to Manu National Reserve, a major Peruvian tourist destination. Atalaya is on the banks of the Carbon River, and tourists enter Manu by boat, and usually take two to seven day trips. Judit is in the process of starting her own boat company to ferry tourists on cultural trips into the park. She plans to offer a cheaper two-day trip and more inclusive trips of five to eight days. Her husband will navegate the boat, and she will handle the administrative end of things.

Judit also has a small restaurant, where she prepares fixed-price lunch menus as well as extra dishes. She doesn’t cook every day, since some days there aren’t very many people in her small town looking for lunch, but she tries to take advantage whenever opportunities present themselves (for example, on days when large groups come through town). Most of her customers are locals, not tourists, and her specialties are fish, cakes, and gelatin desserts. 

Judit is requesting a loan of 3000 soles to buy a boat. She already has the motor, which is actually more expensive than the boat itself will be.  Her goal for the future is to continue to improve and expand her restaurant.
texts.en:
Judit is a member of the Santa Rosalia Village Bank and lives in the Peruvian jungle town of Atalaya. Atalaya is the main entry point to Manu National Reserve, a major Peruvian tourist destination. Atalaya is on the banks of the Carbon River, and tourists enter Manu by boat, and usually take two to seven day trips. Judit is in the process of starting her own boat company to ferry tourists on cultural trips into the park. She plans to offer a cheaper two-day trip and more inclusive trips of five to eight days. Her husband will navigate the boat, and she will handle the administrative end of things. Judit also has a small restaurant, where she prepares fixed-price lunch menus as well as extra dishes. She doesn’t cook every day, since some days there aren’t very many people in her small town looking for lunch, but she tries to take advantage whenever opportunities present themselves (for example, on days when large groups come through town). Most of her customers are locals, not tourists, and her specialties are fish, cakes, and gelatin desserts. Judit is requesting a loan of 3000 Sols to buy a boat. She already has the motor, which is actually more expensive than the boat itself will be. Her goal for the future is to continue to improve and expand her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a boat for tourism company

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: Doña Felipa es viuda, de 50 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, 2 de ellos habitan con ella, pero son independientes, tiene 18 años de laborar para la Escuela Normal como maestra y actualmente como inspectora, con horario variado, rotando cada semana, tenendo que dormir en algunos casos dentro del centro, los horarios son de 6:00am. a 2 p.m. y de 2p.m. a 6 pm., en sus tiempos lires se dedica a la costura para obtener mayores ingresos. Esta solicitando su ovo credito el cual utilizara para la construccion de una pequeña casa para su hija que esta recien casada, ella es maestra y aportara otra parte para avanzar en la construccion lo mas que se pueda, doña Felipa lo que desea es que su hija tenga independencia porque estan los otros hijos de ella, y considera que esta es la unica oportunidad que tiene para apoyarla.
texts.en:
Dona Felipa is a widow. She is 50 years old and has 3 children, 2 of her children still live with her but are independent. Felipa has worked for 18 years as a teacher and examiner. Her schedule changes each week, causing her to sometimes stay at the school to sleep. She works from 6am until 2pm, and from 2pm until 6pm. In her spare time she works as a seamstress to generate more income. She is requesting a loan to construct a small house for her daughter who was recently married. Her daughter is also a teacher. Felipa feels this is the only opportunity she has to help her so that she can also be more independant.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction of a small house for her daughter

loans.name: Jose Trinidad

texts.es: Jose Trinidad es soltero, de 31 años de edad, de profesion psicologo clinico, y ademas trabaja como deocente en la universidad en Nueva Guinea, es una persona muy estudiosa, ya que tiene 2 carreras universitarias y esta estudiando derecho, el hecho de no tener compromisos personales le ha permitido prepararse, pues manifiesta que no quiere que le sucesa lo de sus hermanos que se casaron y no continuaron sus estudios.  No tiene ni compañera, ni hijos, habita en casa de sus padres y es donde hará la mejora, pero ahi habitan otros hermanos y no tiene privaciadas los fines de semana que el viene. Esta solicitando su 4to credito para la construccion de un anexo, el que utilizara para dormitorio y tener mayor comodidad, sus creditos anteriores los utlizo para pagos de sus estudios.
texts.en:
Jose Trinidad is single, 31 years old, and a clinical psychologist. He also works as an instructor at a university in New Guinea. He is a very studious person and in addition to his career in psychology, he is also studying to become a lawyer. Since he is single and has no children, he has had the freedom to study and to better himself. In Nicaragua he lives with his parents. He has to share a room with his siblings and he does not have privacy on the weekends when he comes home from work. He is now requesting his 4th loan which he will use to build his own room so that he is more comfortable and have more privacy. The loans that he has requested before has been used to pay for his education.

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The constuction of a bedroom

loans.name: Silvia Dinora

texts.es: La Señora Silvia Sánchez M. es mujer una casada. Tiene 44 años de edad. Tiene 4 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta de frutas y verduras. Hace más de 23 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que inicia con muy pocos ingresos, pero con mucha ganas de sobresalir, por lo que viajaba a los diferentes departamentos ofreciendo sus productos en una camioneta, y así surge su negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos. Su deseo es comprar una vivienda propia ya que no tiene nada que dejarles a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Silvia Sánchez M. is a married woman. She is 44 years old. She has four children under her care. To make a living, she sells fruit and vegetables. She has worked in the business for more than 23 years. She started with little income, but a great desire to succeed. As she traveled to many different areas offering her products from a truck, her business advanced. The loan that she requests is for working capital to purchase products. She hopes to purchase her own home, since she doesn’t have anything to leave to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosa Olivia

texts.es: Rosa Olivia Pérez Pérez tiene la edad de 43 años. Es madre soltera. Tiene 6 a su cargo. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Su actividad económica es venta de granos básicos. Por lo que inicia esta humilde actividad anteriormente se dedica a la venta de hielo y bisutería. Rosa siempre ha sido una mujer que se esfuerza mucho para salir adelante, y lo consigue porque con las ganancias, obtiene un lugar para vender este tipo de productos. A solicitud de sus clientes invierte en detergentes, jabón, desinfectante entre otros. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo en  la compra de granos básicos, que son necesarios para el consumo diario  arroz, azúcar, frijoles, maíz y concentrado. El sueño de Rosa es mantener la actividad porque de esta actividad depende sus ingresos por lo que el único medio de vida que ella posee.
texts.en:
Rosa Olivia Pérez Pérez is 43 years old. She is a single mother. She has six children under her care. For more than 20 years, she has worked selling basic grains. In order to start this humble business, she first worked selling ice and jewelry. Rosa has always been a strong woman with a desire to succeed. With her earnings, she obtained a location from which to sell her products. At her customers’ request, she invested in detergents, soap, disinfectant and other products. The loan that she requests is for working capital to purchase basic grains that are necessary for daily consumption such as rice, sugar, beans, corn and concentrate. Rosa’s dream is to maintain her work, because she depends on the income as her only means of living.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anselma Del Carmen

texts.es: Anselma del Carmen M. tiene la edad de 46 años. Es madre soltera. Tiene 1 hijo y asiste a una escuela pública. La actividad económica es la venta de comida. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio. Su negocio inicio estableciendo una pequeña mesa, en el mercado de la terminal aquí solamente ofrecía desayunos, como pan, café, leche, donas y refrescos naturales, con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio logro con sus muy pocas ganancias vender almuerzo, y así es como posee este negocio con mucho esfuerzo y ganas de salir adelante. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos para la elaboración de su comida. Su deseo es seguir administrando su negocio de buena manera y establecer una gran distribuidora en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Anselma del Carmen M. is 46 years old. She is a single mother. She has one son and helps in the public school. She sells food to make a living. She has worked in this for over 15 years. Her business started as a small table in the bus station market where she could only offer breakfasts such as bread, coffee, milk, donuts and juices.
