With enough strength and sacrifice, she was able to use her little earnings to offer lunches. This is how she obtained this business, with much strength and the wish to succeed. The loan that she requests is for working capital to buy basic grains to prepare her meals. Her wish is to continue running this business well and establish a large distribution from her home.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nubia

texts.es: Nubia O. tiene la edad de 58 años. Es una mujer casada. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo, ellos ayudan a su Mama y asisten a una escuela. Su actividad económica es ofrecer los servicios de costura. Hace más de 40 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que sus inicios surgen desde hace mucho tiempo y fue con la ayuda de sus padres, ellos le enseñaron este oficio para que obtuviera un medio para generar ingresos, Nubia comenzó con la elaboración de vestidos para niños, ellos fueron sus primeros clientes más tarde decide incursionar en la elaboración de pantalones, trajes y faldas y así sus clientes aumentan por la extensa variedad de productos que ofrecía. Este financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima como tela, agujas, alfileres, hilo y tijeras. Su deseo es mejorar la calidad de sus confecciones y además trasmitir este conocimientos a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nubia Ordóñez is 58 years old. She is married and has two children to support. They help their mother and also attend school. Nubia has been working as a seamstress for more than 40 years. She started this work a long time ago with the help of her parents who taught her how to sew so she would have a way of earning an income. At first Nubia made clothing for children so they were her first customers. Later she decided to venture into making pants, dresses, and skirts; as a result she gained more customers because of the wide variety of products she offered. Nubia will use this loan to buy items such as material, needles, pins, thread and scissors. She wants to improve the quality of the clothes she makes and also pass on her skills to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy dress-making supplies

loans.name: Claudia Martha

texts.es: Claudia Martha L. B. tiene la edad de 50 años. Es madre soltera. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica es venta de refrescos. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella da inicio a esta actividad por que los ingresos que generaba son muy pocos, porque además labora como afanadora en el hospital, y con muy poco capital recaudado y por las tardes decide recorrer las calles, ofreciendo sus deliciosos refrescos, y así comienza  este humilde negocio, con el tiempo decide ofrecer otros productos como café, pan, repostería entre otros. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de leña, azúcar, canela, café y pan. Su deseo es establecer un lugar en donde pueda ofrecer sus refrescos.
texts.en:
Claudia Martha L. B. is 50 years old. She is a single mother. She has two children in her care. Her job is selling refreshments. She has been dedicated to this business for more than eight years. She started this work because the income that she generated was small since she worked as a janitor in a hospital making very little money. She decided to roam the streets selling her delicious refreshments and, in this manner, began her humble business. Over time, she decided to offer other products such as coffee, bread, and pastries among others. The loan that she is requesting is for working capital to purchase firewood, sugar,cinnamon, coffee and bread. Her wish is to establish a place in which she can offer her refreshments.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Mujeres De Negocios Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Mujeres de Negocio conformado por La joven Tereza de Jesús S. C., es una mujer casada y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo de los cuales solo su hijo de 6 años estudia su actividad económica es la venta de frijoles cocidos y leña. La ubicación es en su humilde vivienda. Teresa empezó este negocio desde hace 4 años. Anteriormente  vendía refrescos y helados ya que no poseía el capital suficiente, para invertir en más productos. Con ayuda de su esposo han salido adelante, por lo que algunas veces el salía a vender los refrescos en su comarca, sin embargo la situación económica por la cual ellos pasan no impiden que salgan adelante con su negocio. El financiamiento que solicitan es para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos como leña, frijoles, cuajadas, queso y crema. Sus sueños son que sus hijos puedan aspirar a poseer algún nivel académico. Su otra amiga Claudia del Carmen O. R. tiene la edad de 39años. Es madre soltera. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que inicio por cuenta propia, ya que tenía que sacar adelante a sus hijos, ya que es Madre soltera y tenía que salir adelante con sus hijos. Por lo que con la ayuda de sus hijos, salía vender ya que uno de ellos estaba pequeño y necesitaba de cuido, por lo que algunas veces ofrecía sus productos y viajaba con su hijo. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo en la compra de cremas, perfumes y lociones. Su deseo es salir adelante con su negocio. Y la ultima es María Elena O. R. tiene 46 años de edad. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos y dulces. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio, por que anteriormente ella se dedicaba a la venta de cajetas así ayudaba para completar de pagar los gastos necesarios. Ya que el financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cosméticos. A pesar de las diferentes actividades económicas que poseen las 3 todas tiene el sueño y el deseo de seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The group "Mujeres de Negocio" (Women of Business) is made up of young de Tereza de Jesús S. C.. She is a married woman who has two children in her care of whom only her six year old son is in school. Her economic activity is selling baked beans and firewood. Her business' location is in her humble home. Teresa began this business four years ago. Previously, she sold refreshments and ice cream since she didn't have sufficient capital to invest in more products. With the help of her husband, she has been getting ahead. Sometimes he goes out and sells refreshments in their area. Nevertheless, their economic situation does not stop them from getting ahead with their business. The loan that they are requesting is for working capital used to purchase products such as firewood, beans, cheese curds, cheese and cream. Their dreams are that their children may aspire to achieve any academic level. Her other friend, Claudia del Carmen O. R., is 39 years old. She is a single mother. She has two children in her care. Her economic activity is selling cosmetics. It's been more than five years that she's been working in this business. She started it on her own since she had to get her children ahead and she is a single mother. So with the help of her children, she would go out selling. Since one of them was little, and needed care, sometimes she would go out to sell with her son. The loan that she is requesting is for working capital to purchase creams, perfumes and lotions. Her wish is to suceed with her business. The last member is María Elena O. R. who is 46 years old. She has two children in her care. Her job is selling cosmetics and sweets. She has been dedicated to this business for more than 15 years. Previously she sold cajetas (a dessert) and helped to pay the bills. The loan that she is requesting is for working capital to purchase cosmetics. While the economic activities of these three women is different, each has the dream and desire to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Santa Teresa Group

texts.en:
The members of Santa Teresa Group all know each other, and some of the members belong to the same family. The president of the group is Karina. The group has fourteen members, each of which have different types of businesses, including selling cosmetics, clothes, groceries, computers, chocolate, artisanal crafts, porcelain decorations, breakfast, and lunch. Also, Raul lends out DJ equipment for parties.

Everyone would like to use the loan to buy more stock, material, and tools for their businesses. They all have competition in their industries, but they are confident in their business abilities and will be responsible in paying back the loan. Also, since they have taken out loans in the past, they know the importance of everyone paying back on time in order to have access to future loans.

loans.use: To buy more stock for sale

loans.name: Justo Arsenio

texts.es: El Señor Justo Arsenio J. Hernández tiene la edad de 46 años. La actividad económica de Justo es ofrecer los servicios de transporte. Su autobús hace recorrido de personal de una empresa. Anteriormente él era conductor, de una empresa llamada ENAVIN aquí ofrecía el servicio de transporte y se encargaba de transportar al personal. Por lo que con esto logra establecer su propio negocio. Por lo que ahora solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de repuestos de su camión. Su deseo es ofrecer un mejor servicio para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Justo Arsenio J. Hernández is 46 years old. Justo works offering transportation. His bus has transports the personnel of a business. He was previously a driver for a business called ENAVIN. Here, he offered transportation and was responsible for transporting the staff. With this, he was able to establish his own business. Now he is asking for a loan for working capital to buy spare parts for his bus. His wish is to offer better service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gladys Ricarda

texts.es: Gladys Ricarda V. M. es madre soltera. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Desde hace 11 años que se dedica a este negocio. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta y elaboración de tortillas. Gladys implemento un lugar en su vivienda para establecer su humilde negocio, por lo que algunas veces ella misma tiene que salir a las calles a ofrecer sus productos, este trabajo requiere su mucha dedicación, y con la ayuda de sus hijos ha superado. El dinero que está solicitando es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima como leña, maíz, cal entre otras cosas. Su mayor sueño es establecer una pulpería para que ambos ingresos la ayuden a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Gladys Ricarda V. M. is a single mother. She has 2 children in her care. She makes and sells tortillas and has been in this business for more than 11 years. Gladys set up an area in her home to establish her humble business and sometimes she has to go out to the streets to sell her products. This job requires a lot of dedication, but she has made it through with the help of her children. The loan that she is asking for is for working capital so that she can buy raw materials such as wood and corn, among other items. Her biggest dream is to set up a local store so that both incomes can help her get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Geronima Esperanza

texts.es: La señora Geronima Esperanza B. tiene le edad de 63 años. Es una mujer casada. Su actividad económica es la venta de tortillas. Hace más de 41 años que se dedica a este negocio. Geronima ha sido una mujer muy responsable, que le ha ayudado a sus hijos a salir adelante, por lo que inicia este negocio por cuenta propia, y es un negocio que ha descendido de su familia, por lo que más  tarde decide hacerse cargo del negocio, no es la primera ves que Geronima realiza financiamientos, ya que ha logrado observar, que es por medio de Fundación que kiva ayuda a las personas que desean salir adelante. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de maíz, leña, cal entre otras cosas de materia prima. El sueño de Geronima es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda para el día de mañana no sufrir necesidades.
texts.en:
Mrs. Geronima Esperanza B. is 63 years old and married. She has been in the business of selling tortillas for over 41 years. Geronima is a very responsible woman who has helped her children become successful. It was for this reason she decided to go into business. Her business belonged to her family, but it wasn’t until much later that she decided to take it over. This is not the first time Geronima has taken out a loan. As you can see, Fundación Leon is asking assistance from Kiva on behalf of people who have the desire to succeed. Her requested loan will be used as working capital to purchase corn, wood, lime and other raw materials. Geronima’s dream is to make improvements to her home so that she does not have to worry about them in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Ana Virgen Noble Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Ana Virgen Noble está conformado por La señora Manuela Sánchez tiene 48 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. El negocio al que se dedica es a la elaboración de tortillas, las cuales elabora en su casa de habitación.  Ella ya tiene 30 años de dedicarse a esta actividad. Ella solicita el crédito con el propósito de comprar insumos al por mayor, ya que de esta manera los precios son menores. Su deseo principal siempre ha sido mantener estable el negocio, que le permita mejorar siempre el nivel de vida de ella y de sus hijos. Su amiga La señora Yesenia del Socorro Sánchez, tiene 30 años y se dedica también a la elaboración de tortilla artesanal, esta actividad la realiza con otros miembros de su familia que le ayudan a elaborar. Ella posee tres hijos los cuales son menores de edad. Ella es casada, por lo tanto para el ingreso del hogar su esposo también aporta, ya que trabaja como ayudante de albañilería. La señora solicito este crédito con el propósito de incrementar su capital de trabajo y comprar los insumos al por mayor ya que compra a un precio más favorable. La ultima integrante es La señora Marcia C. se dedica a la elaboración de nacatamales en su casa de habitación. Tiene 28 años y actualmente es casada. y Tiene 3 hijos. Ella solicito el préstamo con el objetivo de comprar insumos. Este ingreso permite contribuir con los gastos familiares, ya que su esposo también aporta para los gastos del hogar. Ella tiene el sueño de brindar un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos del que ella alguna vez tuvo, a través de su trabajo arduo.
texts.en:
The Ana Virgen Noble Solidarity Group is made up of Manuela Sánchez, who is 48 years old, married, and has 2 children. She makes tortillas in her home and has been doing this for 30 years. She is asking for a loan with the intention of buying wholesale ingredients, since the prices are lower buying them this way. Her biggest dream has always been for her business to remain stable so that she is able to always improve her quality of life and that of her children.

Her friend, Yesenia del Socorro Sánchez, is 30 years old and also makes artisanal tortillas. She does this with other members of her family who help her to make them. She has three young children. She is married, so her husband also contributes to the household income since he is an assistant bricklayer. Yesenia is asking for this loan with the intention of increasing her working capital and buying wholesale ingredients so that she can buy them at a more affordable price.

The last member is Marcia C.. She makes nacatamales in her home. She is 28 years old and is currently married with 3 children. She is asking for this loan to purchase ingredients. This income, in addition to her husband’s income, helps contribute to household expenses. Marcia’s dream is to provide her children with a better quality of life, which she once obtained through hard work.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Troya Group

texts.es:
Trujo is characterized by being very united. In times of conflict, the group comes together to support one another until all of the payments are maD..

The  members of this group each specialize in the sale of groceries, bread, pastries/desserts, soft drinks, make-up, quinoa honey, cleaning products, school supplies, and clothes. Their diverse businesses are well known within their communities, which helps them significantly against local competition. 

This group would like a loan to increase their stock and better fight off competition and increase their profits. They hope to grow their businesses more in the future to help proviD. for their families.
texts.en:
Trujo is characterized by being very united. In times of conflict, the group comes together to support one another until all of the payments are maD.. The members of this group each specialize in the sale of groceries, bread, pastries/desserts, soft drinks, make-up, quinoa honey, cleaning products, school supplies, and clothes. Their diverse businesses are well known within their communities, which helps them significantly against local competition. This group would like a loan to increase their stock and better fight off competition and increase their profits. They hope to grow their businesses more in the future to help proviD. for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying stock to sell

loans.name: Thelma Del Socorro

texts.es: Thelma del Socorro C. M. tiene la edad de 53 años. Vive con su único hijo. Desde hace 4 años que se dedica a su pulpería. Decidiendo dedicarse a esta actividad, porque necesitaba un trabajo que pudiera realizar en su vivienda, es por eso que al comienzo solamente vendía refrescos naturales y jugos, y se dio cuenta que era muy rentable, Thelma le dedica bastante tiempo a su trabajo por lo que tiene que buscar nuevos productos y ordenar sus estantes. Y poco a poco cada día aprende más de su negocio. Con el financiamiento que solicita comprara granos básicos, gaseosas, golosinas y frutas. Su deseo es obtener una distribuidora para proporcionarle a su hijo una muy buena educación.
texts.en:
Thelma is 53 years old and lives with her only son. For the last 4 years she has run a small shop. She started this business because she needed a way to work from her home. She began by selling sodas and juices, and realized that this was a good business. She has dedicated a lot of time to her work, looking for new products to sell. Little by little she has learned more about running her shop. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy basic grains, sodas, sweets and fruits. Her goal is to grow her business so that she can provide a good education for her son.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her shop, and continue to grow her business so that she can pay for her son's education

loans.name: Alfonso Vanegas

texts.es: Alfonso Vanegas M. tiene la edad de 50 años. Es un hombre casado. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es ofrecer los servicios de mecánico. Hace más de 30 años que se dedica a este negocio. Alfonso tiene que trabajar desde muy temprano, hasta por la noche por que solamente así puede ofrecerle a su familia el pan de cada día. En algunas ocasiones sus hijos le ayudan en el taller, por lo que ellos estudian. Alfonso es una persona muy responsable y es un buen cliente. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de repuestos de vehículos. Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos logren finalizar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Alfonso Vanegas Munoz is 50 years old. He is married with three children who still depend on him. He earns a living as a mechanic, work he has been doing for more than 30 years. Alfonso needs to work long hours, from early morning until late at night just to put food on the table for his family. Sometimes his children help him in the shop when they are not at school. He is a very responsible person and a good client of the communal bank. He will use the loan he is requesting to purchase spare parts. His dream is for his children to be able to complete their education.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his auto repair shop

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia tiene 37 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y de buen carácter, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 5 hijos en la casa que heredó de sus padres. La siembra y venta de cultivos agrícolas como papa, arvejas y habas es su actividad diaria, por ello madrugada a las 5 de la mañana para tener tiempo suficiente para la preparación de sus alimentos y también para atender a los animales menores que cría en casa, luego acude a laborar en sus cultivos. Realizar los trabajas agrícolas le agrada mucho, ya que desde niña labraba sus chacras contemplando cada una de sus siembras y más ahora con el liderazgo de su esposo se siente muy motivada. Luego de la cosecha, terminan comercializando sus productos en el mercado de la ciudad de Tarma, para ello trata de seleccionar las papas de un solo tamaño para colocar un precio fijo. Gracias a su esfuerzo y al buen precio de sus productos, Alicia ha podido educar a sus hijos todos estos años, siendo su próxima meta; comprar otros terrenos para incrementar sus siembras. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, ha pagado sus anteriores créditos con mucha responsabilidad, además cuenta con el respaldo de sus compañeros de banco comunal, por lo que se siente muy contenta. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará 20 sacos de fertilizantes químicos, calcula que le costará un aproximado de 2,200 soles, con lo que resta comprará víveres para el consumo familiar.
texts.en:
Alicia is 37 years old. She is a hardworking and good-natured woman. She lives with her partner, the father of her 5 children, in the house they inherited from his parents. They plant and grow agricultural crops such as potatoes, peas and beans to earn their living. Alicia wakes up at 5am so that she has enough time to prepare the meals and tend to the younger animals. Afterwards, she begins her work in their fields.

Alicia says she enjoys working on a farm. Since she was a girl, she has helped plow the fields, always thinking about which crops to plant. Thanks to her husband’s influence, she finds herself more motivated. Once harvesting is done, they sell their products at the Tarma city market. They select potatoes of the same size so that they can be placed out for sale at a fixed price. Through her hard work and excellent pricing of her products, Alicia has been able to pay for her children’s education all these years. Her next goal is to buy additional farmland to increase her output.

This is Alicia’s ninth loan with MFP, and she has responsibly repaid her previous loans. She also has the backing of her fellow communal bank members, with whom she feels very happy. She will use the money to purchase 20 bags of chemical fertilizer, estimated cost of approximately 2200 soles, and with the remainder buy food for family consumption.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Esmeralda Group

texts.es:
En el centro focal Germán Buch, se reúne la asociación “Esmeralda”, está formado por doce mujeres, demostrando responsabilidad en sus seis años de trabajo junto a Pro-Mujer. Una de las socias más  antiguas es Teodocia L., quien es una de las fundadoras de la asociación, ella se dedica al tejido de ropa para invierno, además en su tiempo libre ayuda a su esposo como voceadora de transporte público.
Diversos son los negocios de este grupo, tales como: costura de ropa, venta y/o accesorios para celular, venta de abarrotes, bolsas desechables, tejido de alfombras, tejido de ropa para bebes, venta de papas fritas, venta de pescado  y otros. Ellas afirman que necesitan comprar mercadería y/o materia prima (compra de lana, tela, azúcar al por mayor y otros).
texts.en:
In the central community of Germán Buch, you will find the Esmeralda Association. They are a group of 12 women who have demonstrated responsibility in their six years of working together with Pro Mujer. One of the oldest members is Teodocia L., who is one of the founders of the association. She sells fabric used to make winter clothing. In her free time, she helps with her husband’s taxi business as a “voceadora” (a street barker who helps attract customers).

Several types of businesses are represented in this group: tailoring, mobile phone accessories, selling groceries, disposable bag sales, carpet weaving, knitting baby clothes, selling French fries, fish vending, and more. The members say they need to buy merchandise and raw materials (wool, cloth, sugar and other items).

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia tiene 27 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 2 hijas; Daniela de 5 años y Mayori de 2 en la casa que le cedieron sus padres. Tras haber sufrido un terrible accidente hace 20 días atrás, Alicia ha quedado con heridas en su cuerpo y en el rostro, por eso se cubre la cara con una chalina para evitar que el sol genere mayores infecciones. Antes de este accidente trabajaba diariamente en las chacras de sus padres y de suegros; últimamente, con su esposo, decidieron sembrar papas y arvejas dejando a sus pequeñas al cuidado de su madre. A ella le gusta mucho el labrado de la tierra ya que lo  realizó desde muy pequeña y ahora que está descansando por sus dolencias se aburre mucho en su casa. Desde entonces, su esposo solo viene trabajando en los cultivos y ella espera  pronto poder recuperarse para realizar las cosechas, ya que es la época más trabajosa, pero una vez pasada esa temporada siente tranquilidad hasta la próxima siembra. Su deseo a futuro es poder adquirir sus propios terrenos de cultivo. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, pero su esposo trabajó en los ciclos pasados en su banco comunal y demostró pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Cabe mencionar que Alicia acude a todas las reuniones en compañía de su esposo, ya que son muy comprometidos en los trabajos de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicitan lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos y algunas medicinas para su recuperación oportuna.
texts.en:
Alicia is 27 years old and lives her husband and their two daughters, Daniela, 5, and Mayori, 2, in a home given to her by her parents. After suffering a terrible accident 20 days ago, Alicia was left with injuries to her body and face, which is why she covers her face with a scarf to block out the sun and stave off worse infections. Before the accident, she worked daily on the fields of her parents and in-laws. Ultimately, she and her husband decided to plant potatoes and peas of their own while they left their daughter in the care of Alicia's mother. Alicia really enjoys working on the land because it's something she has done since she was very little, and now that she is recovering from her ailments at home she is very bored. Since then, her husband has been the only one working on the crops, and she hopes she'll be able to get better soon so she can help with the harvest since that's when the most work is required, but once it passes everything relaxes until the next planting. Her wish for the future is to be able to acquire her own land to cultivate. This is her second loan with Kiva partner MFP, and her husband has worked with loans in the past with his communal bank and has shown himself to be punctual with his payments. With the money Alicia is currently requesting, she plans to invest in the purchase of chemical fertilizers and some medicines for her speedy recovery.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es: Epifanía tiene 50 años, es una mujer muy amorosa con su familia, la cual está conformada por su pareja y sus 4 hijos, viven en su casa propia. Desde muy pequeña labraba la tierra, su cultivo preferido era la papa, pero en alguna oportunidad fracasó con su cosecha debido al precio muy bajo del mercado y el clima no ayudó al desarrollo de sus productos. Desde entonces comenzó a comprar y vender verduras y últimamente también quesos a la ciudad de la Merced. Este año ha incrementado notablemente sus clientes, permitiéndole captar mayores ingresos para su hogar, mientras que su esposo se sigue dedicándose a la agricultura. Ahora que los dos trabajan, percibe que los ingresos son mayores y de ese modo no sienten mucha carga para pagar la educación de sus 4 hijos. Epifanía está muy contenta con su negocio y a cada cliente le da su mejor atención, puesto que sabe que gracias a ellos está mejorando su calidad de vida. De seguir trabajando con esta dinámica pronto alcanzará su meta de comprar un terreno en la ciudad para el bienestar de sus hijos y se eviten viajar diariamente hacia el colegio. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP y así como pagó todos sus créditos anteriores oportunamente, ahora se compromete seguir cumpliendo de esa manera. En cuanto a su banco comunal, se siente muy satisfecha de pertenecer a él, ya que dice encontrar mucho apoyo moral. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará para la compra de fertilizantes químicos, y para comprar más verduras para su negocio.
texts.en:
Epifanía is 50 years old and very loving to her family, which consists of her husband and their four children, and they live together in a home they own. Since she was very little Epifanía worked on the land. Her preferred crop was potatoes, but at some point her harvest failed due to the low prices garnered at the market, and the climate did not help her develop her products. Since that time she started buying and selling vegetables, and ultimately cheeses as well, at the city market of Merced. This year her client base has notably increased, allowing her to bring in more income for her household while her husband continues making a living in agriculture. Now that both are working, it appears that their income has improved and they don't feel as much of a burden in paying for the education of their four children. Epifanía feels very satisfied with her business, and she provides good service to every customer, since she knows her it's thanks to them that her quality of life is improving. If she keeps working with this dynamic she will soon be able to reach her goal of buying some land in the city to help her children, so they won't have to commute as far daily to school. This is her ninth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she has paid all her previous ones punctually. She feels very satisfied to belong to her community bank, where she receives a lot of moral support. With the money she is requesting, she plans to purchase chemical fertilizers and purchase more vegetables for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chemical fertilizers and increase her vegetable inventory

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es: Genoveva tiene 57 años, es una mujer muy alegre y bastante ágil en sus actividades, vive con el padre de sus 7 hijos, de los cuales sólo los 6 menores viven en su casa. Se dedica a la crianza de vacas y al cultivo de sus chacras, pero lo que más le gusta es el cuidado de sus animales. Para ello se levanta muy temprano por la mañana para acumular la cantidad necesaria de forraje para alimentarlos, posteriormente sujeta a sus vacas, encerrando a los becerros en un corral, hasta que termine de ordeñar la leche y luego los alimenta, esa leche la lleva a su comprador quien le paga 1.60 soles por cada litro. Una vez terminada esta actividad carga las viandas del almuerzo en su espalda y camina entre 3 a 4 kilómetros de distancia hacia donde está su esposo trabajando en sus cultivos. Genoveva se siente muy feliz de hacer este trabaja cada día, ya que le genera buenas ganancias, permitiéndole acumular dinero para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Para el futuro, tiene planes de comprar más becerras para que cuando crezcan se conviertan en vacas lecheras que le ayuden a aumentar sus ingresos económicos diarios. Genoveva ingresa al noveno crédito con MFP y hace el compromiso de seguir cumpliendo como hasta ahora con sus cuotas de pago. Ella quiere mucho a su banco comunal, ya que en él encuentra compañerismo y apoyo. El dinero que viene solicitando lo va a invertir en la compra de chacras de avenas sembrada para alimentar a sus vacas, la otra parte es para la compra de fertilizantes con lo que sembrará papas.
texts.en:
Genoveva is 57 years old. She is a very happy woman who remains active in her work. She lives with the father of her 7 children, 6 of whom still live at home. She raises cows and plants crops, but of those two activities, she enjoys caring for her animals the most.

She wakes up each morning to gather the necessary amount of fodder to feed her cows. Once the cows are together in a single place, she locks up the calves in a corral until she finishes milking and feeding the adults. The milk is delivered to a buyer who pays 1.60 soles per liter. After that, she packs a lunchbox on to her back and walks 3 to 4 kilometers to where her husband is working in the fields.

Genoveva is very happy to do this work every day because it generates a good income and allows her to accumulate money to maintain her home. In the future, she plans to purchase more calves that become full grown dairy cows that can help increase her daily earnings.

Genoveva is on her ninth loan with MFP and is committed to completing her payments as she has done previously. She enjoys very much the companionship and support of her communal bank group. Part of the money she is requesting will be used to purchase another plot of land to plant oats that will feed her cows. The remaining funds will be set aside to buy fertilizer for her potato fields.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and animal feed

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José tiene 26 años, vive con su pareja en L. casa D. sus padres y tiene una hija que es el motor D. su trabajo. Él se dedica a brindar servicios D. transporte público y a enseñar danzas. Cuando empezó con el transporte no contaba con L. licencia D. conducir ni con el permiso D. L. municipalidad, por lo que tenía muchas dificultades para trabajar. Posteriormente con el apoyo D. su padre logró regularizar todos sus documentos, por ello le da una parte D. las ganancias D. su trabajo como alquiler del motocarro, pues el vehículo es D. su padre. Pero con lo que José se siente más identificado es con las danzas y constantemente se capacita en diversas coreografías actuales. Además, también alquiL. los trajes para los danzantes, lo que le permite acumular más ganancias. Con estas dos actividades es con las que José mantiene a su familia, siendo su próxima meta L. construcción D. su casa propia. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, durante los periodos concluidos demostró pagar a tiempo todas las cuotas, además sus compañeros le tienen mucho aprecio por ser el presidente D. su banco comunal y siempre los orienta para que tomen decisiones acertadas. El dinero que solicita lo piensa utilizar en el incremento D. los disfraces típicos que alquiL., con otra parte pagará el cambio D. un repuesto del motocarro con el que trabaja.
texts.en:
José is 26 years old, lives with his partner at his parents’ house, and has one daughter who is the driving force behind his work. He dedicates himself to providing public transportation services and teaching dance. When he started in transportation, he didn’t have a license or the necessary municipal approvals, which maD. it very difficult to work. Later, with his father’s support, he managed to obtain all the necessary documentation. He pays a part of his earnings towards renting his motocar, as it belongs to his father. However, what José most identifies with is dance and he is always choreographing new dances. Teaching dance generates additional income for him, but he also has to rent dance costumes. His two activities allow him to support his family, and his next goal is to build his own home. This is his ninth credit with MFP, and his past record demonstrates that he complies with his payments. In addition, his friends greatly appreciate him as he is the president of their cooperative bank and he always helps guiD. them towards good decision-making. He plans to use some of the funds he is requesting to rent more traditional dance outfits, and the rest to pay off a repair on his motocar.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make repairs to his motocar and buy dance costumes.

loans.name: Alternativa Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal “Alternativa” tiene once años de vida, se reúne en el centro focal Los Andes ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto.
Actualmente Francisca C. es  la presidente de este grupo, menciona que el grupo se caracteriza por que entre ellas son  solidarias, cumplidas y se llevan como hermanas.
La asociación tiene diferentes actividades como ser, venta de zapatos, bolsas plásticas, elaboración y venta de comida, una  de ellas es carpintera, pero la mayoría de sus integrantes se dedica al tejido artesanal de chompas, medias  y guantes. Con las bajas temperaturas del invierno tienen la seguridad que pueden incrementar sus ventas, para este objetivo necesitan capital para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
The “Alternative” cooperative bank has been in existence for eleven years. It meets in Los Andes, located in the city of El Alto. Currently, Francisca C. is the president of this group. She notes that the group members work together, are prompt, and get along like sisters. Group members undertake different types of activities such as the sale of shoes, plastic bags, making and selling of prepared foods, and carpentry. The majority of the members knit traditional sweaters, socks and gloves. The coming winter cold will ensure that their sales grow, and for this they need funds to buy raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Amigas Por Siempre (Friends Forever) Group

texts.es:
La asociación  “amigas por Siempre” está formada por catorce integrantes, nace aproximadamente hace tres años, Marina C. es una de las mas antiguas, cuenta que el grupo se conformo  invitando a vecinas y conocidas de la zona Los Andes, ella recuerda que a pesar que las socias  vivían cerca la misma zona no tenían mucho trato social, pero a medida que asistieron a las reuniones lograron formar un grupo muy unido y alegre.
Este grupo se dedica a diferentes actividades como ser: venta de verduras, zapatos, adornos, pero la actividad principal de este grupo esta basado en la ropa, realizan confecciones de polleras, mandiles de cocina, pantalones, blusas, también realizan tejidos de mantas y chompas.Luego comercializan sus productos en puestos y tiendas de la ciudad. Desean aumentar su produccion, para esto necesitan capital para comprar materia prima, tienen la seguridad de obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
The "Friends Forever" Association has fourteen members, and it was founded approximately three years ago. Marina C. is one of the first members. She was there when the group was founded by inviting neighbors and acquaintances from the Los Andes zone. She remembers that in spite of the fact that the members lived close to the same area, they didn't have very much social contact. However, through attendance at their group meetings, they have become a very united and happy group. The group members work at different activities, including the sale of vegetables, shoes, and decorations. However, the main activity of the group is based on clothing. They make skirts, kitchen aprons, pants, and blouses. They also weave blankets and sweaters. Then, they sell their products in stands and stores in the city. They want to expand their production, and for this they need capital to purchase raw material so they will have the certainty of earning better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw material

loans.name: Las Rosas Group 2

texts.en:
Kenia S., pictured on the far right, is the coordinator of her 5-member group. She lives in a rented home in the sector of Guaricanos, in Santo Domingo Norte, along with her husband and two daughters, ages 10 and 3. Their eldest daughter attends school and the youngest plans to begin school next year.

Kenia just graduated from beauty school. She plans to use this first loan from Esperanza to set up her own hair salon. She plans to invest in a hair drier, a styling chair, and general beauty equipment, such as brushes and clips, to complete what she needs to start. She is very excited to finally begin reaping the results of her studying.

Her goals for this loan are to solidify her hair styling abilities, establish a stable business, and sharpen her business skills. Her long term goals are to own her own home, and to become an extremely good stylist, so that she can become a styling teacher.

loans.use: A hair drier, a styling chair, and general beauty equipment

loans.name: Sebastiana Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Sebastiana del Carmen Sánchez García , tiene la edad de 38 años , habita en el barrio pilas Orientales , ubicado en la cuidad de Masaya , junto a su compañero de vida , ellos tienen tres hijos , el mayor ya está casado y el de 18 y 13 años estudia actualmente y le poyan con los trabajos agrícolas , los planes hacia su familia es poder apoyar siempre a sus hijos en sus estudios , doña Sebastiana desde 15 años se dedica a la agricultura , ella inicio esta actividad con  ayuda de su esposo , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son las plagas  que espera poder fumigar,  Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y poder tener una buena cosecha, para vender a buen precio al mercado y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sebastiana del Carmen Sánchez Garcia is 38 years old. She lives in the Pilas Orientales neighborhood, in the city of Masaya, with her spouse. They have three children, the oldest of whom is married. The other two children, who are 18 and 13 years old, are currently studying and also help with the farm work. The Garcias' plans for their family are to always be able to support their children in their studies. Ms. Sebastiana has worked in agriculture for 15 years. She started this work with the help of her husband. The greatest difficulties that they face are the plagues, which she hopes to be able to fumigate. With this loan, she will buy fertilizers and other inputs that she will apply to her crop so that she can have a good harvest, that she can sell for a good price at the market and earn greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: La señora  Nancy es una cliente antigua, en su historial demuestra que es una cliente responsable y su actitud lo demuestra tambien asi, la señora Nancy se dedica a la venta de ropa a medio uso, la señora es ambulante por lo cual tiene puestos el las diferentes ferias de la ciudad de La Paz, la señora es una persona muy trabajadora, ella sale todos los dias a la venta. Su esposo es don Roberto Encinas el es chofer del rdio taxi, juntos ella con su esposo trabajan para darle un mejor patrimonio a sus hijos, ellos tienen 2 hijos que aun son pequeños, el destino del credito es para surtir su mercaderia, ella tiene un stock determinado, pero ella quiere ampliarlo.
texts.en:
Nancy is an experienced client. Her record demonstrates that she is a responsible client and her attitude says the same. Nancy has a business selling used clothing. She is a traveling saleswoman, so she sells at stalls in different markets of the city of La Paz. She is a very hard-working person, and she goes out every day to make her sales. Her husband is Roberto Encinas, a radio taxi driver. Nancy and her husband work together to give their children a better life. They have two children who are still young. The loan will be used to purchase merchandise; Nancy has some stock, but she wants to expand her variety.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise; to expand her stock of clothing

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es: Don Sebastian de 52 años es soltero, comerciante, propietario de repuestos automotriz y autolavado, quien tiene una excelente clientela, tiene mucha experiancia en el negocio, su compañera de vida Rosa Amelia se encarga de otro negocio en su casa con una pulperia quien ayuda en los gastos del hogar, tiene 3 hijos, todos estudian 2 la secundaria y 1 la universidad.  Esta solicitando su credito # 1 el que utilizara para la construccion de una tapia y un anexo para un dormitorio, ya que considera que su casa es muy pequeña y desea mayor comodidad para su familia, sobre todo porque sus hijos ya estan bien crecidos.  El Señor F. goza de prestigio y capacidad de pago.
texts.en:
Sebastian is 52-years old and has never married. He is an experienced business man, owner of a spare auto parts shop and car wash with an excellent customer base. His life partner, Rosa Amelia, is in charge of another business in their house; a local store that helps cover household expenses with its revenues. They have three children, all in school. Two are in high school and one is in college. Sebastian is requesting his first loan, which he will use to build a wall around his home and an extra bedroom. His house is very small and he hopes to make it more comfortable for his family, especially because his children are growing up. Mr. F. has a good reputation and the capacity to repay his loan.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of wall and bedroom

loans.name: Las Rosas Group 1

texts.en:
Ana Robertina C. Bonillo, who appears in the middle in the photo, is the coordinator of her 5-member loan group.

Ana lives in the Guaricanos sector of Santo Domingo Norte. She is a single mother and lives with her three boys, ages 18, 15, and 14. All three attend school. The oldest just graduated from high school and plans to begin college in the fall, where he will study graphic design. For the last three years, Ana has sold general beauty products and underwear around her town, but it has not been a stable income for her, due to lack of resources.

Ana plans to use this Kiva loan to invest in a good amount of merchandise for her business. Specifically, she plans to purchase hair products, underwear, and hair accessories, which are the products with greatest demand. She will also buy small quantities of some other hair products as an experiment and see if there is demand for them.

Her goals for this loan are to be able to establish her business, and to have a permanent location for the business so that she will not have to go walking around her town selling her products any longer. She dreams that all of her children graduate from college and that she will eventually own her own hair salon and have two or three employees.

loans.use: Hair products, underwear, and hair accessories

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 44 años, vive con su hermano y su anciana madre en su casa propia. DesD. su niñez se dedica a las actividades agrícolas y ganaderas, tiene en su misma casa un amplio establo donD. elL. y sus hermanos se encargan D. atender a los animales en L. limpieza y alimentación, además cuidan D. que estén desparasitados. Luego D. un mes D. trabajo intenso los venden en L. feria ganadera y también arriendan sus toros para los arados en las épocas D. siembra. L. ganadería le trae mayores ganancias que el cultivo D. L. tierra, por lo que  Gladys está planeando para más adelante ampliar el espacio D. su establo para albergar a más animales. Esta es L. sexta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, elL. es muy querida por los demás integrantes D. su banco comunal debido a su carisma. A su vez, se compromete a seguir adelante  en L. participación activa en su grupo. El dinero que está solicitando será destinado a L. compra D. semillas y abono para sembrar pastos que servirán D. alimento para sus animales, también invertirá en un nuevo negocio que será L. venta D. ladrillos.
texts.en:
Gladys is 44 years old, she lives with her brother and aging mother in the house they own. Since childhood she has dedicated herself to agricultural and livestock work. The house has a spacious stable where she and her brothers are in charge of the animals' cleaning and feeding. They also make sure they are free of parasitic infections. After a month of intense work, they sell the animals in the livestock market and also rent out their bulls for ploughing during the planting season. The cattle farm brings them more income than farming the land does, thus Gladys is planning to expand the stable space in the future to be able to house more animals. This is the sixth loan she has had with MFP; she is much loved by the other members of her community bank due to her charisma. In turn, she is committed to continuing her active participation in her group. The money that she is requesting will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizer to create more pasture that will serve to feed her cattle. It will also be invested in a new business to sell bricks.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Herminio

texts.es: Herminio tiene 36 años, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde su juventud se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno en su propio establo, es muy cuidadoso con sus animales y está pendiente de alimentarlos y desparasitarlos periódicamente. Todos los sábados los vende en la feria ganadera de su localidad, donde también adquiere nuevos animales para revenderlos, a su vez, vende la leche de sus vacas, por lo que obtiene ingresos extras. Esta actividad le resulta muy rentable, por lo que ha decidió implementar y mejorar su establo para albergar a más animales. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, su primer crédito fue para él una experiencia muy exitosa, por lo que ha decidido integrarse de manera más comprometida a su banco comunal. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de un toro pequeño que incrementará su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Herminio is 36 years old, and lives with his wife and 2 children in a house they own. He has dedicated himself to raising livestock since he was a youth. He takes great care of his animals, and he is always aware of feeding them and looking for parasites. Each Saturday, he sells them at the livestock market in his locality where he also buys new animals to resell. Concurrently, he sells his cows’ milk from which he generates additional income. These activities have proven profitable for him, because he has decided to expand and make improvements to his stables so he can house additional animals. This is his second loan with MFP. His first loan went very well, and helped him decide to become an integral member of his cooperative bank. The funds that he is soliciting will be used to buy a small bull and to increase his working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a small bull.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge tiene 33 años, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 6 años se dedica a fabricar canaletes, las cuales que colocan en los techos de las casas en época de lluvia. Aprendió esta actividad de unas amistades cuando trabajaba como obrero y hoy, junto a su esposa (quien aparece en la foto) las fabrican y llevan a localidades aledañas para venderlas. Como primer paso, busca a sus clientes por las mañanas, mientras que su esposa va almacenando lo que se ha fabricado para tenerlo listo en el momento que se necesite llevarlo al cliente. Asimismo, ofrece sus canaletas a las principales tiendas ferreteras  de su barrio pactando cobrarles de manera semanal. Esta actividad le ha permitido a Jorge hacer progresar económicamente a su familia, por lo que ha decidido comprar más materia prima para seguir produciendo en mayor cantidad sus canaletas. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está muy satisfecho de formar parte de un grupo humano donde se siente bien integrado e identificado como es su banco comunal. El dinero solicitado será destinado a la compra de fierros y calaminas que son los principales materiales que utiliza para la fabricación de las canaletes.
texts.en:
Jorge is 33 years old, and lives with his wife and 2 children in a house he owns. For the past six years, he has dedicated himself to fabricating gutters/water channels. These are placed on the roof of a home during the rainy season. He learned the trade from a friend, during a time when he worked as a laborer. Today, together with his wife (who appears in the photograph), he manufactures them and transports them to neighboring towns to sell. He first tries looking for customers in the mornings, while his wife organizes their goods and readies the product to be delivered to a customer at a moments’ notice. Likewise, he offers his product in his neighborhood’s hardware stores agreeing to charge on a weekly basis. This activity has allowed Jorge to support his family financially, a reason why he’s decided to buy more raw materials to produce his gutters in greater quantity. This is the third time he has taken a loan with MFP, and he is very gratified to be part of a group where he feels well-integrated as he does with his cooperative bank. The funds he is requesting will be used to buy metals and mill scale, the principal materials he needs to fabricate his product.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis tiene 46 años, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace más de 20 años, junto a su esposa (quien aparece en la foto) se ha dedicado incansablemente a las actividades agrícolas y ganaderas. Como veterinario de profesión, cuida de sus animales con mucho ahínco y muchas veces sus vecinos acuden a él cuando tienen alguna emergencia con sus animales, lo que le significa un ingreso económico adicional. La alimentación que brinda a sus animales es la adecuada y por lo que los mantiene en buen estado de salud para ser bien cotizados en el mercado ganadero de su zona. Por tal razón, Luis desea tener un establo más grande y con la infraestructura necesaria para criar a sus animales de la mejora manera. Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, para él estar integrando en un banco comunal es un espacio muy agradable donde comparte buenas relaciones con sus compañeros. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de un torete para incrementar la cantidad de ganado que tiene.
texts.en:
Luis is 46 years old and lives with his wife and their 3 children in their own house. For more than 20 years, he and his wife (who appears in the photo) have worked tirelessly in agriculture and livestock. Since he is a veterinarian by profession, he takes care of their animals with a lot of devotion, and, many times, his neighbors come to him when they have an emergency with their animals. This serves as another source of income for him. He gives good food to his animals, and because they are healthy, his animals are in high-demand in the livestock market in his area. For this reason, Luis wants to have a larger stable, with the necessary infrastructure to care for his animals in the best way. This is his fourth loan with MFP. He enjoys being a member of his community bank, and he has good relationships with his peers. The money that he is requesting will be invested to buy a young bull to increase the amount of livestock that he has.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a young bull

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: El señor Vicente es un cliente antiguo de la institucion, comenzo con su grupo solidario "la bolivianita"  a medida que pasaba el tiempo el demostro responsabilidad y puntualidad, su negocio es la fabricacion de joyas, su lugar de venta esta ubicado en la avenida Tiwanaku, su negocio esta ubicado en un lugar estrategico de la ciudad de El Alto, su esposo se dedica a  la joyeria juntos ellos trabajan y elaboran joyas de diferentes modelos, ella se dedica a la elaboracion de joya y ella lo vende en su tienda, el destino del credito es la compra de oror en bruto para la elaboracion de joyas de diferentes modelos.
texts.en:
Vicente is a long time client of the institution. He began with his solidarity group “La Bolivianita” and as time passed, he proved his responsibility and punctuality. He makes jewelry and sells it on Tiwanaku Avenue. His business is located in a strategic place in the city of El Alto. His wife is a jeweler and they work together, making pieces of jewelry of different models. She makes jewelry and sells it in their store. This loan will be used to purchase gold to make pieces of jewelry of different models.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase uncut gold

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam tiene 25 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo de 4 años en una casa que le dieron a cuidar. Desde hace 5 años tiene una granja de cuyes y pollos que ella misma atiende con mucho esmero, adquiere el alimento básico de sus animales cortando la alfalfa de las tierras de cultivo que dispone de su madre. Por las tardes de dedica a limpiar su granja y el guano que extrae le sirve para abonar sus tierras de cultivo. Los cuyes que cría los vende a sus vecinos y a otras personas que le hacen pedidos para banquetes donde los platillos son a base de cuy. Esta actividad es de gran ayuda para la economía de su hogar y está decidida a hacer crecer su granja para incrementar sus ganancias. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y se siente muy comprometida en su banco comunal, por lo que renueva su compromiso de ser responsable con sus pagos. Con el dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de más cuyes y pollos de mejor raza.
texts.en:
Miriam is 25 years old, and she lives in a house with her husband and their 4-year-old son. For the past 5 years, she has had a guinea pig and chicken farm and she takes very good care of it. She cuts alfalfa from her mother’s land to obtain basic foods for her animals. In the afternoons, she cleans the farm and manure that she uses to fertilize her lands. She sells the guinea pigs that she raises to her neighbors and other people that make requests for banquets with guinea pig based dishes. This job is a big help for the economy of her home and she is determined to expand her farm to increase her earnings. This is her second loan with MFP and she feels very engaged in her community bank because it revitalizes her commitment to being responsible in making her payments. The loan that she is asking for will be invested in the purchase of more guinea pigs and chickens that are of a better breed.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of guinea pigs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Percy

texts.es: Percy tiene 34 años, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la ganadería, todos los días de manera constante limpia, alimenta y desparasita a sus animales, lo cuales vende en la feria ganadera, junto con la leche que producen sus vacas. Paralelamente siembra en sus tierras papa, maíz y otros productos nativos de su localidad, pero en lo que más intensifica su trabajo es en el cultivo de la alfalfa para alimentar a sus animales. Para un futuro cercano, Percy desea tener un establo más grande y mejorar su infraestructura para poder criar a más animales. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, él se siente muy integrado y comprometido con su trabajo en su banco comunal porque todos son organizados y juntos han superado muchos obstáculos. El monto que está ahora solicitando será destinado a la compra de abono para sembrar más extensiones de alfalfa y asegurar la alimentación de su ganado.
texts.en:
Percy is 34 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and his 3 children. He has been in the livestock business for the past 10 years. Every day he cleans, feeds, and treats his animals for parasites. He sells his animals in the livestock market, along with the milk produced by his cows. He also grows potatoes, corn, and other crops on his land that are native to his area. However, what intensifies his work the most is the cultivation of alfalfa to feed his animals. In the near future, Percy wants to have a bigger stable and improve the infrastructure so that he can raise more animals. This is his second loan with MFP. He feels very integrated and committed to the work at his community bank because everyone is organized and together they have overcome many obstacles. The loan that he is asking for will be used for the purchase of fertilizer to plant more alfalfa and to assure the feeding of his livestock.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar tiene 40  años, vive con sus dos hijas en su casa propia. Desde hace 2 años tiene una tienda en su misma casa, donde sus hijas la apoyan en la atención cuando ella tiene que llevar los animales que cría al campo para alimentarlos. La atención que ofrece es diaria, incluyendo los domingos, Pilar comenta que por las mañanas hay más ventas que por las tardes, es por eso que nunca deja de atender en ese horario. Y debido a su perseverancia cada vez tiene más clientes que compran regularmente, lo que le significa mayores ganancias que incrementan su capital de trabajo. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, cuando ingresó a su banco comunal  fue una experiencia muy gratificante por lo que se animó a renovar su compromiso con su grupo. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de más mercadería en productos de primera necesidad, como leche envasada, arroz, azúcar, fideos, entre otros.
texts.en:
Pilar is 40 years old and lives in her own house with her two daughters. She has had a store in her house for the past 2 years, where her daughters help her with service while she has to bring the animals that she cares for to the field to feed them. Her store is open daily, including Sundays. Pilar comments that there are more sales in the mornings than there are in the afternoons. This is why she never stops attending to the store during these hours. Due to her increasing perseverance, she has more customers that buy regularly, which for her means greater earnings that increase her working capital. This is her second loan with MFP. When she joined her community bank, it was a very gratifying experience because it encouraged her to renew her commitment with her group. The loan that she is asking for will be used for the purchase of more staple merchandise such as canned milk, rice, sugar, and pasta, among others.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Lorgenia

texts.en:
Lorgenia S. is from the village of Malibangcao in Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 40 years old. Lorgenia is married. To make a living, Lorgenia plants and harvests corn, banana, and coconut to sell. Lorgenia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Lorgenia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorgenia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be Lorgenia's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita B. is from the village of Malibangcao Ozamiz City. She is 60 years old. Anecita is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Anecita prepares and sell "tuba" or coconut wine. Anecita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Anecita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anecita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Anecita is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP that she will use to expand her business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Anecita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora F. is from the village of Malibangcao, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old. Flora is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Flora grows crops, especially coconuts and bananas, to sale. Flora has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Flora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flora is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP that she will use to expand her business. This is Flora's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: 01-Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Thuý N. Thị, 39, lives in the town of Thanh Hoá. Thuý is the leader of a 5-member group that is requesting a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 01-Điện Biên (03.19.01).

Thuý is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Thuý owns and operates a food stall where she sells a variety of food products. Thuý has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 1.200.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2009, Thuý joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Thuý is requesting her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan of 4.248.000 VND that she will invest in expanding her business. Thuý plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  N. Thị Tâm, 52, is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her food stall business.

2.  Lê Thị Cúc, 49, is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business of making and selling food.

3.  H. Thị Hường, 38, is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her food stall business.

4.  N. Thị Vân, 36,  requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her food stall business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Thuý N. Thị (4) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Thuý là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 01-Điện Biên (03.19.01).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các loại thực phẩm khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Thuý thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Thuý kiếm được khoảng 1.200.000 VND.  Vào 2009, Thuý đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Thuý đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  N. Thị Tâm (2) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.

2.  Lê Thị Cúc (3) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

3.  H. Thị Hường (1) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.

4.  N. Thị Vân (6) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Genine

texts.en:
Genine V. is from the village of Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 19 years old. Genine is married and has no children. To make a living, Genine owns and operates a transportation business. She provides pedicab transport  to local community members. Genine has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Genine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genine is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP that she will use to renovate the business. This is Genine's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and  Misamis  Occidental. Its membership consists mostly of farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To renovate the business

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna D. is a woman of faith and courage who is trying to cut the string of poverty that hinders the dreams of her family. She is 37 years old and married to Reynaldo who is a fisherman and also a carpenter. She is the mother of three children. The family lives in the island village of Sapang in the town of Binangonan, Rizal province in the Philippines.

Digna joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2008. When she got her first loan, she invested it in fishing. The business did well and now she is asking for a second loan, a loan of 10,000 pesos to pay for 10 bundles of fish nets and other equipment for fishing.

Digna is hopeful that in the near future, her business will grow, and they will have more fishing gear--she even dreams of having her own fishing boat someday. She aspires to send her children to school until they finish schooling and find jobs.

loans.use: 10 bundles of fish nets and other equipment for fishing

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria A. is a resident of the Sapang island village in the town of Bianangonan in Rizal Province in the Philippines. She is married to Bartolome, who is 49 years old and her partner in business. She is a mother to two boys, both of legal age.

She joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2008 with a hope to free herself from poverty. She owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store and she spent her previous loan wisely and orderly. Now, she proposes to borrow a second loan of 10,000 pesos to serve as additional capital for her sari-sari store. The funds will be used to purchase two sacks of rice and groceries for the store.

She is sure that people in the village will visit her store regularly because she sells the food that meets their daily needs. She dreams of expanding the business, turning it to a grocery store, and repairing her house.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of rice and groceries for her general store

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes H. is a poverty-fighting woman from the island village of Bombong in the town of Binangonan, Rizal Province in the Philippines. She is 45 years old and is married to Dominador, a 36-year-old fisherman. She is the mother of a daughter who is in high school.

She joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2006 with bag full of hope to have the opportunity to rise above poverty. She use her previous loans as a continuous supply capital for her grocery business. Now, for her fourth loan, she proposes the amount of 20,000 pesos to buy 7 sacks of rice, 3 sacks of white sugar, 2 gallons of gasoline (for resale), and liquor, and among many other grocery items. She been in this kind of business for three years.

She dreams of really being able to provide the basics and any other needs of her child, especially for schooling. She dreams of having a bigger grocery and someday, she will hire employees.

loans.use: 7 sacks of rice, 3 sacks of white sugar, liqours and other grooceries for her general store

loans.name: Nin

texts.en:
Mrs. Nin M. is 42 years old and a resident of Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. Her husband, Phok Phoeun, who appears in the photo, is also 42 years old. They make a living planting crops in the village. This couple has given birth to five children. One of their children is married and lives separately; the others still live at home. Their single children also work on the farm. To help be a little more responsible for her family, one of their daughters works in a garment factory.

Because the family lacks the money to support the farm field activities during this farming season, Nin M. would like a loan from Kiva to grow a rice crop.

loans.use: To grow a rice crop

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria D. is a 48-year-old mother to five children, almost all of whom are already of legal age. She is optimistic about the battle against poverty. She hails from the island village of Kinagatan in the town of Binangonan, Rizal Province in the Philippines.

She joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2006 with full of determination to cut the string of poverty that hinders her way to success. She invested her loan in the resale business. For her fifth loan, she proposes the amount of 25,000 pesos as additional capital for her resale business. She will purchase 3 sacks of rice, 3 gallons of cooking oil, and 10 chairs made of bamboo.

She is looking forward to expanding her business and being able to resell in the nearby markets, to be able to let her youngest child finish college, and to have savings for emergency purposes.

loans.use: To buy 3 sacks of rice, 3 gallons of gasoline, and 10 bamboo chairs for her resale business.

loans.name: Rodellia

texts.en:
Rodellia D. is from the village of San Antonio, Ozamiz City, in Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 29 years old. Rodellia is married and has an infant. To make a living, Rodellia owns and operates a business making and selling peanut butter and "longanisa" (pork sausage) to sell in the community. Rodellia is just starting this business.
