She and her husband are hopeful that this loan will allow them to accrue more income in order to make sure their family attains a good standard of living.

loans.use: To buy additional tools for her husband's fishing business

loans.name: Olushegun

texts.en:
B. produces and sells popcorn and bakes cakes; she engages in indoor and outdoor catering services and has been in the business for the past four years.

B. is 30 years old and married with two children. She is requesting the loan of N120,000 to purchase more corn for the productions of popcorn. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more corn for the production of popcorn to sell

loans.name: Enjeh

texts.en: F. is married with two children. She originally joined GHAPE and got her first empowerment credit in 2007 and, since that time, she and her husband have enjoyed the benefits of GHAPE empowerment credits on two other occasions. Things have been very difficult for F. since she took her last loan of 200,000 frs, since thieves broke into her poultry house and stole all her fowls. As if that was not enough, the cold hands of death took away her first-born due to an accident, a son she had in mind to be very supportive of her. Before her first two loans, F. had only a little to start frying Accra beans (a mixture of ground beans) and used the profits. Throughout the years, F. has suffered the consequences of poor health and of her husband refusing to supply the needs of the children. Besides that, she and her family have simply suffered the results of poverty and the accompanying challenges of life that has brought them. F., however, has the beginnings of a solid business. She has a prime location for her poultry farm and she plans to reinforce it by buying planks and steel doors. She is well known throughout the community as being trustworthy with her customers. She also has years of experience already in running a poultry and a vegetable farm, which has helped her. With her third GHAPE loan, F. intends to invest in the poultry farm in offering chickens for sale, By expanding her business like this, she will also be able to offer manure for sale to fertilize local farms and gardens, and will also provide such essentials as oil, salt and Maggi (a soup mix) for the family. With the profits of this business, F. will be able to afford the school fees of her other children, and will be able to continue providing good healthful medications for them. She will be able to feed her family, provide them with clothes and will have the opportunity to save for the future as well. F. came to GHAPE because of the training scheme the organization offers, because of the terms of the loans, and because the method of repayment is “comfortable and convenient”. About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase chickens, fertilizer, feed, pay rent of the farmland and renovate the poultry house

loans.name: Mangwi

texts.en:
D. is married and blessed with four children. She was terribly upset when her two brothers and mother died in the same year. Also, she worked very hard so that her son could travel abroad, but when he left, his documents were seized, and he is now home with her in the house and struggling to make ends meet. Finally, she contracted bird flu during the term of her previous loan, which was a great loss for her.

She joined GHAPE in 2007 and, after obtaining training in business management, she obtained her first loan and open a video shop. With her second loan of 200000frs, she invested in poultry and successfully repaid the loan, despite the hard times.

With her third loan, she plans to continue the poultry farming. With the profit, she will be able to maintain her house and provide medication for herself and her family when they are sick. She plans to repay the loan in 18 months and the first installment of the repayment will be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of chicks and feed.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 19-year-old man living in the town of Saida in South Lebanon. Abdallah supports his family because his father can no longer work due to his age. Abdallah has been a carpenter for two years, and he recently started a new business.

This is his second loan with A. Majmoua, which he always repaid with timely payments. With his first loan, he built a mini-train that he attached to his motorbike to give little kids rides on the Saida pier. This was the only business of the like in the area. This business has proven to be profitable, and he would like a second loan of $1,000 to create a second mini-train so that he can expand his business to the other parts of the pier.

loans.use: To create a second mini-train for his kids'-ride entertainment business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Okeke

texts.en: N. sells food, drinks and groceries. She has been in this business for the past 10 years. N. is 38 years old and married, and has 3 children. N. lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan of N60,000 to purchase more food and drinks to sell. She thanks Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more food and drinks to sell

loans.name: Adegoke

texts.en: H. sells plates and knifes in her shop. She has been in this business for the past 10 years. H. lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. H. is 38 years old and married, and has 5 children. H. is very happy with the growth of her business. She is hoping for a loan of N70,000 to purchase more plates and knifes to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more plates and knifes to sell

loans.name: Sles

texts.en: Sles S. is 33 years old and the mother of three children who are single. One of them earns about $2 a day as a fish currying worker. Sles S. and her husband have used the river for fishing since their kids were very young. Recently, some of family’s fishing equipment has cracked, affecting their ability to fish effectively and frequently. Therefore, Sles S. has decided to seek a loan to buy new fishing equipment to replace the old broken ones.

loans.use: To buy fishing tools

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married mother of two children and four grandchildren. She lives Musang, a quarter in Bamenda, Cameroon. She wants to take a loan to expand her businesses and increase her profit margin so she can make some small improvements to her livelihood.

Because she is married to a polygamous husband, Mary has to provide for herself and her children. Also, Mary has a problem with her left leg which makes her unable to do some jobs that are available to other women in her community. Nonetheless, Mary is quite ready to fight through life to the last moment with every morsel of strength. This is why she became a GHAPE beneficiary in 2004. Mary has been supporting her family on her firewood and her groundnut businesses.

This is Mary’s fourth loan from GHAPE. She plans to buy firewood to split and transport, and to buy fresh groundnuts to boil and sell retail on a daily basis. Firewood is always needed in her community and groundnuts are used as food and dessert, so they always sells well. Thus, her business is sure to be successful after this loan.

With the profits from this loan, Mary plans to pay for her children's school fees and other educational needs and to pay medical bills. She hopes this loan will improve her and her family's standard of living. She prefers GHAPE loans because the conditions of the loans work well for her.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase firewood and fresh groundnuts

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa L. is from Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 54, married and has 4 adult children.  Rosa owns & operates a specialized retail store. Her main source of income comes from selling cosmetics in the local community. Rosa has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Rosa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosa repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC. Rosa is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 13th loan taken out by Rosa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy N. is 38 and is a single mother of one. She owns a clothing boutique that has been in operation for 5 years. Nancy learned about KADET from a friend and decided to join us. This will be her first loan to boost her business.

With the 80,000 Kenyan shilling loan Nancy plans to purchase more clothes, tailoring garments and sewing threads for her boutique. She also sells soft drinks and beverages in her shop to supplement her income. Her main customers are residents of Shanzu. In the future Nancy hopes to expand her boutique business and also to start making school uniforms.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing stock, and also to buy tailoring material and sewing thread.

loans.name: Deysi Marlene

texts.es: Deysi Marlene G. D. M. D. 30 años D. edad resiD. en el departamento D. La Libertad junto a su esposo que ejerce la profesión D. profesor en una universidad. Deysi posee una pequeña tienda en su vivienda donD. su inventario en productos D. consumo es muy escaso, pero Deysi para mejorar sus ingresos también se dedica a la venta D. ropa nueva y usada comercializándola en las zonas alrededor D. su domiclio. Deysi solicita un crédito ya que su negocio en la venta D. ropa ha ido creciendo y aumentando la demanda D. clientes es por eso que Deysi quiere surtir mas su inventario en ropa.
texts.en:
Deysi Marlene G. D. M. is 30 years old. She lives in the department of La Libertad with her husband, who is a university professor. Deysi has a small store in her home where her product inventory is very limited. However, Deysi also sells new and used clothing, marketing it in the areas around her home to improve her income. Deysi is asking for a loan because her clothing business has been growing and her customer demand has been increasing. This is why Deysi wants to stock up on her clothing inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 41 and the mother of 4 children who are in school. She lives in Runyenjes Embu. She is an entrepreneur who runs a boutique which she opened in 2002. She sells assorted items for both men and women, including shoes, clothes and handbags. She has requested a loan of Kshs 50,000 to purchase more stock for her boutique.

loans.use: Purchase more stock of clothes

loans.name: Elegbede

texts.en: C. sells foodstuffs and frozen food. She has been in this business for the past 15 years. C. lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 47 and is married with 4 children. She requests a loan of N80, 000 to purchase more foodstuffs and frozen foods, like chicken and turkey.  She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and frozen food to sell

loans.name: Prospérité Plus Group

texts.fr: Josée K. vend des beignets, des boissons sucrées et de l’eau pure dans un quartier très populaire situé au nord de Kinshasa. Elle a commencé son activité en 1993. Après une année de prospérité, son affaire a connu une baisse suite à son hospitalisation causée par la fièvre typhoïde. Après la mort de son mari en 1994, Josée décida de pérenniser cette micro entreprise qui a beaucoup supporté les études de ses trois enfants qui vont encore à l’école. De 1996 – 2002, elle ouvrit une pharmacie et une boutique dont elle fut victime d’escroquerie. Elle ferma la pharmacie pour renforcer la boutique avec les crédits obtenus de Hope à travers un des groupes dénommé « Prospérité Plus ». Le prêt qu’elle recevra le cycle prochain sera utilisé pour acheter des cartons des savons et autres articles pour renforcer le stock de la boutique en vue d’accroitre le revenu. Josée est âgée de 50 ans et a cinq enfants dont leurs âges varient de 15 à 31 ans. L’ainée d’entre eux est mariée et quatre autres vivent avec elle.
texts.en:
Josée K. sells doughnuts, sweet drinks and pure water in a very busy neighborhood to the north of Kinshasa. She started the business in 1993. After a very prosperous year, she was hospitalized with typhoid fever and business dropped off. Following the death of her husband in 1994, Josée decided to continue with her micro-business, which helped greatly towards the education of her three children, who are still at school. From 1996-2002 she operated a pharmacy and small store but fell victim to fraud. She closed the pharmacy to expand the store using loans she obtained from Hope via one of the “Prosperity Plus” groups. The loan she will receive during the next loan cycle will be used to buy boxes of soap and other items in order to boost the store’s inventory and thus increase her income. Josée is 50 years old and has five children aged between 15 and 31. The eldest is married and the four others live with her.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of soap and other items to boost store inventory and increase revenue

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Teresa Julia

texts.es: Teresa Julia R. D. A. D. 43 años D. edad vive en el departamento D. Ahuachapán con sus seis hijos D. las edades siguientes Max D. 20años D. edad, Ángel 13 años, José 11 años, Henry  8 años, David 5 años y la mas pequeñita Alicia D. 2 años D. edad. Teresa en una madre ejemplar al sacar adelante a todos sus hijos y dándoles educación escolar a cada uno D. ellos. Teresa se dedica a la producción D. chocolate el cual distribuye en varias tiendas D. la zona, Teresa hace su chocolate desD. la etapa D. moler hasta el empacamiento D. cada tablilla del mismo, este crédito Teresa lo solicita para comprar materia prima para su producto ya que pretenD.  expandir su distribución D. su chocolate a diferentes lugares del país.
texts.en:
Teresa Julia R. D. A., 43, lives in the Ahuachapán department with her six children. Max is 20, Ángel is 13, José is 11, Henry is 8, David is 5, and the smallest, Alicia, is 2. Teresa is an exemplary mother in helping all of her children and giving each one of them an education. Teresa makes chocolate and distributes it to various stores in the area. Teresa is involved in each stage of making chocolate from grinding the chocolate to packing each chocolate bar. The loan Teresa is asking for is to buy raw material for her product. She is trying to expand the distribution of her chocolate to different parts of the country.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material

loans.name: Elba Dolores

texts.es: Elba Dolores L. D. M. tiene 46 años D. edad resiD. en el departamento D. Ahuachapán junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos. Elba desarrolla todas las actividades labores dentro D. su misma casa ya que posee una tienda, venta D.  pupusas y venta D. tortillas, todos estos negocios son atendidos por ella, el crédito Elba lo solicita para compra D. materia prima D. pupusas y tortillas ya que no es suficiente la producción que hasta el momento saca, Elba ya obtenido créditos anteriormente los cuales ha cancelado, siendo muy puntual en sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Elba Dolores L. D. M. is 46. She lives in the Ahuachapán department with her husband and three children. Elba does all of her work in her own home. She has a store, she sells “pupusas” (flatbread stuffed with meat, cheese, or vegetables), and she sells tortillas. She runs all of these businesses. The loan that Elba is asking for is to buy raw materials to make pupusas and tortillas because her current production is insufficient. Elba has had previous loans, which she repaid with very punctual payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material

loans.name: Yohana Clarisa

texts.es: Yohana Clarisa P. G. de 30 años de edad vive en el departamento de Ahuachapán junto a su esposo y sus hijas. Yohana posee una tienda en su casa donde vende productos de consumo diario,  Yohana y su esposo se dividen los gastos de la familia ya que el también da un aporte económico por que posee dos moto taxis que circulan en la zona para transportar personas, El crédito Yohana lo solicita para invertir en su negocio que carece de varios productos por los cuales preguntan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Yohana Clarisa P. G. is 30. She lives in the Ahuachapán department with her husband and daughters. Yohana has a store in her house; she sells daily consumption products. Yohana and her husband split the family expenses. He also contributes economically because he has two moto taxis (motorcycles with tricycle-like attachments) that travel the area transporting people. The loan that Yohana is asking for is to invest in her business, which needs various products that her customers ask for.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Transito Emérita

texts.es: Transito Emérita C. D. B. vive en el departamento D. Ahuachapán junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos, Don Benjamín el esposo D. Transito trabaja como seguridad en una empresa privada y aporta a la familia 200$ mensuales; Transito posee una tienda en su casa donD. además D. vender productos D. consumo también comercializa ropa y zapatos, Transito solicita un crédito para invertir en su negocio y así aumentar su ganancias por medio D. que sus ventas crezcan con más variedad D. mercadería.
texts.en:
Transito Emérita C. D. B. lives in the district of Ahuachapan with her husband and three kids. Transito's husband, Don Benjamin, works as a security guard for a private sector firm and supports his family with $200 a month. Transito has a small shop in her house where, as well as selling groceries, she also sells clothes and shoes. Transito would like a loan to invest in her business and thereby increase her earnings as her sales will increase with a larger range of merchandise.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her business/Surtir su negocio

loans.name: Wendy Antonia

texts.es: Wendy Antonia M. O. de 23 años de edad reside el municipio de Apaneca en el departamento de Ahuachapán. Wendy vive en casa propia con sus hermanos y su hijo, ella posee una panadería en su casa donde elaboran todo tipo de pan dulce y luego lo distribuyen en las tiendas de la zona, Wendy solicita un crédito para mejoramiento de sus vivienda la cual ha sufrido daños después de poco mantenimiento a la infraestructura, al igual que el interior de la casa se encuentra descuidada el deseo de Wendy es lograr mejorar y su vivienda para brindarle a su familia una casa cálida, segura y en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Wendy Antonia M. O. is 23 years old and lives in the county of Apaneca in the district of Ahuachapan. Wendy lives in her own home with her siblings and her son. She has a bakery in her house where she makes all kinds of sweet breads which she then sells to shops in the area. Wendy would like a loan to improve her home as it has been damaged due to lack of maintenance to its structure. The house's interior is also in a poor condition and Wendy would like to improve her home to give her family a good-quality house that is secure and in a good condition.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements/Mejoras a su vivienda

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following its development MLF “MicroInvest” transformed into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. In October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” founded the Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”.
“Arvand” continues to carry out its mission, which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

K. Mamlakat first applied to  MicroInvest in 2006 but after its transformation into “Arvand” she started working closely with “Arvand”. Today she is one of the active clients who trusts our organization and intends to help continue our work. Mamlakat is married with 3 children; they live in Zafarabad.  She is a loving mother who does her best to ensure the good future of her children. For the last 6 years Mamlakat has traded dry fruits and rice. She works with the supplier so she can sell her goods at prices lower than in the bazaar. She has repeat and wholesale customers. 
Mamlakat is applying to KIVA for a loan of 2000 STJ, which she will use for importing rice from Iran. Iranian rice is  popular and having it to sell should help her business increase. 
Mamlakat thanks KIVA for the small business support and wishes all the best.

loans.use: importing rice from Iran

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel K. was born in 1931 in Runyenjes Embu. He is married and the father of five living children, all of whom finished school. He is also is a member of a CBD group in Runyenjes. Samuel joined KMET microfinance in 2006. He is proud of being a beneficiary of 2 previous KMET loans that he paid back.  Now he requests a loan of US 260 to help him further expand his retail shop.

loans.use: Buy stock for his store

loans.name: Akporuma

texts.en: G. is 38 and is married with 6 children. She sells foodstuffs and provisions and is very happy with the improvement of her business.  She requests a loan of N50, 000 to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Ezra

texts.en: Ezra is 56 and is a single mother of three children. She lives with her childen in Runyenjes. She is a committed member of the Runyenjes CBD group and her community. She is known for her humility and hard work. She has received and paid back three previous KMET loans which have helped her improve her community pharmacy. She currently requires a loan to enable her to purchase more drug supplies.

loans.use: Buy drugs for pharmacy

loans.name: Saidmahmad

texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following its development MLF “MicroInvest”  transformed into a Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. In October 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” founded the Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”.

“Arvand” continues to carry out its mission, which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

U. Saidmahmad first applied to MicroInvest in 2007 but after its transformation into “Arvand” he started working with “Arvand”. He wants to work  with “Arvand” until he can stabilize the existing business and to start helping other small entrepreneurs.  

Saidmahmad works in the livestock business. It is his family business and his wife and children help him. He has worked with livestock for 15 years;  he has a small flock. Saidmahmad also works in the collective farm. He has a good reputation as a hard-working man. Saidmahmad wants to build a new summer house for the cows and so he is applying to KIVA for a business development loan..

loans.use: build a new house for cows

loans.name: Renne Atieno

texts.en:
Renne Atieno Y. is 26, married and the mother of three children. Renee runs a pharmacy shop which she took over from her husband after he got employed. The business is situated in Miwani Juakali, which is in the outskirts of Kisumu City, Western Kenya. Most of her clients come from Juakali center and Miwani Sugar factory and its environs.

Renne got introduced to KADET by a neighbor who was already a member. She joined and took her first loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings. She plans to diversify her business with this loan. She therefore intends to expand her other business of selling window curtains. Her future hope is to expand her businesses and become a wholesaler.


About KADET
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To diversify her current  business by combining it with another one selling window curtains.

loans.name: Nanga

texts.en:
Nanga was born on the 1971 and is married to a very supportive man. They are blessed with five children, four who are younger than fifteen. She lives in a four room house the Nstualam quarter of Bamenda, Cameroon. Before becoming a member, Nanga underwent surgical operations twice during child birth. She joined GHAPE in 2007 and has since benefited enormously through their help. With her previous loans she succeeded in providing her community with table birds for food and manure for farming.

With the third loan, she plans to buy a motorbike. Her son will be riding the motorbike. She will reinvest part of the profit into her business for expansion. She will also use part for food, clothes, school fees, and hospital bills.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike and fuel

loans.name: Boinazar

texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following its development MLF “MicroInvest” transformed into a Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. In October 2008 MLF “MicroInvest”, together with LLC “Frontiers”, founded the Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”. “Arvand” continues to carry out its mission, which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

A. Boinazar was born in 1964 in the Zafarabad region of Tajikistan. He is married and has 4 children. He has had his livestock business for 20 years; it is the family business. Boinazar dreams of having excellent livestock that he will give to his only son. Today he has one cow and 6 rams. He wants to buy a pedigreed bull and applies to KIVA for a loan of 1500 STJ. 
Boinazar thanks KIVA for its support and small business development all over the world.

loans.use: to purchase a pedigreed bull

loans.name: Arifa

texts.en:
Arifa H. is 57, married, and has five children. She started her own business nine years ago because her husband at that time was unemployed. Arifa sells different kinds of food in the local market, such as candies, cookies, butter, yoghurt, tea and pastries. The generated income allows Arifa to support her family. Arifa dreams that all of her children will achieve a higher education.

Today, Arifa requests 2000 USD to purchase more food products to enlarge her range of goods. She is planning to spend the income on the well-being of her family as well as for educating her children.

loans.use: purchase more food products

loans.name: Hafiz

texts.en: Hafiz M. is 43,  married and has 3 children. He started his own business in 1996 because his salary as an engineer wasn’t enough for the family expenses. Hafiz, together with the help of his wife, sells food such as butter, tea, cookies, and pastries, in the local market. The generated income allows Hafiz to support his family. He dreams of educating all of his children with a higher education. Today, he is requesting a loan of 2000 USD that he will use to expand the range of goods he sells. The income he will receive will be spent on the well-being of his family, as well as for his children's education.

loans.use: expand the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Tofiq

texts.en: Tofiq M. has always been a hard-working man. He made sure from a young age that his family never went without their daily bread. He is married with four sons. Tofiq has a store where he sells different kinds of goods, such as cosmetics and home products. Thanks to his perseverance and dedication, Tofiq began his enterprise 8 years ago, with a starting capital of 100 USD. His salary as a accountant wasn’t enough to cover basic needs of his family. Since then he has expanded his business and it has become a family affair, with his whole family helping. Tofiq needs to buy more goods to increase the range of his inventory, so he is requesting a loan of 2000 USD. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push to achieve his goals and become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: purchase more home products

loans.name: Bahor

texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following its development MLF “MicroInvest”  transformed into a Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. In October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest”, together with LLC “Frontiers”, founded the Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”.
“Arvand” continues to carry out its mission, which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.
A. Bahor first applied to MicroInvest in 2005, when she was in a difficult situation. Thanks to her previous loans she could open and strengthen her livestock and milk processing business. She has a good herd. Bahor is married with 4 daughters who help her. She also works as a cook in the local pub. The processed milk she sells into the collective farms and in the local bazaar. Working with “Arvand” , Bahor is applying to KIVA for a loan of 2600 STJ, which she will use to buy specialized milk control equipment.

loans.use: to purchase specialized milk control equipment

loans.name: İslam

texts.en: İslam M. is a married father of two sons. His family lives in Agsu city where İslam runs a small grocery store downtown. İslam's store is well known in the neighborhood as he serves his customers well and works late hours, which is very convenient for many customers who work late and go shopping after they are done with work. İslam has been in business for 9 years. Currently he is seeking a loan of 2000 USD to purchase more inventory, so he can increase the variety of goods he offers. İslam had some struggles when his business was growing and becoming self-sustainable, but he handled all those challenges pretty well and is looking toward the future with much enthusiasm and optimism.

loans.use: purchase more inventory to increase the variety of goods

loans.name: Ismayil

texts.en: Ismayil A. is 49  and is married with 2 children. Ismayil has his own grocery store and sells different kinds of products, such as macaroni, cookies, soft drinks, juices, tea, detergents and many other things. He started this business 13 years ago with a small inventory, but now is very successful. Today Ismayil is requesting a loan of 2000 USD. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: purchase more food products

loans.name: Akinsade

texts.en: J. sells garri (roast cassava grain) in bags and she also grinds pepper, and sells beans and tomatoes. She has been in this business for the past 10 years. J. is 52 years old, which she thinks is old, but she is very determined to pull her family out of poverty and to expand her business. She has 5 children and she requests a loan of N70, 000 to purchase more garri to sell. She thanks Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more garri in bags to sell

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en: Rovshan

loans.use: purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Nazim

texts.en:
Nazim S. is 49, married and the father of 2 children. Nazim owns a grocery store and provides for his family with the revenue generated from the store.  He requests a loan of US 2000 to increase the stock of foodstuffs in his grocery store. 

Nazim is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. One of his dreams is that his children progress by means of their studies, for which he is doing his best. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors for his small business.

loans.use: increase the stock of foodstuffs

loans.name: Savur

texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following its development, MLF “MicroInvest” transformed into a Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. In October 2008, MLF “MicroInvest,” together with LLC “Frontiers,” founded a Limited Liability Company, Microloan Deposit-taking Organization called “Arvand.”

“Arvand” continues to carry out its mission, which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

M. Savur lives in the Zafarabad region of Tajikistan. He is married and has three daughters and a son. One of his daughters works in Arvand as the credit expert. He works in local bazaar as a clothing trader. He first applied to MicroInvest for a business-support loan in 2005 and since that time, he has been a repeat client of our loan program. After the MicroInvest transformation, Savur works with Arvand and he is glad for its co-operation.

Savur applies to Kiva for a business-development loan of 4100 STJ for 8 months to import new seasonal goods straight from suppliers to increase the business turnover.

Savur thanks Kiva for its support and small business development assistance.

loans.use: Importing new seasonal goods straight from suppliers

loans.name: Leyla

texts.en: Leyla A. has been selling a big variety of cosmetic and home products in her store for the past eight years. She is married and has two adorable daughters. A true entrepreneur, she studies the market to determine client needs and preferences. Industrious and enterprising, Leyla is focused on expanding her business. Leyla is currently seeking a loan for 2000 USD. She plans to use the loan to increase her assortment of cosmetics and expand her business. With the increased sales and profits, Leyla hopes to expand her grocery and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: Increase her assortment of cosmetics

loans.name: Puits De Jacob Plus Group

texts.fr: Célestin S. est vice-président d’un des groupes de Hope RDC dénommé « Puits de Jacob Plus » depuis 2008. Il gère sa propre boutique ainsi qu’une cabine téléphonique qu’il a commencées en 2002 avec un capital initial de $100. Sa clientèle est constituée en grande partie par des étudiants car, son activité se situe au campus universitaire. Depuis 2008, Célestin a reçu plusieurs prêts qui ont renforcé et stabilisé son affaire et qu’il a remboursé totalement à temps. Le crédit qu’il recevra ce cycle, lui permettra d’acheter du lait, du sucre, des savons, des cartes prépayées et d’autres articles divers à revendre dans le but d’augmenter le bénéfice. Après ses études universitaires en Médecine cette année, Célestin a une ambition d’ouvrir un Centre Médical. Il est célibataire âgé de 31 ans. Actuellement, son affaire lui génère un bénéfice de $150 par semaine. Son groupe a eu le privilège d’être visité par John qui est Kiva Fellow venu des USA.
texts.en:
Célestin S. has been vice president of one of the Hope RDC groups called “Puits de Jacob Plus” since 2008. He owns and runs a small store and telephone booth, which he started in 2002 with an initial capital of $100. His clientele consists mainly of students, since his business is located on the university campus. Since 2008 Céléstin has received several loans which have strengthened and stabilized his business and which he repaid in full and on time. The loan he will receive in this loan cycle will enable him to buy milk, sugar, soap, prepaid phone cards and various other items which he will sell in order to increase profits. After his university medical studies this year, Célestin aims to open a medical center. He is single and 31 years old. His business currently provides him with a weekly profit of $150. His group was privileged to receive a visit from John, a Kiva Fellow from the US.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy milk, soap, tinned food, prepaid phone cards and miscellaneous items to resell at a profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Qabil

texts.en:
Qabil A. is 42 years old. He is married with four daughters. Qabil sells foodstuffs like macaroni, wheat, buckwheat, cottonseed oil and other products. When Qabil started the business in 1993, it was only retail sales. Gradually expanding the business, he purchased the goods as a wholesaler and distributed them among the stores. The business became successful and stable.

Currently Qabil requests a 2,000 US loan. The loan will be used for purchasing foodstuffs to increase the range of goods for sale. Qabil thanks all who support him and promises to pay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchase more foodstuffs

loans.name: Nabi

texts.en: Nabi A. is 47 years old and married, and has four children. Nabi sells confections and other food in the market. He has been in this business for ten years. His business generates the main income for Nabi’s family. Nabi is very popular in the market because he sell fresh and tasty pastry and he tries to maintain a wide range of goods. Thus, today Nabi is requesting a loan of $2000 USD loan to purchase more food products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more food products
